reviews.review: Lovely Park. Yet another well maintained, clean park for everyone to enjoyed in the middle of a busy city. It's definitely worth walking through the park to get away from the busy traffic and chaos.

It's like Hyde Park, just smaller. I used to work in the vicinity and come here often. Hong Kong used to be British so the town-planning is similar - there must be a park within the central business district for people to breathe and this is it. The Hong Kong equivalent of the Hyde Park in London or the Central Park in Manhattan - it's just a lot smaller. It serves the same purpose though. When you are tired of all the paper work in the office, or of the shopping mall in Pacific Place nearby, come and breathe in the fresh air. Look at the flowers. Stare at the lake. This park keeps all of us sane.
Beauty in the Heart of the City.. Really good place to just relax and have a walk around and to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

An oasis in the middle of busy Hong Kong. HK park is right next door to many hotels, the superb Pacific Place shopping mall and bang in the middle of Centra's business district. I have walked through it many times and also eaten at the restaurant in the middle (great Thai green curry). Also have a lovely picture of my (then) 2 year old daughter walking through it that I cherish.
Green oasis. This park, close to Central, is a wonderful green space in the noisy city. It has lots of shade, beautiful plants, an aviary, pond and beautiful fountains. A great place to rest!

Urban Oasis on a hot and humid day. We had a great time in the Park as it was one of our side trips if we had time. Glad we did! The fish pond and aviary are little gems in the middle of a very crowded city. It's location near the main streets and shopping was a plus and made it an easy get away. Our kids loved the turtles (Can't really explain why, but they did). A pleasant walk and activity for an hour.

lovely. Such a lovely place in the middle of that busy, noisy HK. Always cross it with my friends or even when I'm alone. Great for a nice walk, or in your lunch time you can just sit on a bench and enjoy your lunch there. Love this cute park!

Beautiful urban park in the midst of Central's high rises.. This beautiful, well-maintained park is a cool oasis in the midst of Hong Kong's urban high rises. it appears larger than it is due to the meandering paths (it's easy to get lost).The aviary is one of the nicest and largest we've visited. Well worth the visit.
A little oasis in HK. It was a hot day so we walked slowly around. Very well maintained, glass houses, cafe, aviary - quite a lot to do, very peaceful.

Gorgeous!. Beautifully landscaped, Hong Kong park has a tea house (who do lovelly teas and delicious dim sum style snacks), an indoor garden and a huge avairy... it is isnt a huge park but it is small and well formed. Definitely worth a visit

Peace and close to central HK. Found this on my early walk after reading about it on trip advisor.It is a lovely park, I believe newer than Victoria park, different in that it's closer to the business buildings in central Hong Kong.I loved the use of water and the bridges that are in part decorative.A restful 15 minutes watching people go about this business. Again a great use of space which is much needed in busy HK

A very pleasant 15 minute sojourn in Central Hong Kong. It might be best known as a 5 minute walk between Admiralty and Citibank Plaza in Central, but it is also a lovely walk around the fish pond, aviary and gardens, especially suitable for tourists.

Bad ripoff. While they have tried to create something similar to Central Park in New York, it's not even close! It's a small patch of green with loads of fountains, turtles, fish and streams - can step into the park for a break.

Hidden Gem!. Would never have found this without our guide (see my other reviews and book Mandy for a half day!!!) Incredible landscaping with contrasting HK skyscraper backgrounds make for the best photos. A great walk and takes about an hour. Well worth the time.

Beautiful and well looked after city park. Peace in the centre of a bustling city. Beautiful plants, water, fish, terrapins, fountains, cafes, an aviary (free to enter) and plant exhibition space (also free). It is also very close to the tram up to the peak, so it is a great add-on experience if you are in the area.
another nice place to visit. Easy to get to and well designed water garden, popular wedding venue. Being at Central means that it is somewhere nice to visit when your Hong Kong stay is only short.

Slightly underwhelming. Visited this as it was right next to the peak tram. Spent an hour there but for the most part could have been in any park, anywhere. Surprised it was so high up on the list of must visit places
great for people watching. had a lovely afternoon here people watching - we grabbed some sweets from a local bakery and sat in teh park and relaxed...
An oasis in the city. A quiet oasis out of the hustle and bustle. It has a children's play area, short walks and café as well as a beautiful walk through aviary. Aviary closes at 5pm.

Excellent . Far better than we expected. We spent a couple of hours wandering around including visiting the conservatory and aviary.It's an oasis of calm and greenery, very relaxing.Best way to visit is by tram, bus or MTR to the 'mtr admiralty' stop. Then cross the road by the footbridge into the Pacific Place shopping centre (where you can make use of the amazing toilet facilities) before heading up the escalators straight into the park.

Decent park but nothing special. A decent enough park but doesnt wow like many other gardens in asia. The skyline of hong kong is fantastic and was looking forward to seeing beautiful gardens as a retreat from the urban jungle. But this is slightly underwhelming if not still quite pretty.

Gorgeous gorgeous gorgeous . Had a lovely few hours walk here and through the averies. Lovely and peaceful. Well kept and popular with very clean toilets and a few drinkable water fountains. Thete are a couple of man made ponds and water features and a kids playground. Watch for the snakes in October.
Pleasant visit. This park can take some effort to get to as it quite hilly. Once inside the ponds, waterfalls, gardens, tea house and aviary are all worth the effort.

Great walk. Had a great surprise in visiting the Hong Kong park. Basically it was tucked away near the hotel and upon walking by decided to duck in. The waterfall and walkway was awesome and the elevation change is great.

Garden within the city centre. Hong Kong Park is at the Central District, and it takes only about 10-15 minutes walk from Chater Garden, Cheung Kong Centre, HSBC nearby up the hill. Entry is free. There are many trees and different sceneries to look at inside, including fish and tortoises in the pond, bird garden, and artificial waterfall. Wonderful to have a relaxed stroll during cool weather.

A hidden oasis in the city. I suppose most tourists come to Hong Kong for food, shopping and theme parks so this will not be high on their list of places to visit. My husband and I enjoyed ourselves tremendously and in fact spent longer time than we had planned here. There were many things to see - the excellent aviary with a tree canopy walkway, the pond with turtles and fish, the informative Flagstaff house museum of tea and the conservatory which houses lovely orchids and other plants. We had a good lunch in a Thai/fusion restaurant inside the park itself. It was indeed a lovely day spent in a hidden oasis among the concrete jungle.
HK park. Good place to stay and get relaxing momentalso for a pleasant walkWell finished and suggestive park

Lovely respite from the bustle of the city. Not exactly a park in the sense we have in the UK but lots of trees, a few ponds and a quiet place close to the city. There is also the aviary with many colourful birds. I don't really like animals kept in a closed area but they seem to have adapted and are used to humans taking their picture - some even appear to pose! Nice place to spend an hour.

Great Aviary! . This park has a strange feel to it, no open spaces as such. Nice terrapin pond and the Aviary is massive and you can get up close with some really interesting birds! Worth a visit if passing, we went after visiting Victoria Peak as its right at the bottom near the tram stop.

Peaceful scenery with great aviary. This park is a lovely peaceful place to sit and walk to get away from the bustle of the streets.There's also an aviary (free to enter) which you can walk through with many birds of different types. They have staff wandering round feeding the birds which encourages the birds to come over and makes for some great photos.Highly recommended as a free activity to do in Hong Kong.
Go there and relax. Amazing park in the city. I like seeing the fish moving inside the small oasis. I went during the night and I did not see any birds.

A small oasis in a busy and fast paced city. Surrounded by high rise buildings, this park is well suited for a relaxing stroll. The setting was peaceful with water fountains, pond, birds, fish, and green vegetation. It is worth a visit especially in cooler weather.We reached the park by getting off the Admiraty station and walked towards the HK Shangrila hotel. There is an exterior escalator by the hotel that takes you to the park entrance.

Calm place , right in Next to peak tram entrance... The HK park is easily accessible by buses and metro, very close to peak tram entrance.. the walk through it is pleasant , quite and away from the hustle bustle of the City, lots of birds and trees to see.. A good place to take a break.. open to public,.. easily accessible to the specially abled..

Lovely Walk and great birds. It took me several visits to Hong Kong to take the time to walk through this park. I loved it. The plantings are lovely and there are places to sit.And there's an aviary with many kinds of birds, most fairly tame. Great photo ops.

Excellent spot worth a visit. The bird aviary in Hong Kong park is well worth visiting. The entrance is at the top and the signage confusing but it was great to wander through and see all the many birds from all over the world.

Young kids will love the turtles and fish in the pond!. Took my daughter to HK park last Sunday while we were on a short stay in HK. I love this park. It is really a nice tranquil place in the middle of Central surrounded by skyscrapers. My daughter loved the pond because there are a ton of turtles and fish there! Recommend that if you have young kids and are in the area, they will definitely have fun running around the pond looking for the most and biggest turtles. A good way to spend an hour or so outside.

Great way to start the morning. Go before breakfast !!. Less than 1 km walk from a lot of hotels. Enjoyed the walk as a tranquil escape.Loved the bird aviary (refer photos). That was great.One of the 'To Do' things in Hong Kong - we go before breakfast and before it gets too hot. Also close / next to the Botanic Gardens - do one on one day, and the other the next morning...

Wow! Very cool public park. Very cool public park! Highlights were the viewing tower (at the edge of the SARS memorial plaza) with views of the Central skyline and water beyond, and the walk-through aviary - the walkways are high off the ground so you're at bird level. Awesome & free!
Oasis in metropolis. Lovely area to walk around, different parts to it, amazing seeing the skyscrapers when you are in this green oasis

A beautiful place to visit. If you go to Hong Kong it's well worth taking time out from shopping and sightseeing to have a walk around the gardens. You forget you're in the middle of a very busy city. The water features and the conservatory are amazing. A great way to spend half a day.
clean and beautiful i the city. we loved the waterfall, th etea museum and the veggie tea house - we even got a tea making class - cuold have spent all day there

Green among the Concrete. This is a beautiful park nestled inside towering skyscrapers! It's easily accessed by MTR and a short walk through a gorgeous high end mall, Pacific Place. The Flagstaff Tea Museum is located inside the park. The visual contrast of the old house (museum) and the towering skyscrapers is interesting. The aviary is also located in the park and is definitely worth the hike up the hill to enter the open air sanctuary.
WATER DISPLAY. Lovely gardensIn all the frenetic madness that can engulf Hong Kong this is a tranquil restThe water displays are magnificent
Green in the middle of the hustle bustle. A refreshing oasis of green in the middle of city centre. The aviary is a must if you like birds and like tropical plants.
a liitle bit of greenery amongst the concrete jungle. Lovely to have space as it is such a rare commodity especially in these parts. Aviary is quite interesting & it's FREE

Oasis of calm in a bustling city. A great place to escape the crowds and chill out on a hot and humid day. A lake brimming with Koi Carp and terrapins and a walk-through aviary with exotic birds add interest, particularly for youngsters.

Overhyped. We went through the hassle of getting here only to be disappointed by the quality of the place, this is not to say that is terrible but its just not worth making it a destination, only get there if you are nearby! There is a tiny history of tea museum there which was interesting, other than that there isn't much to do/see that is really fascinating.

Tranquility in the middle of the City. Easily accessed from Pacific Place at one end, and the Peak Tram station at the other, with other access points throughout, this is lovely, large well maintained park. There's a lake with fish and turtles, aviary, tai chi garden with a 30m viewing tower that not many people seem to know about, and plenty of benches set around the fountains, water features and pathways . Great. To get away from the noise and hustle of the City.
Great park in Central HK!. This is a nice smallish park in Central. Its fun and has some nice gold fish. There's also a small waterfall. Plan on spending maybe one hour at most.

Worth a visit. We stumbled on this gem of a city park purely by accident while searching for the tram to take us to Victoria Peak. It provided a nice respite from the hike up from Admiralty MTR station. There was a nice water feature and a security guard gave us directions to the tram. This park is definitely worth visiting.
Nice for kids. Very nice place in Hong Kong to take a rest and relax. If you need to take some rest after a long walk the Hong Kong Park is the right place to do it.
Relax and chinese yoga. Well, it is a park. Huge park with people everywhere! I was impressed that there was people in every single corner. Many old people doing yoga and dancing, very cute to see!

Worth a visit. Spent about two hours in the park. Pleasant green space surrounded by tall buildings as you would expect.
Clean and some good photo opportunities.
Worth a visit.
Central park. Great park adjacent to the Conrad and Island Shangri la. The tea museum is there and some sculptures. Nice greenery in the center of the city

Free breath of fresh air in the middle of the City. HK Park is a really pleasant oasis of greenery in the middle of the bustle of the City, and a great place to unwind or potter. There is a decent but not spectacular cafe with open air seating (a rarity) a Lake and Aviary; there are seats. It is a handy route through if you are staying in Pacific Place to walk in to Central. It is free!It is well kept, and paved walkways are on easy gradients if steps are too forbidding in the heat.

A Green Oasis. The park is an oasis of green in the middle of skyscrapers. There are aviaries with the birds, lily ponds, fountains or you can visit a conservatory - a building full of flowers. Of course, there are more interesting places, but I didn't visit them all.It is a nice place for a walk.

Serenity within the chaos of Hong Kong. Simply put, this is a beautiful park. It is, by far, the prettiest of the many parks I have visited in the whole of China*, and also one of the very few that are free of charge. There are greenhouses, flower exhibistions, gorgeous little streams, waterfalls and ponds filled with fishes and turtles, all accompanied with the genlte buzzing of dragonflies. There are a few small museums with excellent English descriptions. The aviary holds beautiful birds, in what appears to be very good living conditions. All in all, this is a beautiful park that breaks the chaos of the crowded city. The contrast of verdant trees against the monolithic skyscrapers is especially stunning. *Hong Kong isn't actually a part of China, but well, you know what I mean.
Fantastic Park. Small park with fantastic view for photographing and relax.Fish pond is attractive and well designed.Many of chairs to relax with view.Greenhouse with plant labels.Water falls.
Park in the midst of CBD area. Free of charge entry. There are ponds and waterfall. Terrapins, fishes among others that i seen. Interesting. Accessible via central mtr.

Perfect for a wedding!. My wife and I were married in the park in November of 2015. We wanted something informal but special and memorable. After thinking through the options of something on the harbor, something on the beach, something on a rooftop...we went with Hong Kong Park. It was a beautiful venue and made for some wonderful pictures!

Lovely Park in Central Hong Kong. This is a lovely place to escape the busy Hong Kong. It rarely feels packed and is wonderfully shaded from the sun. There are plenty of places to bring food and water and there are seats to sit and take in the scenery. There are a number of hidden gems inside including the aviary which has a wonderful collection of birds which are easy to approach - great for kids or photographers. It is easy to access the park from a number of directions including escalators from Admiralty. The only small downside is that much of the park is on a hillside so there are some stairs and slopes if you want to walk all around.

Lush Green park in midst of the city.... We visited Hong Kong park during the evening. The park had lush greenery with ponds contains turtles, fishes and lilies. It also had a waterfall and was well maintained. Good for spending some relaxing time.

Beautiful park, serene with lots of different types of gardens. This park is an absolute oasis in Hong Kong. Each time we thought we had seen something beautiful we went to another section of the park and were mesmerised again. Worth a visit, but leave some time to do this. An hour was not enough.

Tranquility of the city. . If you want to escape the mad hussle and bustle of the city, then visit this park. You still get awesome views of the skyline but from a unique peaceful perspective. The park is in excellent condition and a great area to just take a stroll through, to read a book or just to take in the beauty of Hong Kong skyscrapers from below.
Nice park in central HK. Nice park in the central area of HK. Not a destination in its won right but if you are in the area it is nice to squeeze in and escape the heat a bit

Excellent variety of things to see in park. Fantastic park with a surprising amount of things to see. Went with 9 year old and had an enjoyable time (she said to put in the review "very fun!") Spent a couple of hours there.There is an umbrella-shaped fountain that you can go under for cute photo op, can get a little wet. Aviary has many varieties of birds to see, also a smaller caged bird section. A must see. Stroll through park has large pond with turtles, fish, and other water plants. There's a man-made waterfall that you can walk behind to the conservatory with different kinda of plants. Beautifully curated. A few other sites like a small art exhibit, tea house (has a restaurant inside).There's a playground area also, though more suitable for younger aged kids. To get there from the Admiralty MTR station, we asked the locals to direct us. Ended up going up a set of escalators which ran through a mall.

Beautiful park. Lovely oasis amongst the skyscrapers of Hong Kong. Fountains and ponds full of koi carp and terrapins. Clean facilities and free admission. Tea museum is also lovely to wander around (air conditioned). Good to sit and people watch.

Visit on a weekend. this place really comes alive on a weekend and it's great for people watching, we joined the locals sitting in the park and taking photos of the wildlife. The park itself was extremely peaceful.
Unexpected. Beautiful park in the middle of the city. Its not central park, even people tell you it is. really enjoyed the bird watching area.
Nice for a morning / evening walk. A calm oasis worth a morning or evening walk with flowers and free roaming parrots.If you are not there for the walk and calm, visit when the aviariium is open.
Disappointing day in the park. For some reason I expected a whole lot more of the park itself and the aviary (about 3-4 cages). I believe the aviary should be expanded more.

Quiet oasis . Park gives an opportunity to cool down a bit, take a breath from busy Hong Kong island around. Few places to sit down in a shade, refill water bottles, look at nice greenery, see some birds at aviary or have food or tea at teahouse. Definitely worth visiting as a break from busy attractions around (especially peak tram).

Nice garden and aviary. I really liked the garden especially the bird aviary located in the park where you can spot different kinds of birds, the chirping of the birds transports you to a different world all together.
Leisure Walking-Shopping. Highly recommended for travellers and shoppers alike - Place is very clean and convenient. Can be reached via public transport - start early afternoon till night.

Great hideaway from HK bustle. A real special place in the middle of Hongkong. worth going to the tea house there and the bird houses very well done. Good to have a wander there if you have time. There is a restaurant in the middle but quality is average. Outside seating area is fine to have a drink during the day or after work. The whole area connects up across into a small zoo area , so worth a look.

Pretty. Interesting to watch the timed wedding shoots stopping at each marked 'spot' with their photographer in succession - so busy they have time slots! Nice park with some lovely little seasonal etc displays too, tea museum interesting experience.
A little oasis. I love it here... amidst the hustle and bustle of HK, this is a great place to have a moment to rejuvenate.Beautifully cared for and so much thought has gone into these gardens.

A little oasis. Situated within Hong Kong this park is a quiet oasis. The walkways lead you around ponds with Terrapins and koi, with fantastic flora and forna. Further up is an aviary where you can get some fantastic pictures of the birds. It is very well maintained and cleaned. Would recommend it as a trip away from the hustle and bustle.

More nature trail than park. After an exhausting day in the centre of Hong Kong, we were looking forward to a rest sitting in the shaded area of a park with a drink. Unfortunately, Hong Kong Park is not a "park" in the usual sense of a city centre park, but more a nature trail built into the side of the hill going up and down slopes and stairs.I was looking forward to the aviary, but it closes at 17:00 along with the conservation exhibit, so get there early if you want to experience those. The nature walk is rather nice, and the Tai Chi garden is peaceful. There's also an Olympic arena from last decade to explore, and a waterfall going down into an artificial lake beside the fountain plaza. I would not say that the park is an essential sight of Hong Kong, and it is not as peaceful as people seem to make it out to be. Nevertheless, it is nice for a small trip if you are in the area.

Nice gardens. If you are into plants and flowers this is a nice relief in Hong Kong. It has water falls, fish, turtles and a huge display of plants and flowers. Very relaxing stroll and has a conservatory with humid and tropical sections with all plants named. A plant lovers paradise. Do it.
amazing. I was traveling Hong Kong Park it very beautiful and have a lot high building ,the water very clear .I very love this place relaxing .

A quiet escape amid the concrete jungle!. This is a lovely public park located in Admiralty connecting Citibank/ICBC towers, Pacific Place as well as the entrance to Cotton Tree Drive near the Peak Tram. There is an aviary, conservatory and lots of goldfish as well as terrapins in the water. Highly recommend L16 for a quick bite or a cheeky coffee on your little wander around the park. It's fairly hilly in parts so pace yourself and make sure you check out the opening times of the exhibits/aviary before heading over (I believe they close around 5). There is a fountain near the Pacific Place entrance which you can walk into - I often see people taking an I'm-dry-but-totally-just-walked-through-water-HOW?! photo here! Some people use the park for general fitness, bird-watch or to practice Tai Chi... it's a fab place to just sit and people watch too!
Everything to delight. Exquisitely planned and cared for. Lots to see especially the tea pot museum in a colonial building. The desert plant section was amazing.

A little oasis. This is a great green space in the midst of the city.There are a variety of spaces here, from the Olympic Park which is a quiet space to take a break to an atrium and a botanical garden, plus a cafe space and lots of benches to sit and chill out. The other handy thing is the provision of lots of clean well maintained public lavatories.A great place to take a break and get away from the hustle of the city

Nice place to stroll!. We enjoyed walking through the park - it is a nice area to get away from the traffic and buildings. The plantings, ponds and fountains create a relaxing atmosphere in the heart of Hong Kong!

Small but pretty and well worth a visit. We have visited previously and never disappointed. Tucked away near shops that hide the pleasant park that gets you away from the hustle and bustle. Take time out, have a cool drink and relax.
Birdwatching!. It's nice to take a walk in this park and there are several different things discover. Birdwatch, Teamusuem and the Tai-Chi area.

worth 2-3 hours. This is probably the best park to visit in Hong Kong, better than Victoria Park or Kowloon Park. It also has its own botanical gardens, in addition to many sites and exhibits within the park. They also have vendors selling various artwork and souvenirs.
Feel Free. I really enjoy to see the flowes and listen to the tweeting of the lovely birds. Especislly the birds can fly freely in the garden can make me happy the whole day.
Small, but nice. Thought it would be bigger. Luckely not as crowded as expected. Some beautifull plants and animals can be found here. Entrance is near Admiralty MTR station.

A Quiet space in the central district. Hong Kongs central business district is quite busy and hectic. However, right off Queens Rd. Hong Kong Park is a quiet , relaxing place in the busy city. It's small, but sitting back the lake, walking through the gardens, provides a nice break from the crowds.I used to work nearby, and whenever I needed a quiet place to read, or think, HK Park was the place.

Adventures around!!!. I love hangout of this kinda one of an amazing tourist spots here in HK...plants,animals and views blended all together in this mesmerizing park and such a fabulous attraction for all...

good getaway. nice place to unwind and relax. we went with kids and they were excited to see so many turtles in the lake. also saw a lot of different butterflies in the park. the fountain near the entrance of the park opposite the shangri la is also a good attraction

Oasis in the City. This is a great way to get away from the hustle of the city. It's a beautifully landscaped park, with gorgeous water features. Make sure you check out the Tai Chi area, as there is usually a group going and you can join in. After the hectic pace of the Admiralty district, this is a great place to relax and even have an impromptu picnic.

Excellent Escape. A small but excellent little park set right at the heart of HK Island's financial centre. The diverse array of flora and fauna is outstanding; I particularly enjoyed seeing the Terrapins by the lake. Don't miss the Avery and Observation Tower also. Easily accessible on foot from Admiralty MTR.

Lovely place to visit. Much to my surprise Hong Kong is filled with parks, many very small that don't rate on some maps.This is a lovely park and the must see point is the Aviary. This is a walk in Aviary and the birds inside are accustomed to humans so they are happy to site just a meter or two from you.You won't have any trouble getting some great photos.
Beautiful little sanctuary in the middle of the city. Love taking strolls in HK Park, the waterfall is super cute. You can find probably hundreds of turtles and fish here!

With a backdrop of gleaming skyscrapers Hong Kong Park sits in the heart of the bustling, noisy, Central commercial Dist. Bordered by Cotton Tree Drive and Kennedy Road. Set aside a couple of hours to absorb the elegant Flagstaff House, the Conservatory, and the tropical greenery of the Edwarde Youde Aviary.(free entry)Built in 1846 Flagstaff house, (Greek Revival style), is the oldest example of Western style architecture in Hong Kong, and sits elegantly in a pleasant garden setting. It is now the Museum of Tea Ware which showcases various tea wares from the Tang Dynasty until more modern teapots and times; promoting pottery and porcelain wares, part of the tradition of Chinese tea Culture. Teapots range from the exquisite to the amusing; traditional teapots through to quirky modern imaginative creations. Open 10:00 to 18:00 closed Tuesdays.Just inside the main Admiralty entrance is the Fountain Plaza which includes a large mushroom shaped water feature, on a hot day walk under the overhanging water feature, your feet may get a little damp though you remain dry under the umbrella shaped feature.From the large artificial lake walk over the arched bridge, and behind the waterfall to get to the Forsgate Conservatory. From this location photographers can get fabulous images of some of the gleaming high-rise buildings including IFC2 rising from behind the foreground of colourful shrubbery. The impressive Conservatory is the largest in S.E. Asia and features exotic flowers, trees, and plants in various climate controlled pavilions. Dozens of prickly Cacti from dry regions, and lush ferns and pathways cooled by a trickling stream.The 3,000 square metre walk-through Edward Youde Aviary is built over a natural valley on the N.E. slope of Victoria Peak. Named after a Governor of Hong Kong during British rule, the aviary comprises bird species indigenous of S.E. Asia, New Guinea, and Indonesia. The highest point of the aviary is 46.5 metres. Broad wooden elevated walkways wind under a canopy of natural vegetation. A small stream provides water and cooling to the site. The aviary is seldom crowded.

Retreat with amazing wildlife and musea. This park is a lovely place to go for an afternoon of relaxation after the hustle of Hong Kong. The aviary is definitely fantastic (and free). The museum of tea ware is lovely. Don't forget anti-mosquito spray.

i love this park. in the middle of town a great get away from urban life, green trees a lake a waterfall a bisrds section and plat section, nice walk and a great small vegetarian dim sum tea house in the park
Great bird watching opportunity in CBD. Giant walk through aviary (free) with plenty of birds in a very natural setting. Restrooms in the park are absolutely spotless - staff are to be commended.

Accidental Gem. As we discovered Hong Kong park was right behind our Hotel the Conrad at Admiralty. We did not realise that a short walk through the park got us to the peak train. The park like a most other things in Hong Kong is beautifully maintained. The water feature the ponds full of fish and turtles. There is plenty of bird life as well. The gardens are stunning and all the various shrubs flowers and trees have signs indicating what they are which is really useful if they suddenly give you great ideas for you home gardens. Amazing to find something so peaceful and tranquil in and area that within a small walk is a busy and bustling city
Pretty oasis. I enjoy walking through this Park, the gardens are lovely and its nice to watch the turtles in the ponds. Avoid on a Sunday though when its full of helpers on their day off
Hong Kong Park. If you happen to be near Admiralty, you my want to swing into the Hong Kong Park. It have a pond, and a nice water fall. Have some birds too. It is a good sooth relaxing place.

Nothing Much Excited. Just a normal park rather small and quiet. There is a church and some ancient building inside HK Park. Unless you are very close nearby or sight seeing collector, otherwise no necessary to pay visit this Park.
Relaxing place. Park is like piece of paradise middle of the city. There is restaurant where you get good food, beverages and excellent service.

Unexpected beautiful park in centre of city. Shopping along Nathan Rd & came across some interesting steps leading to a park so decided to go up. Surprise. Beautiful gardens. & cooler respite from heat. Nice bird park. Fountains. Then walked out to view Mosque next door & was greeted & offered tour. So interesting especially as was Ramadan.

Open space antidote. I always walk back through the park which is an oasis of calm after the frantic pace of the central shopping districts. The water falls, Aviary and trees are wonderful to slowly explore.the plants are labelled so useful if you spot an interesting specimen. It is always incredibly hot, and a bit steamy, but In ice lolly next to the cascades always helps. It is also free, Except the lolly,so if you have splurged on shopping, this is a good antidote.
Good park. Got bitten by tiny black insects(very painful) but other than that the place is a nice park with a good way to pass time between other attractions in the area

Green Oasis. We wandered in here on our way down from the Peak Tram lower terminus – an oasis of green among the towering high rises – clean and very well kept with an impressive waterfall and man-made lakes and ponds – there is a nice looking restaurant at the lower entrance and it is just across the road from a shopping plaza that has MTR access - for us a pleasant detour but would also make a nice break from the hubbub of Hong Kong Central if you are in that area.

Nice park - just as walking in a outdoor flowershop. Nice park with a lot of Nice flowers, plants and also waterfall with water were you can see Fish and turtles. Freindly for the Whole Family and Close to the Peak Tram.
Hidden oasis. Somewhat hidden amongst all the Hong Kong sky scrapers, this park shows a different side of Hong Kong and is a great place to quickly relax and get away from the hussle and bussle of HK

Solitude in midst of work. Like to take a stroll during lunch time, sit at the benches and watch family and office people enjoying the air, the green, the fountain, and the turtles. This is a gem offering a place to relax in quietness, away from the madness of office work. The only thing missing is probably some shaded areas in case of rain.

Hong Kong Park simply is beautiful!. On a rainy day or on a sunny day, a little stroll through the park is something I always do when in Hong Kong. I love looking at the beautiful flowers and fish in the water. Turtles and exotic birds are everywhere to observe. It is such a lovely place where everything is clean and well maintained. Waterfalls, a Thai Chi park and even a little wedding ministry can be found. You can stay 5 minutes or 2 hours. It is up to you! You feel relaxed and get to take deep breaths in the silence of this picturesque park. And when you look up, you are always remembered that you are in the heart of Hong Kong by seeing the big skyscrapers. Awww, I want to go back!

Lovely Park hidden in the Concrete/Glass Jungle in Central.... I always walk by this park during the weekdays. There is a reason why it earns a Certificate of Excellence is because its really good! Many people come to see the gardens and plants, many come to see the birds and wildlife while my favorite is the lake with lillies and goldfish. Its also great for those of you who like taking photos. Many office workers like to take a stroll here at lunchtime with many taking a take-out lunch to eat on a bench in the sunshine.My only complain is that there is no nice piece of grass or garden that I can sit on like what you would find in western countries. There is a restaurant/bar called L16 a the middle of the park.

Hidden gem in the midst of HK bustle. It is possible to miss this gem of a park even when you have been to Hong Kong countless times, unless you know of its existence and you get a taxi to take you there. But the effort will be well worth it.The greenery, gorgeous trees and exotic plants would be satisfying enough, until you come to the aviary. The birds flying about inside the enormous netting are mesmerising, especially when you stroll along the raised walkway and the birds pecking at the fruits seem almost within reach.Then there is a museum of tea-making equipment which could be an attraction all its own.

One oasis in Hong Kong. A wonderful park with fish and turtles in the water. Waterfalls and botanical garden with different climate zones. When entering the park fromthe alarms from traffic, it feels like entering an oasis.

Nice park in the city. With easy access by Admiralty MTR or by walking from Central, this 8ha park proposes : a pound, an aviary, a glasshouse, a teahouse, a museum, a restaurant, an special area in memories of SARS victims, a big children playground, and a 30-metre tower (105 steps) to have a view on the park.Nice place to cross moving from Central to Admiralty for instance. On the way, have a look to the 3 main banks towers & Lippo Bldg.
beautiful. this is such a pretty park right in the middle of hong kong....it's a nice park to walk around in and has a few restaurants in it.

Green and beautiful. We had a nice surprise finding this park. It was very quiet and there's a nice scenery mixing raw nature with skyscrapers. If you want to relax on a bench, surrounded by nature, this is the right place.
peaceful. Escaping the rush of hong kong.. a green peaceful place with lots of flowers and water..a place to charche your batteries..

Beautiful views of nature and skyscrapers. Stopped here while making our way to Victoria Peak. Beautiful park with turtles in the pond and birds in the aviary. Clean public bathrooms and plenty of benches to take it all in.
Lungs of the city. Always nice to be here and take an afternoon walk. Its right in the central city, surrounded by the central's buildings. Its clean and easy to walk.
Beautiful. We had a lovely, albeit hot, day here. The playground equipment was great. The maze was such fun for the little ones!
Peaceful. Just close to the Tramway lower station entry near the peak. Aviary a treat to the bird watchers. Can spend some peaceful moments at the park
Heaven in the middle of a chaotic city. Lots of things to do and to get immerse into. Great place to have a moment of peace in the middle of HK.
A Piece of Green Haven. Beautiful park with fountains in the middle of the Central, a jungle of office towers. Take a walk through this park to get to the tram to Victoria Peak.

free and easy. one of free destination in hongkong is hongkong park... located nearby to peak tram station and madamme tussaud museum.. you could visit and enjoy the park and listening to the bird within the park... you could bring a long food with you and make a small picnic with family or friends... well.. it's free and nice to be visited... you won't sorry...

beautiful park in city centre. Make sure to get off at the Admiralty station, not the Central if you take MTR. There are lots of things to see and do. There is an Aviary, a Greenhouse , a Museum of Tea Ware, a kids playground and sand pit. If you have young kids with you, Hong Kong park is a very good choice after doing shopping in Central. The kid playground and sand pit are just next to the Aviary. Young kids can have fun there. If you enjoy something green or cultural, this is a good place to visit too.

Scenic park. Very beautiful, scenic park. There is a waterfall which you can stand behind and take pictures, a greenhouse and gardens. The park is surrounded by skyscrapers which is odd but fascinating.
Right in the center of the city.. Right in the center of the concrete jungle. Beautiful, Clean and tranquil, a good place to relax and just look at people.

An Amazing Park in Hong Kong Concrete Jungle!. Have half a day in the morning before your flight? I would suggest you do an early central city check-in and take an MTR (under ground train) from central station to the next stop Admiralty Station for the park visit. Take a slow 5 minutes walk towards HK Park via Pacific Place Mall as you got off the MTR. Most visitors to Hong Kong over looked this park for some reasons. Park entry and special displays like Aviary and reptile display are free to all visitors. There are tea history museum and a tea house serving vegie dim sum delicacy from 11am. Several old heritage buildings left down from the former British master with charming colonial architecture. There are benches where one could sit and spend some quiet time by the water features or simply do birds watching in the aviary!

Green park with a zoo in middle of mid levels. this park is great to go at any time of the day and houses many species of monkeys and birds. The kids enjoy it and its a good place have some fresh air too

Beautiful park. From our hotel window we could see some interesting structures amidst lush greenery and we were intrigued. It turned out to be this beautiful park. We loved the fact that there was this oasis so close to our hotel and in the middle of all the skyscrapers. In addition to the beautiful gardens there is a wonderful walk-through aviary in here. Magnificent.
Peacedful oasis. One of the best parks in Hong Kong. A peaceful oasis in the heart of the most densely populated citiy in the world

A fantastic little park, better than Kowloon Park. Every time I come to Hong Kong I love to spend some time here. Its a really well designed park, some great plants and flowers, lovely water features and of course the Aviary. The Tai Chi Gardens are lovely and it also has the memorial to those involved in the SARS outbreak. There is also an observation tower in this area.If you are staying in Wan Chai or beyond then head to Admiralty/Pacific place and start from there. If you are staying in Central, Shueng Wan, Kowloon or if you have just done The Peak Tram then start at the other entrance on Cotton Tree Drive

A lovely oasis in the city . Hong Kong park is a lovely stop if you are walking up to the lower terminus of the peak tram, but warrants a visit in its own right. Featuring sculpted gardens, a lake, playgrounds and a cafe and museum it's easy to spend a bit of time here. A particular favorite of mine is the water feature with the ornamental carp and turtles. The view against the HK skyline is a bit of magic.

An excellent way to spend half a day - and its free. HK Park is a green oasis surrounded by skyscrapers that gives it a feel of Central Park in NY. It is long a thin and leads up to the Botanical Gardens and Zoo which are worth seeing, There are a number of attractions starting with the pretty lakes at the bottom, the Museum of Tea Ware (small and interesting), the KS Lo gallery (beautiful collection of document seals and pottery), the glass house which has some delightful cacti and orchids. As you climb further you reach the memorial to the medical workers killed by SARS within the Tai Chi garden (the tower of 105 steps does have great views) and finally you reach the lovely walk through aviary which is very worthwhile and the birds will come quite close. There is a childrens' playground at the top as well as toilets in various locations plus a cafe and kiosk at the bottom end although the tea house is closed for renovation.

Nice Walk-About. Great place to get some good pictures of Hong Kong Island and also across to Kowloon -- there are underground and above-road bridges that allow you to get to the park from the local hotels.
walk through aviary. this is a nice place to chill, right near the centre of the city.best part is the walk through aviary. The white tower with 100 steps is also worth a climb.

Nice park in the heart of city. this park is good if you love to see so many different type of birds
not too good for elderly to walk around as quite hilly

Turtles, fish and birds galore. Almost every morningn of our week long stay in HK we started the day with a visit to HK Park - what else do you do when your 5 year old is up at 6.30am and ready to go. He just loved the turtles, fish and the waterfall and it was great for him to have some space to run around after the confines of a hotel room. If you are there a bit later in the morning you can also visit the conservatory and the aviary. There is a kids playground too - average by our home standards but good for HK.

Loved this place! . We'd had a bit of a disappointing trip up Victoria peak so decided to go here on our way home - completely unexpected how amazing it was!! There are beautiful fountains and waterfalls and lakes with fish and Terrapins in!! It's absolutely stunning and it's huge so you can stroll around for hours! There's lots of little stalls about for buying souvenirs etc which are pretty cool and there's places you can get food and drinks. We really enjoyed it here and even though it was busy you could find little paths and benches away from the crowds if you wanted peace and quiet. Really great place to take kids as well. Highly recommend.
Lovely place. We really enjoyed Hong Kong park- great to have this in such a busy city. Keep your eye out for a LOT of turtles.Also there is a cool lookout point up a hundred steps (white tower).
Green space!. A green oasis in amongst the concrete jungle. Come here with a packed lunch and slow down for a bit before getting back out to the city.

Beautiful break from city buzz. The garden is close to the entrance to the Peak Tram and the HSBC building with its two distinctive lion heads. Very peaceful with water features and steps along the way.

Nice green serine place . So butiful. Quiet and releaxing. Well gardened.Combination of plants flowers and water.Fish and water turtels.Somtimes weddings are held there.Fun to take a moment away from the crowd and enjoy nature.Loved it. Recommended.

A wonderful spot of green. The best part of the park is the open air aviary - lots of tropical birds flying around, lots of fun. The whole park is impeccably maintained, so if you need a touch of green after a day of shopping, head over to the Hong Kong Park.
Lovely park in the heart if Hong kong. Situated next to the zoo and botanical gardens this is a small pretty park with a lovely fountain. Pop in here after visiting the zoo and the botanical gardens
Calm and Beautiful. It was such a delight to find a haven of peace in this city of eternal movement and noise. Beautiful flowers, fountains and birds - a place to take time and contemplate.
An oasis in the city. Love the lake, the fountains, the sports centre. Amazingly peaceful in the middle of the sky high buildings of Central.
Pleasant wandering. In the midst of skyscrapers and crowds, this is a welcome diversion. Take in the aviary and the small zoo that is next door.

Very nice aviary!. Relaxing and fun!
Aviary is cool,fun playground,beautiful atmosphere,artificial waterfalls,turtles in the pond.

Subtropical oasis in the concrete jungle. By the standards of many cities, this is not a large park, but it is in such a densely populated place as Hong Kong Island. The highlight for me was the walk through aviary, which is well worth seeing if you have any interest in wildlife at all. The tea museum is only a small display, but is worth a few minutes of your time, especially if it rains.

Nice park to visit if you have nothing else to do.... If you are done shopping and done with Disneyland and Ocean Park...and you happened to be staying in somewhere in Central, this place is just around the corner. A regular park.

Beautiful - Enjoy the various areas with lots to see & do. I had not been here before & am glad I took the time to get here by train & tram!!Well worth it we enjoyed walking around saw the various Conservatories, lakes or rather probably more ponds! Enjoyed the sculptures loved the frogs!! We did not go into the Aviary but saw the Olympic Rings, The Tai Chi Garden & lots more. Nice cafes & snack places there to eat, clean toilets as well that are free
A nice relaxing Place. We when on a Sunday afternoon. There were many people there with kids . The park nd everything about it was amazing .. To find this park in the middle of a concrete city.

Birds, Plants, Fountains Await. Excellent park in the middle of downtown Hong Kong. Easily accessible from the Admiralty MTR station, this park has water fountains, a bird and a plant conservatory all for free.

Beautiful park a real oasis. A great place to take break from the hustle and bustle strolling amongst the superb gardens, water features and enjoying some different views across HK. The aviary is worth visiting not just to see the birds but also to listen to the birdsongs

Another visit and just as good!. Hong Kong Park is amazing. There are so many things to see and it is all free. There are ape enclosures and massive aviaries. It is spotlessly clean and brilliant for the whole family especially young children. They will love it. Food and drink available too.

A green lung in Central and some less obvious attractions. This park is justifiably very popular but big enough not to feel too crowded, particularly on week days. Besides the obvious – ponds, waterfall, koi fish, tortoises, flowers and nice trees - it provides great views over Central and includes some less expected attractions, chiefly the Aviary and the Flagstaff House Tea Ware Museum. There is also the Conservatory, an interesting and pleasant displays of dry and wet climate plants. A restaurant with outside terrace, L-16, also provides a variety of choices for food and drinks at reasonable price. (The Olympic Square theatre and the Tai Chi Garden section were of less obvious interest to me, except that the observation tower included in the Tai Chi section allows for great views over park and the city. The park has a handful of access points, but the two most convenient in my opinion are the escalator through Pacific Place mall (MTR Admiralty) and the bridge overpass to and from Citybank/ICBC Towers (MTR Central).
Beautiful just to loose yourself. This is a lovely park and is a great place just to loose yourself and take a break from the cosmopolitan atmosphere that is HK. Grab an ice cream and just..chill.

Great city park; great aviary. A wonderful oasis of quiet and greenery in the midst of the urban jungle that is Central District. There are walkways, fountains, an artificial lake, a superb aviary (see below), a couple of museums and a marriage centre. It is very hilly and you can spend a lot of energy hiking up and down. It is amazing that this park seems so hidden away, yet it is quite spacious.There is a huge aviary that is very well designed. We have been to aviaries around the world and this is our favourite so far. You enter at the top and proceed down a pleasant wide wooden walkway to the exit at the bottom. Many bird species are present, including some that you really have to work to see. Some are friendly and some hide away as much as possible.This is a great place for a budding bird photographer. There are endless opportunities for experimentation and practice because there are birds everywhere. There are stopping places at frequent intervals so you do not get in the way if you stop to look or take a picture.It is free.

Disapointing . The park feels run down. Almost everything was closed off. We went through the avery but apart from a few parrots we couldn't see much. The children's playground was dirty and run down. I was secretly quite happy when my three year old said he didn't want to play.If you want a break from the hustle and bustle sit in a coffee shop, this park is a waste of time.

Nice park to visit. We were going to catch the tram to go to Victoria's peak, but the queue was way too long. So, we decided to go to Hong Kong park instead. It was a Sunday, so there were lots of local young families. The park is well maintained, there is a small zoo, aviary, conservation, and playground. It was well worth a trip there
If you like man made waterfalls, lily ponds and small streams. More than 80 species are kept in a rainforest environment at The Edward Youde. Nice with a park among all high-rise buildings.
Peaceful. This place is very peaceful and beautiful in Hong Kong. We can walk around and chill or bring something to eat here.
HK central park. Beautiful park with many parrots. Park is situated in HK island near Peak Tram. VERY good for relax!
beautiful. tranquil, spotless clean and a great escape from the city, go see the Aviary its free and just enjoy the peace and quiet

Beautiful Park - Don't miss it!. We spent an afternoon in the park! It was amazing ! Such a beautiful park in the heart of such a big city! Also a fun place to stop for lunch in one of the outside eateries! The green space was relaxing and very enjoyable! Weather you are walking, sitting, people watching or meditating! Worthwhile stop while in Hong Kong!

A Pleasant Surprise. My boyfriend and I went to Hong Kong during Chinese New Year which means that almost every shop and store was closed. Had this park not been there, we would have had quite an uneventful day, but this was wonderful!It is scenic to walk around and get great views. While somewhat hidden, I would recommend going to the nursery for the orchids and aviary. Wear comfortable shoes and know there are a number of stairs. We ended up spending more time here than we thought and are happy for it. Add it to your walking tour.

Lovely little Stroll. Take a few hours to stroll through HK Park. It's small but full of fun corners and lovely vistas. Since it's in the middle of the city you find yourself immediately surround with foliage and then the magnificent architecture. Fav parts: The Aviary Top of the Spire - excellent 360 views of the city.The WaterfallThe Turtle Ponds

Beautiful. Lively botanical garden in the centre of the city, ponds with turtles, waterfall, aviary, tea museum. Disappointed the tea museum is undergoing renovation and cafe isn't open - we just wanted a cup of tea! Managed the tea - just - at the Japanese restaurant, but couldn't get anything to go with it.Would have loved to walk on to the Zoological gardens, but ran out of time.A very pleasant afternoon spent in the park.

Peaceful and lovely gardens.. We went to this park on a wet and raining day. There were only a few people around, it was very peaceful, the waterfalls flowing fast, the fish and turtles had plenty of room to move about, the gardens well tended. We spent a couple of hours in the peaceful surrounds. Well worth the effort to get out of the hustle and bustle of the busy roads only a few meters from the entrance to the park.

You wouldn't know it is there!. You have to go all the way through it to appreciate what is there.In amongst the hustle and bustle of busy HK is a lovely change of pace. Sit and look around you, lovely plants, birds and good for people watching.

Best park I've been to. The size and layout of this park is perfect. There are beautiful pond areas. Unique statues. Aviary with many birds in. Tea museum. Art gallery. Waterfall. All this in one park! It is very clean and spacious and relaxing break from thr city. Located at admiralty mtr station just walk through the mall. Plenty of seats and refreshment areas

An outstanding public space. Very well designed, maintained and landscaped, this is my favorite part of the city. There is an extensive walk-through aviary, a poi/turtle pond, lots of exercise opportunties (extensive steps), a fountain you can walk into, a waterfall you can walk behind, several eating choices, an observatory tower, a conservatory and...I am probably forgetting a few things. But it is certainly among the best if not the best urban public space I have ever visited. And it's all free except obviously the food.

A Green Oasis with a city backdrop. Well situated within walking distance form Admiralty MTR station and adjacent to the Peak Tram station this park is well worth a visit. Admission is free and the park well kept with an interesting walk in bird aviary.

Green in the city. If you need to pause for a while, this is a good place to do it. Kids enjoyed the koi and turtle ponds, the waterfall (that you can walk in behind), the conservatory, viewing tower and the walk through aviary. Interesting small monument to medical professionals who died caring for others during the SARS epidemic. Aside from that there are nicely kept gardens, water features, tall trees and a bit of space to relax. Clean toilets, a couple of snack bars and noticed at least one restaurant.

Great park with a wonderful walk through aviary. This is a calm oasis in the centre of the city with a wonderful walk through aviary. The greenery is lush, the lakes full of turtles and the toilet facilities clean. A great way to spend a few hours in Hong Kong.
Lots of Green Space. Attractive as city parks go. We liked the children's playground, locals performing yoga and tai-chi, and the aviary.

A little (and free) gem right in the centre of HK!. We had a spare morning during a week-end and we decided to go: what a great idea! A quite place, where you forget to be right in center of one of the busiest capital of the world! Very nice the huge bird observatory cage!
Birds . Lovely and peaceful. Nice for a walk and to take a few photos of the beautiful birds. Fun and free for everyone.

Little oasis in the city . I stumbled on Hong Kong park while wandering the streets before a business meeting. The park is a lovely place to spend an hour or so. It's set in the foothills so the paths are steep - parents with buggies and mobility challenged would have difficulty. The map of the park makes it look huge but in reality everything is quite closely packed which means you can move seamlessly from the rather too build up zen gardens to the walk through aviary. Be warned the cages large birds to the side of the aviary are a depressing sight but the walk through aviary is simply stunning. Beautiful big space for birds to swoop in. You walk along a raised path so the birds can be above or below you. Look out for camouflaged green birds hidden in the trees. The lake is pleasant with a lovely surprise of tonnes of turtles piling themselves into the rocks and swimming with the fish. The toilets at the entrance are surprisingly clean and well maintained with a choice of squat or European style. All in all a lovely wander

Nice spot on a busy day. This is a tiny gem in the middle of a busy city. We went on a Saturday morning and watched people doing Tai Chi, bird watching, and the aviary. It was more peaceful and a nice activity to do between check-out and airport check-in.
An oasis. Nice place to relax and look at the buildings from a park setting, the restaurant looked expensive but there was a takeaway booth if peckish. Nice plants and fish etc.

An oasis of calm. Amongst the skyscrapers and hustle and bustle is a small oasis of calm and tranquility. We spent and hour here with the kids for a picnic. Plenty of space to sit down and they had great fun in a couple of the fountains. Good location to rest before going to the peak. The tram is 5 minutes walk away.

A lovely oasis in the city. We visited the park early morning. It is a lovely, green and clean place to visit. There were many locals doing exercise and thi chi. There is a lake with many koi carp and turtles. Beautifully kept gardens. Also a walk through avairy and a caged birds area ( pleas note these are not open until 9am) . Altogether a good way to spend a morning, and Free entry.

Love the birds!. Hey, not every where in park one can see a flamingo, they are kind of cute and fun. some turtles and other funky birds there too. beware the weekends though, picnic groups are everywhere.

Fun times.. There are animals (mostly birds and primates) to oogle at while you stroll through the park. There's also fountains and a small waterfall. Clean bathrooms and cafes. Gorgeous prehistoric looking trees.
fun for al. Beautiful sights and a nice walk. Be sure to see the cute turtles who search and compete for the sunshine!!

A green space amid the sky scrapers. Lovely area in the heart of Victoria city just steps away from Paific Mall. Aviary, ponds full of koi and turtles,waterfalls, two indoor gardens and acres of green space.
Very nice place.... ...to decompress in busy Hong Kong. Much better than other parks in the city. Place free of noise & smog. Very beautiful.

Lovely Park. This park is free for all. I recommend you to spend more than 3 hours here. There are a lot of things to see. The park is outstanding and it blends with the natural landscape. This park has museum, aviary and Hong Kong Visual Arts Centre to say the least.

A nice inner-city surprise. This is a beautiful park surrounded by Hong Kong sky scrapers. It is a peaceful oasis in the city and well worth taking a break and chilling out there with the ducks. It is clean and well maintained. Great for photos on a nice day. You can get tea in a Chinese Tea House or a meal and drink in the cafe.
Lungs of the City. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a couple of hours this is the place. A lovely park with many attractive features and worth a visit
A welcome oasis. The walk through aviary is exceptional and is worth a visit to the park. The park is very well maintained and attractive. It is surprisingly large and convenient.
Lots to see and free too. Spent hours wandering the gardens and aviary in HK Park. Simply beautiful. Also a lovely place to picnic on the Olympic circle.

Escape from the noisy Hong Kong. Hong Kong Park is a nice place to escape from the busy and noisy life in Hong Kong. It quite silent and not even crowded on the Saturday early afternoon when I was there. Interesting selection and exhibition of plants – and also an area with birds. It is worth visiting for adults as well as families with children.

An oasis in a very busy city. Hong Kong is completely surrounded by green, but in the city, there's often not a lot of it. This is a beautiful oasis that stretches up the hillside behind Admiralty. It's a little bit of heaven in an extremely artificial, built environment.

A javen from the npise. The fountains and streams over rocks cuts out the city noise. Nice selection of trees and flowers and lots of fish and terrapins in the water. All man made but it does make a nice break from the noisy city.
Their is a Japanese/Thai resteraunt there, also snack place that sells ice creams.
Very relaxing in the middle in the city. Very quiet with a few hidden areas. Would recommend visiting the Tai Chi garden. The back drop with all the skyscrapers is breath taking!

Lovely park. A lovely park set amongst all the high rise buildings. The park has lakes and trees beautifully set out and looked after. In the middle there is a free large walk through aviary and plant pavilion.
Lovely place... Was taken during a business trip when we had a few hours to spare, lovely place, well worth a visit if you have some spare time

One Of the Best Views In The World!. We took the bus tour that winds its way up the steep and narrow road with dramatic views of Hong Kong as we ascended the mountain. When we reached the top, we departed the bus and walked over to a group of buildings with one prominant building on top of this mountain. Once inside, you must pay a moderate fee to goto the upper deck on top of the building. This deck provides some of the most incredible views of the entire Hong Kong bay area-many which have been captured in famous movies too. Definitely a must do, must see adventure while in Hong Kong!
Beautiful Park Middle of City. Great place to wander around, finished a run in and then do a good work out. Lots of places to get away from the action and spend some time alone or relaxing.

A Restful place. A nice place to get away from the crowds for a bit. There are lovely netted in bird areas where you observe a variety of birds. Some of the gardens are nice and there is a pretty area containing a memorial to the medical staff who died whilst treating the SARS victims.
Lovely. We spent an hour or more sitting in the park, watching the many school children visiting. The ponds are lovely packed with Koi and Terrapines. There is also a Aviary that you can walk through

Bird Aviary to meet cute and beautiful ones.. Hills and mountains come close to the coast in Hong Kong side of the town. The bird aviary make the best of the geography. You walk through the path road high above the ground, and beautiful tropical birds are just in front of you, not above you. Also nice is the conservatory, and both are admission free. I think it is a must in HK just a few minutes walking from the Peak Tram.

Very nice park in the middle of a busy city!. Very clean and well laid out park for a relaxing walk or grab a cup of coffee and enjoy the shade under a tree. All trees and plants are clearly labeled. It's really nice to go thru this green park after walking thru a concrete jungle!

Clean And Peaceful. This park is very quiet (except for kids playground in the north part) and peaceful just to read, or little sleep :D.
Teaware Museum, Wedding Hall, and several British Colonial building are an extra attraction to this park.

Serene and calm place in the bustling heart of Hong Kong.. You have got to spend an hour or two in Hong Kong Park. This is my first time visiting and what a pleasant surprise. There is acres of gardens and grounds to roam with water falls (man made) and pools full or koi. Also, there are lots of benches and seating areas for resting and reflecting. Two areas we really liked. First was the tea museum...think clay teapot museum. Aviary. I have been to many aviaries in many zoos and parks and the one here in Hong Kong is rally top notch. Take MTR to Admiralty and exit through the escalators in the court building. Hong Kong park is at the top of the escalators! Easy... Loads of school children visit but the park is big enough that you can navigate around the groups.

Impresssive urban park. We were impressed by this park. It is quite walkable once you get to it. The trees and flora are all identified in both English and Chinese, so one can learn a lot. There are interesting sculptures, buildings, and ponds. There also is an interesting aviary which contains a wide variety of birds. It is definitely worth spending a couple hours here.

This is what it means to have an oasis in the city. Although human-made, this sanctuary right smack in the middle of the city feels so natural. Looking up, you're never in doubt that you're in the middle of the city, but it's not the passing traffic that catches your ear-- it's the birds in the aviary. There's also a waterfall and ponds as well as a playground and a visual arts centre, along with a museum and a conservatory. Every city must have a HK park!

Nice walk in the park. Hidden away from the roads and only found by asking for help after visiting the zoo. Free aviary to walk through. Good kids play area. Shame it rained or we would have visited for longer

Paradise in the middle of a concrete junglw. Me and my partner visited this park on the way to the Zoological gardens.It is situated right in the middle of the Admiralty business district so whilst strolling through the park you are able to take in the views of the impressive skyscrapers.Within the park there is a free aviary, conservatory with butterfly's, a vantage point, exhibition centre and Tai Chi park.The restaurant was a bit expensive but expected in a wealthy, central area of Hong Kong. A must visit

Nice bird zoo!. Quite nice in the middl of the city and very impressive bird zoo, especially the central huge cage -- my kids love it! Nice place to hang out and relax for a little while. Also has great kids playground

The Birds!. Found the park by accident as we decided not to stand in the never ending queue for the Peak Tram. Hong Kong Park is a short signposted walk from the Central MTR and the Peak Tram queue. It has a fascinating 'walk through' aviary - free entrance - which was the highlight of our visit. Nearby is the botanical Gardens - an uphill walk - and we also peered through the security gates at the Governor's Residence which is also nearby. Much better than standing in a queue!
Walk to the Park. Nice park, pleasant walk to it, not massive but very well kept. There are a couple of booths selling snacks.
Greenery in the City!. Great park right in the middle of the city. Excellent for kids and families with turtles, fish and birds to see.
Nice Park. Nice little park with terrapins and fish right in the middle of Hong Kong. The tea museum is worth a quick visit as well.

Tranquil Retreat. The Park provided a tranquil retreat in a hectic and crowded city.Although a constructed rather than a natural environment it works well and offers flora,fountains,waterfalls ,ponds teeming with terrapins and much more.A few hours could very pleasantly be spent here.The park ,with an entrance adjacent to the tram terminus ,could conveniently be combined with a visit to Victoria Peak.
Very peaceful. Lovely to walk around somewhere so peaceful in the middle of a busy city. The aviary (where the birds were flying around in a huge area and not caged) was stunning.
not to bad. a big beauty in the middle of Hong Kong! a easy walk and a good way to relax after shopping before you shop some more

I walk through here most days ...a little bit of greenery in a very busy city. its nice to take time out and enjoy the gardens and the scenery. there are a couple of interesting tourist places to visit in the park and a lovely bird avery

Lovely Oasis. The park is a wonderful respite from Hong Kong's noisy, crowded streets. The large aviary is a peaceful place to observe several species that appear to be well taken care of. A visit to this beautiful park is a good antidote to the city's crowds and exhaust fumes.

Waterfalls in the City. Great stroll and pleasant place to enjoy skyscrapers and nature at same time. Admission and wifi are free in the park and observatory. Best you can walk to the sky tram thru this natural oasis.

A Hong Kong Gem. The Hong Kong park and the Botanical gardens are a gem in Hong Kong, a peaceful sanctuary from the hustle and bustle. The walk through aviary is a must. You can wile away a good few hours here in the gardens, the glass house, the aviary, zoo. Almost surreal surrounded by high rise

You must visit this peaceful park. Just across from the Peak tram station you can enter this fantastic park and escape the noise and bustle of Hong Kong. Spend a few minutes or much longer meandering through clean, tidy gardens. Experience the movement and colour of wild exotic birds in the walk through aviary, pause at the SARS memorial set in a small tasteful landscape, enjoy the miniature Olympic arena, visit the tea making museum and walk by gentle lakes filled by fresh flowing waters. We spent nearly two hours there and best of all was being invited into the small audience of a wedding ceremony at the Park Marriage Registry Office.

Peaceful yet busy. A peaceful haven from the bustling city. Flowers, trees, lakes all with a cityscape background. At the weekend there is a small arts and crafts market. Don't miss the Aviary - a walkway winding through the tree canopy with birds flying freely. No charge for it - and some excellent photo opportunities.

Step into secluded oasis. Beautiful park, not very large but worth taking a walk as its just be to the peak tram (another great attraction). It has many beautiful features like carp pond or fantastic fountains. One of the countries is in the shape of the "flat mushroom" and you can go inside to take fantastic photo (on a sunny warm day as you will get wet feet doing so)

Short stroll. Not a very big park, nice to spent some time walking around and relaxing by the pond. You can plan to visit this park follow by visiting the Victoria Peak Tram station which is just a 10 minute walk.

Nice Park, many exhibits open up after 9am. I strolled through Hong Kong Park after watching the sunrise from the peak. The park is full of art, some museums, an Aviary that reminded me a bit of Jurassic Park and a Koi pond which I found to be the most scenic and the area round it offered many views of the skyscrapers which surround Hong Kong Park. It's a pleasant bit of green nestled in the steel and concrete jungle.

Relaxing and peaceful . Went there on a gloomy day and it was so calm and peaceful . You see all the skyscrapers around but you can't really hear anything . It's a nice short walk with lots of benches to just chill and relax! Definitely recommend it
Gorgeous Oasis. Have been to HK many times, great to stumble across this park on this trip. It's really tranquil and well maintained. I loved the terrapins in the pond.

Quiet park amidst the HK chaos. When we went to the Peak Tram we noticed we were walking straight past Hong Kong park. I'm glad we went in and strolled around a bit. I really liked the view from some points where you could see all the nice birds, feel the relaxed and quiet atmosphere yet see the skyscrapers very close by. It's completely free, very clean like most places in HK and the aviary was nice to take some pictures. The birds come very close and I enjoyed the visit very much. If you're on your way (back) to the Peak, definitely stop by here (it's right across the road from the tram exit/entry).

A quiet and great oasis. HK Park is located between Central and Admiralty as well as the Mid-Levels in HK Island. The park is a great retreat to escape the always busy streets of the city. In the park is a lake, an aviary, a Japanese garden, museums and more to visit, all conveniently connected within walking distances. HK Park also offers great views of the fantastic HK skyline so don't forget to bring a camera!
Relaxing. Great park in the CBD Kowloon. Great Public pool facilities. Great for walking, running, relaxing. Free immigration museum worth a visit.

An oasis amidst of concrete jungles. A truly oasis amidst of concrete jungles in the most hustle and bustle business circles in Central of Hong Kong. It is well laid out with a fountain and an elaborately-designed waterfalls in many descending levels. It houses a museum, a pond with colorful carps, patches and patches of greenery, an aviary, a big children playground where my kids used to play almost every week when they were toddlers. It also attracts office workers for lunch picnic at lunch time during weekdays. Hong Kong Park is a very beautiful park, providing peace and relaxation for workaholics and visitors as well.

Back to Nature after the Bustle of HK. The park is located between Admiralty and Central MTR. Despite inclement weather, the park was very busy. We visited the park on a Sunday afternoon. It was full of families, couples and there were also many people out with their very expensive photographic equipment photographing the birds and the flowers that were blooming.We were very impressed by the park and particularly enjoyed the water features. As others have said, it is a lovely place of peace and calm after the bustle of Hong Kong. We were fortunate that the park was decorated for the Chinese New Year. There were many locals taking advantage of the displays to take their photos in front of them.There were several stands for purchasing craft goods and there was also a museum in the centre of the park about tea. So, there was plenty of activity to occupy most people for at least an hour. We feel that it is well worth a visit.

a nice half-day thing to do with kids. make sure you put mosquito spray on - as it's green, those lovely friends are everywhere. The park is beautifully laid out and there are ponds with turtles and fish. great with the kids to explore. also easy to get to with the MTR to Admiralty station. a great gem in the city.

I love this place. This is such a lovely place during all the season, but particularly in the spring when everything is in bloom. It's just a nice relaxing place to visit and for great photography. It also has an enclosed tropical garden and an enclosed aviary.
A solace in the midst of a Busy town!. Hong Kong Park is situation in the midst of "hustle and bustle" HK. Walking through HK Park brings solace and peace. It is also a very beautiful park.

Beautiful . A beautiful park with lots of greenery and water features! A real oasis in the middle of the city. There is a little café to eat at, but also little vendors that sell drinks and snacks. There are also a few stalls of local handmade jewellery to buy.

An Oasis in the City. We came across the Hong Kong Park whilst walking from the Pak Tai temple to the Mid Level Escalators and what a pleasant surprise. The park occupies a hillside location deep within the city and they have managed to squeeze into the site a hot house, aviary, children's play area and much more beside. Though quite busy when we visited the park swallowed the visitors and thus did not feel crowded. We spent a very pleasant hour in the peaceful surroundings, a nice break from the pell-mell of the city.

A quiet respite from crazy Hong Kong. It took me 8 years to find this place and since then I have been back regularly. I love the feeling of having stepped out of the noise and bustle of the crowded streets and into a peaceful haven.This is the place you can see tortoises in the lake, gorgeous green gardens and some lovely buildings.There is usually something on in the Tea Museum and there is also an exhibition in the Hong Kong Visual Arts Centre. This is the place to come to savour some peace and quiet.
Worth visiting. Lovely oasis in the urban center of HK. The walk-through aviary is particularly good. Good to walk through the park on the way from the harbor to the Peak Tram station.

Great break from the city in the city and its free.. There are many things to occupy your time within the park and many of them are free. From the clock tower, Olympic stand, bird aviary and onward, it's a relaxing few hours to spend. Be prepared for inclines/many steps, comfortable walking shoes are best.You might even see a newly married couple at the wedding registry. :)Toilets are clean and easy to locate, fresh drinking water stations located through out the park. We really enjoyed the morning here and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong who loves nature.

Beautiful spot!. This is very much worth a few hours of your time! Green and lush, lovely water features, tended gardens and interesting wildlife.
