Easy walk from Admiralty train station.. It's free which is a bonus and beautiful manicured gardens. There is a tea room in the middle if you feel peckish

Serene for you and fun for your children. It is a regular park for children and older teens. There is a play area for kids and play ground for young adults. The park is well maintained and very close to the MTR station. You can carry your camera, walking shows etc. One can spend few hours with children. Do visit the aviary and take a walk around the entire park. Its serenity in the concrete jungle will impress you

Great entertainment for free.. We stumbled upon this park but what a lucky find. There's the KS Lo tea museum which was informative and free. There is a walk-through aviary and a good lake with fish and terrapins. We went down to the Queens Road area afterwards for wan tun and noodles because the restaurant in the park seemed a bit expensive.

An oasis in an concrete world!. I found the whole idea fantastic. Just in the middle of these skyscrapers, this cute well kept landscaped park is ideal for taking a rest. Gushing water, beautiful forna and places to sit and absorb the tranquility as an escape from the hustle no bustle of city life. At night time, the lighting gives it a different atmosphere.

Wonderfull !. A gem of a park that is not really advertised that much but it is an oasis of serenity and calmness in the middle of the urban jungle.. we had a great hour or two one afternoon in this park

At the base of the Peak Tram. This is a nice park that links Pacific Place with the Peak Tram if you are looking for some gentle outdoor activities. Nice pond and well kept gardens. Great opportunity for photographic enthusiasts!

The Aviary is a must.... A beautiful park surrounded by the tall steel and glass towers that add to its beauty. Within it is a free access aviary that is beautiful maintained and as much a botanical park with elevated walkways as an aviary

Peaceful Park surrounded by the city. This is a great park to wander around in the greenery and get away from the traffic and noise. Easy to reach, large enough to offer some space and very pleasant to relax away from the traffic and noise.

Grand and comfortable. Very grand and luxurious hotel with beautiful views of the city, and a gorgeous pool. Being Hong Kong though, even though we were about 50 storeys up you can still smell the city streets, a strangely alluring concoction of frying rice and car fumes. Avoid the minibar and buy wine etc locally. Also the breakfast in the hotel was shockingly expensive - go to the food court beneath the hotel.

An island of calm.. This is a beautiful park - clean and picturesque with imaginative planting. A great deal of thought as gone into the layout and it's well worth spending quality time there. A calm oasis.

take a break. Nice to visit this park in the middle of the big city. Your kids will love to run around without bumping into people. Different theme sections made the park feel bigger than its actual size.

Huge!. Loads to see, and so many places that I wanted to sit and watch the world go by from for hours.
The Park isn't natural, and it doesn't try to be. Embrace that, and you'll love it.

Relaxing moments in butling city. It was very hot when visiting HK so it was good to have a small breat at the park when walking to the Peak Station. There are some nice things to be seen in the park,

Greenery in Hong Kong. Brits left HK a lot of greenery.I used to work in Central and there is a lot of huge trees.after 18 years of mistreating trees, many trees over 50 years old were cut down or simply dead of tree infection.very sad.but we still have Hong Kong part here.visit there, you will find a lovely teahouse locate in the heart of the park. fragrance tea is served with dim sum style treats. very relaxing and cozy.hope you love Hong Kong like I do.
Beautiful restful spot in Hong Kong. A nice place to relax and stroll leisurely. Our kids enjoyed all the little surprises around the park. Highly recommend. I'd go rain or shine.

Yes there is a big park on HK island. I have ceased to be surprised now when people who have been living in HK for many months, say that they don't know where HK park is or that they don't think it is worth going to.Yes this park entrance is a bit hidden but one of the entrances is close to Admiralty MTR station. This is a beautiful place with small lake, restaurant, sometimes small shops and few places to relax and enjoy the turtles in the lake. If you fancy a good walk then visit the aviary. If you fancy more walk then visit the zoo also. I usually go in the reverse order (zoo, aviary and then lake). Take a cab to the zoo and then walk downhill.
Garden. Peceful and serene tranquil but not exactly what we had in mind but it was included and very important for their culture soooo

A good chunk of greenery in the heart of the CBD!. You can go as a tourist and take your time, or if you are in Hong CBD on business just find time during the day to go there between appointments and relax a bit. There is an aviary, no particularly huge but a good collection of birds, if you are patient enough. There is also a teaware museum, benches to ease your feet from walking, especially those on high heels. The restaurant there is okay and convenient and can be pretty busy during lunch time. And all the above has no admission fee; you of course need to pay for the meal at the restaurant!
Hold on to it Hong Kong. Good with a green spot - lots of green surely but i wonder how long it will be able to keep the building tycoons at bay - prime land.
Beaufitful park. Beautiful park close to start your journey to Victoria Peak. Visit the bird sanctuary ( free admission).

Very clean. There was no entrance fee. To get there go down admiralty mtr and cross the road also across city bank. If by dingding go down murray road stop. The park was also walking distance to the peak tram. It was very clean with lovely plants and flowers. It was a good place for photo ops. A good place for relaxation.

Excellent retreat in a busy city. Beautiful park with great views from various places. A great retreat in a busy city. We stayed in Conrad nearby and went to the park after a tiring day in the city. It was a beautiful walk with many features, such as aviary, falls, ponds. etc.

A paradise hideaway in the heart of the city. We entered the park near the fountain place and clock tower, proceeded to the artificial lake. I immediately felt refreshed and recharged when I sat down on one of the park benches and just staring at the beauty that is right in front of me.In the lake, there are water plants and we'll-nourished fishes. Walking further brought to another section of the lake were turtles and fishes co-exist. I believe I saw at least two species of turtles. Next stop was the Conservatory. A man-made waterfalls welcomed us as we climb our way to the entrance. The Conservatory has four sections: indoor plants, plants in dry environment, plants in humid environment, and one section that was closed I couldn't remember. The collection of flowering plants, ferns, trees, vines was just astonishing. It was sensory overload for me, I was nauseous from being exposed to such beauty. I'm not even exaggerating. I learned about plants that need a lot of water, plants that don't and they are not just from the cactus family, and found ferns and plants that I would like to be the soil cover for my garden back home, instead of the usual Bermuda or carabao grass. The park has two aviaries. The first one had birds in cages. The second one is a walk-through type were you can experience bring up close with the birds in their almost natural habitat. The aviary didn't contain birds of prey such as Eagles and falcons, not even owls but mostly it contained small to medium size birds that feed on insects and fruits. A well-equipped camera will be an advantage. It's a must see-must experience park.
Beautiful. The park is really beautiful and quite a sight to see something like this in the middle of such a busy city. Worth a visit.

Well situated with loads to do!. We stumbled across this park by chance and we were pleasantly surprised by what we found. The park is quite big with lots of things to see and do, I would certainly recommend popping in if you're in the area.

excellent resting place for any time of the day, or even to sit with a sandwich lunch. No visit to Hong Kong should come to a close without a few strolls through the Hong Kong Park, which has its own aviary, a museum, wedding chapel, and several other attractions. Wedding watchers may enjoy seeing the luxury autos rolling up to disgorge brides, grooms, parents, and photographers. A work-mate of mine used to point out that on the west side of the park the "wedding chapel" sign is right next to the "toilet" sign, which didn't seem to put the prospect of getting married in a very good light. I frequently sit by the pond, check in on the turtles, and read a chapter or two from whatever tome I'm lugging around. It's a good locale to people watch. There is also a restaurant on the east side of the park which changes hands every couple of years. The last time some of us went there it was good. Just NE of the park is the Pacific Place mall, so you can duck into the park after a rough afternoon of shopping. Or you can hang out for 20 minutes while waiting for the movie to start. Hong Kong newlyweds (even if they haven't been married in the park) frequently come there to have photos taken, so there is quite a bit of local color about on the weekends. Graduates in their caps and gowns also come there for family photos. Always a fun and interesting locale. Enjoy.

Green Bubble in Central. If you want to take a break from hectic and over the top dynamic Hong Kong, go to Hong Kong Park.Steps away from Pacific Place and from the City, a hidden gem with beautiful trees and nice benches were to rest away from the city noise.I love the Bird sanctuary and I enjoy showing it as well as walking through the alley with overseas friends!If you are just walking from Wanchai to Central, or vice-versa, why don't you just walk through the Park. This is what I do when I have a bit of time.
Found by accident. Running around my hotel, found this gem by accident. Love that everything is free here. I wondered around the bird sanctuary, conservatory and tea museum. Just lovely!

Awesome park. Beautiful surrounding, very creative and very quiet. I really enjoyed just walking around in the shadow in the park and just listen to the water and see all the cool parts of the park. If you have nothing special planned and just wanna see Hong Kong islands shopping district for a day this might be a great thing to go to have a break from all the shopping.

Serene, surrounded by skyscrapers... Enjoy this serene park amidst the business of HK, watch the birds, fishes, turtles. Enjoy the sounds of...... The waterfall..... Enjoy a bit of shade as you drink your tea.... Enjoy watching the elderly as they practice their Tai Chi..... Just enjoy this park, don't miss it.

I could spend hours wandering around and sitting in here. A fantastic park on the edge of the business district of the city, it was beautifully planted with fascinating wildlife in the ponds and plants. I walked through it many times during my stay in Hong Kong and it was always spotless. The aviary in particular is worth the walk up the hill.
Peaceful. Away from crowed and busy environment, Hong Kong Park is the place for relax from a tired shopping. Good place for everyone. Beautiful park in the central of the city.

Stylish oasis among the skyscrapers. Beautifully lush surrounded by shining glass high rise buildings. Spend some time in the museum of tea history and drink tea afterwards in the adjoining outstanding traditional tea house. Lots of fountains and water cascades thoughout the park. Beautiful entrance from the Admiralty through luxury shopping malls. Busy office professionals everywhere. We had lunch in the park (good lunch offers) and had a lovely stroll by the fish pond, Conservatory with exotic plants and bird cages. This is an oasis in a unique setting.
Oasis in the city. It was so nice to walk in the Park with its neat gardens and tranquil environment. Safe and clean and right below the skyscrapers
Quiet and Peaceful. Was located conveniently and easy to find. Loved going there in the early evenings when birds came back to the trees to settle in for the night.Quite romantic too..

Find peace within total madness. Hong Kong is super busy and crowded. To find some peace and quiet, even locals visit the park. It's a huge park in the middle of the city, surrounded by huge buildings. But once in this park, you'll forget about everything that's outside of it. There's lots to see and do. There's a garden, a swimmingpool, an aviary. And when you're ready, you can return back to the madness outside :).

Amazing scenery . Such a beautiful park with a free a aviary, the fountains, waterfall and lakes make a nice backdrop on a hot summers day you almost forget your in a middle of metropolis. Walk up the tower to get some great pictures
Beautiful, peaceful park in the heart of the city. Beautiful, peaceful park in the heart of the city. Can recommend it as a calm oasis well worth the visit for a walk.

Ａ　ｃｉｔｙ　ｌｕｎｇ　ｏｎ　ｔｈｅ　ｈｏｎｇ　ｋｏｎｇ　ｓｉｄｅ. Ｌｉｋｅ　Ｋｏｗｌｏｏｎ　Ｐａｒｋ　ｉｎ　Ｋｏｗｌｏｏｎ，　ｔｈｉｓ　ｐａｒｔ　ｏｆｆｅｒｓ　ｙｏｕ　ａ　ｃｈａｎｃｅ　ｔｏ　ｈａｖｅ　ａ　ｂｒｅａｋ　ａｆｔｅｒ　ｙｏｕｒ　Ｐｅａｋ　ｔｒｉｐ　ｏｆ　ｓｈｏｐｐｉｎｇ　ｓｐｒｅｅｓ　ｉｎ　Ｃｅｎｔｒａｌ．Ｉｔ　ｉｓ　ａ　ｓａｎｃｔｕａｒｙ　ｆｏｒ　ｌｏｃａｌｓ　ａｎｄ　ｖｉｓｉｔｏｒｓ　ａｓ　ｗｅｌｌ

Peaceful, well-maintained. I thoroughly enjoyed Hong Kong and everything we experienced. This park is well-maintained, peaceful, and lovely. A perfect way to get out of the bustling streets, and into a bit of mindfulness.

Very good park. It's very very nice park with so much to offer. It's very rare a park with a couple of musems inside. There is a beautiful pond with lots of turtles, they are really cute, I didn't know turtles loves sunshine that much before. our family 5 of us went there the last day of our trip in HK.

City and Zen. This place is where most of the working people relax and take there breaks- to unwind. Others go to this place to enjoy the scenery with the busy city. Some, do picnic, exercise or just stop breathe- to re-charge their energy. This is also the center within the center- accessible going to different areas, streets, alleys , shops, transportation and attractions.

A visit to the Park. I enjoyed very much my walk to this Hong Kong Park. It's beautiful and well kept. It's quite big and lot's to see. It's a paradise surrounded by big skyscrapers and busy Hong Kong City.
Panda's. Excellent display to see the Panda's. Buy tickets online before going as this will help when entering the park.
nice afternoon. Hong Kong is a good contrast to the tall buildings surrounding it. Its a fun half day with a few interesting sights

Great Expectaitons. I expected more to be honest. It was quite small and almost nothing to see. But around 500 m from the HK park there is Botanical and Zoological garden which I would recommend for pictures. There are flamingos there and lemurs.
Nice break. Nice respite from the hectic, hot city but easy access as it's right in town. The conservatory and aviary are interesting and well done.

A shaded respite from the HK chaos.. In a busy and hectic city as crowded as HK, this was a cool shaded oasis of calm. Liked the small turtles and the aviary, plus anyone who likes flowers will find the park has something to offer them too.

Great visit with young kids, but very tricky with a pram!. I took the kids (5yo and 2yo) to Hong Kong Park twice: once with my husband, and the other time by myself, with the kids in the pram.Here are my thoughts / advice based on those visits:* Do go! - it is a little slice of nature in the middle of the Hong Kong concrete jungle. It is such an amazing contrast to be sat inside the park, surrounded by skyscrapers. My kiddies loved the lake (especially the turtles and fishes) and the waterfall. I suspect that the Aviary would be more appreciated by children older than my own.* The park itself is on a significant slope, and there are lots of stairs (including between the different levels in the playground!) ... which made it interesting for me when I was by myself with the kids in the pram! I believe that you MAY be able navigate your way through the park without using the stairs at all (definitely not the case in the playground ... as you can only do it using the stairs), but you would need to take a photo of the map on the way in and keep referring back to it, as it is a little bit of a maze. On my two visits, I saw several people struggling up and down the stairs with their prams.* The playground is quite dated, and really only suitable for toddlers. My 5yo was bored within a few minutes, though my 2yo would have been happy to play for longer.* There are Park employees there to make sure that people are not sitting / walking where they shouldn't be ... so it isn't a park where you can be at ease and let the little ones let off lots of steam!* The toilets were incredibly clean!As the Park is incredibly close to the lower terminal of the Peak Tram, we visited after a trip up to The Peak, and it was a really comfortable day for the kiddies (i.e. not "too much" crammed into one day).

A gorgeous park in Hong Kong.. This is a truly beautiful park, sometimes overlooked by visitors to Hong Kong.The park is a serene haven in the midst of the chaotic streets of this part of the city.The park includes fountains, lakes with turtles, beautiful plants and flowers, a conservatory, several museums and an aviary.A lot of local families visit the park over the weekend and its no wonder - it's truly a great place to stroll in for a couple of hours.Highly recommended!
Nice park in the middle of the city. Nice park in the middle of the city -- good way to go from the peak tram to pacific place by foot (and MTR) if you do not want to take a cab.
Nice park. I liiiikeeee it. Although i feel so contrast because i am small standing between many high buildings. It is clean also.
A simple park to visit. It was simply Amazing. Ive stayed in Dubai and get used to sands. I felt relax after a long flight. It's just a simple place but yet I love it cause of nature.

Lovely, free, and relaxing. A great location to see a slice of HK's people. This clean park has three children's playgrounds, (the wonderful large slide is gone, which is a loss, but the playgrounds, especially the sand diggers are fun). The Aviary is beautiful, free and you can take as much time as you wish walking through it.There is a "coliseum" type place to sit and watch events if there are any, or just relax as kids practise singing or dancing.The park is safe for children but be careful with toddlers going down the hill. By the ponds and lakes, look at the koi and turtles. You're likely to see at least one bride and groom. Hong Kong Park is an oasis amidst the frantic pace of HK...take a break and enjoy it. Look around at the people gathered here...these are the people of HK - people of every age, culture, profession - all there for one reason - to relax.
Great break from a busy city. Beautiful park. Includes aviary, ponds and parks. Enjoy a beautiful landscape with the city skyline peaking through the trees.
Wonderful park!!. Great way to escape the city in the middle of the city! Beautful sites amidst wonderful greenery!Dont miss the chance to visit this lovely park!

A short morning visit for butterfly viewing. I went there for a short sunny morning visit and there I saw about ten butterflies around and took a few good photos. This was my second visit for the same purpose and the park does not appear a very preferable place fo5r that as a matter of fact. I did see a few photographers with heavy professional gear for birds on my way as this is one of the 2 parks where the government organises bird viewing morning tours regualrly for free. Despte the disappointments for me, fairly speaking this park is conveniently located with enough eateries and washrooms. The ponds, trees, paths, flowers, fish, tortoises and greenhouse (which is very clean and comfortable) on the gentle slopes around make this clean park in the urban area a nice area for wedding and general family photography.

A green zone in the heart of the concrete jungle.... Hong Kong Park is one of the more famous and easily accessible of all park areas in Hong Kong. Located in Central, it is essentially in the heart of Hong Kong. This park is a lush green and vibrant with colorful plants. It makes for a great scenic opportunity for Photos with the skyscrapers in the background. There is a nice pond with a small, man-made waterfall in the park as well. And there is also the opportunity to go into the tropical house that has cacti in all sorts and shapes. If you find yourself in Central and want a break away from the cars and myriad of people on the streets, seek out Hong Kong Park.

An oasis in a very busy city. we were advised to go and see this and we are glad we did. It was an eye opener: after all the interesting & very busi areas, here is a place of rest and peace. The aviary is great, the garden and fountains lovely. Certainly a must when you have a few days in HK.

A nice retreat for an hour or two.. We found this by accident when we were travelling to the hill tram. The park is in pristine condition and there is lots of seating for you to do a bit of people watching and take in the lovely scenes.

Seems so removed but yet.... It is pretty easy not to know the park is even there! It is home to some good sites 2 x galleries, free and worth a quick once through and the aviary also free where you walk among the tree tops at eye level with the birds - the one downside is you are too high to see the ground dweling birds. Take a break from the hustle and bustle and have a look around, you'll be passing it on your way to the peak tram.

Beautiful. Excellent gardens...its near the peak tram. Vast & very nice. Theres a nice fountain & great water bodies. There were many newly weds coming there for photos. Excellent...worth a visitNov 12

A nice break from the city. A quiet, peaceful oasis in the concrete jungle of Hong Kong, this park is spectacular. The plants, trees, and birds were the only things distracting me from the book I was trying to read.

Surprisingly beautiful. Amazing array of tropical plants and birds! It was an accidental find whilst walking back from the peak but so glad we happened across it I would recommend the park to visitors as some light relief from the hustle bustle of the city.
Nice little park. This is a very pleasant little park in the middle of a very busy city, grab a lunch and sit down ato give your legs a bit of a rest.
Beautiful English style garden. Many beautiful flowers, water features, sculptures, and just a lovely park environment. Centrally located, we walked through it on the way to the peak tram.
absolutely beautiful. tranquil and beautiful set inside the high-rise city . Truly a place to relax. Beautiful fish in the lake, plants, flowers.... just stunning..... I wanted to get married here :)
A nice place for a bit of quite. A nice place to visit very clean a must see for some peace and quite or just watch people doing exercise.

Splendid & Clean. We enjoyed our visit here, they also have a mini zoo which gives more excitement to our children. Above all it is free to see the animals. It's a good nature walk in the middle of a concrete jungle.
Quiet green space tucked away in a concrete jungle.. Definitely go there for a while if you have the time, it's a quite Beautiful place. Very central and connected too.

On a clear day .... On a clear day you can see forever. That is if you can squeeze past all the other sightseers and actually get a glimps of Hong Kong Harbour. It was once regarded as the most beautiful Barbour in the world. Nowadays it may be regarded as one of the most urbanized Harbour's in the world. Still worth a look though.

Green space not to miss. Hong hong park was right next to our hotel. We were ready for a shady spot after walking around in humid hot day. We walked there directly from the peak tram terminus it is just across the road. Firstly it is a lovely park. Then there is the museum of tea ware which tells the tale of 2000 years of tea on China. Not to be missed is the tea house next door. It is a bit hidden away. When we arrived at noon it was full so we reserved to return in an hour. Super tea house. Lovely setting. Long list of exotic tea and vegetarian options. Also a gift shop with tea and tea services. There is a conservatory for plants and a really cool. Aviary with exotics species flying open as you walk through on upper walkways. All free. Great place for a family to spend the day when beating the heat.
Quiet and Pleasant. We really enjoyed this park which was recommended by a tour guide. It was quiet and pleasant. I wold say that if you want a quiet afternoon go for a stroll in he park.

Oasis in the heat. We stumbled upon the park after a trip up the escalators. The zoological gardens were small but well kept with a few primates, lovely noisy frogs and interesting birds. The gardens are well kept and a welcome break from the noise and bustle of the city.

Great Escape. This is a lovely little park on the main island of HK. It is right in the cityscape meaning you get some beautiful and dramatic pictures. The park is large and has an aviary and wild plant house. Both are worth visiting. There is a lovely goldfish area too making it a lovely free afternoon away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong.It is a very hilly park so do bare that in mind if you have children or suffer from OA or similar condition. There was a little market set up when I was there which was nice, selling crafts and local items. There is a coffee shop on site though I did not try it on this occasion.I would recommend a visit.

Great location. Great location, walking diatance to mtr station and city attractions such as malls, museums and avenue of the stars. There's a smartphone and nespresso machine in every room you can use for free. Bed mattress was a bit hard. Majority of the TV Channels cater to those who understand Chinese. If you wanna watch a movie, you have to pay for it. Expect room size to be small because it's the norm in Hong Kong.

Calm and Beautiful. Hong Kong Park is one of the best green spots in HK. Besides the green areas, check out its waterfalls (a big one and another one where water streams on stairs), plant conservatory, spacious Edward Youde Aviary, Flagstaff Museum of Tea Ware, Visual Arts Centre, a tower with beautiful HK views, and more. You can easily spend a few hours exploring the park - highly recommended!
Relaxing. Get off at Admirality and walk towards Peak Tram via the park. Relaxing, cool and great bac drop of sky scrapers. Worth stopping here for a drink before heading up to the peak.
Beautiful park.. Really stunningly beautiful park. Very quite and peaceful. Great place for a family picnic or something. Could easily spend half a day just lying around :)
Excellent. well worth spending the day here, an oasis in the middle of Hong Kong, so much to see and do - the treetop aviary is fabulous

You can spend a few hours or a whole day. What an amazing contrast to the surrounding city and skyline. There are so many little nooks and crannies to observe animals, see beautiful plants and simply enjoy a little time away from the bustle.

Hong Kong is not only about modern high rise h-buildings. The Hong Kong Park is a 80,000 m2 public park next to Cotton Tree Drive in Central.Its natural landscape provides a relaxing environment in the busy and crowd business centre. Features include Edward Youde Aviary, Hong Kong's largest; the Vantage Point to see the "bird exhibition"; Forsgate Conservatory, which is a greenhouse; several modern gardens, including Garden Plaza and Tai Chi Garden.There is also a sport centre and a squash centre.It is an interesting visit showing an other side of Central Hong Kong.

Serenity in the hustle and bustle . Just found this after shopping and would have liked to have spent longer there.Lovely turtles, various fish and birds, a tea house, waterfalls, lakes, landscaped gardens etc - LOVELY

Urban park right at the heart of Hong Kong commercial center. Very very nice urban public park right at the heart of Hong Kong commercial center. A lot of topical trees are more than 100yrs old. It also has Green House and Aviary.
With young kids. The park was good fun with interesting thing always just around the corner to keep everyone entertained. Went in the morning and a very good people watching spot!

A beautiful escape from HK. A bus there and a walk back, a beautiful part of HK and completely free for all. Wheelchair & stroller friendly clean toilets available and reasonable food to buy on hand. The gardens, the fish and the monkeys. The hot houses, the views, the cleanliness. A great place to visit when in HK.

escape noisy downtown for an hour. If you want to escape noisy Hong Kong you could do worse than spend an hour or two in HK Park. There is an aviary, an art exhibit, a tea museum (super corny but charming) and a few other attractions. A visit should not be on top of your list but it is a pleasant way to spend a bit of time for a change of pace.

Decent park. I went after 5:00 so the bird sanctuary was closed. The rest of the park was alright. Nice place to sit and rest a little in some green space. You'll see turtles and big colourful fish (bass?).There was no tai chi in the tai chi area when I went, maybe going in the morning would be better.

The only green paradise in the central part of HK. If you are in Central, be sure to visit the Hong Kong Park, which is very different from the rest of the city. It is easy to get to by taking the long escalator just outside of Pacific Place. There are several ponds and many different types of lotus and tropical plants and trees. There is a tea house and a cafe in the park with nice view of the pond. Be sure to visit the Aviary ...all FREE
Wow. Found this gem by a accident. It's free and amazing. It has everything. Please go and take a walk Round

Park on Hong Kong Island. This is a beautiful park surrounded by embassies a High court and three 5 star hotels: Conrad, Marriott, Shangrila. It's on Hong Kong Island so you will feel rich if you stay in this area as the Island is built in such a way that it gives a super rich feeling. The garden is beautiful with a wonderful waterfall, hotriculture indoor park and a dim sum joint in the middle of the garden. Yes, it's worth a visit and very beautiful to take pictures. It's free... So there is many thing you can do for free when you are in Hong Kong.....Worth a visit with family and for lovers as well!!

Great place to grab lunch and have a rest. Bought lunch to take in here and have a rest from the crowds of Hong Kong. There are food stalls in here, but we decided to buy something before going in.None of this is natural and is all man made, but it is stunning.Its quiet, relaxing and all of this next to the busy central area of Hong Kong.A must go place, and a place to grab a rest before you carry on!

a beautiful park in the middle of a busy city. Hong Kong Park is such a surprise as it is an oasis of peace in the middle of the hustle and bustle of a busy city. A walk through the park restores some tranquility in your life. Take time to enjoy the magnificent aviary in the park. This is one of my favourite places to visit.
Peaceful Park. As is with every place in Hong Kong - beautiful, cleverly laid out, restful. I really like stopping now and then, sitting on a bench, and just taking in the sights and sounds.

Hidden away from the madness of downtown. On a bank holiday late afternoon, i wanted to escape the madness of downtown Nathan road and stumbled upon this. Lovely outdoor swimming pools, tennis and football pitches and nice park for walking, although i only explored the edge really.
It is ok. It is ok. Just normal park. I personally think Hongkong is a business place, not a siteseeing place.
Great tranquille parc hidden within the city. This parc although right downtown backs onto the mountain and is a semi escape fr noisy Hong Kong. Very well kept and clean.

A beautiful oasis in a crowded city. No matter who you are or what you are doing in Hong Kong this is worth a visit.Not only are the parks beautiful but they house a lovely conservatory with different climatic areas' plants and a huge walk-through aviary - all for free. The park is a lovely spot for a stroll - we popped over to the nearby shops and bought some lunch and brought it back to eat in the park.Definitely worth a visit.

A Beautiful Oasis. A lovely spot - easy walk from Admiralty MTR station via elevated walkways. Plenty to see, a large walk through aviary, ponds, falls etc. Well presented and enjoyable. Not exactly what you come to Hong Kong for but if in the area or looking for something else to do, well worth a look. Kids playground and ponds with koi and tortoises to keep kids happy. Tea room for a break.An oasis!
Greenery & Martial arts. A lovely green park in the middle of hk, a nice rest bite. The martial art shows at the weekend are good too....I enjoyed wedding photo shoot spotting too!

A green oasis in a bustling city. A pleasant surprise... We were unable to stay long and did not get to see the whole park. But what we did see was lovely and well maintained. I thoroughly enjoyed the Tea Ware Museum.
Hong Kong Park, Hong Kong. Nice place to relax and get out of the hustle and bustle. Beautifully presented areas and majestic scenery. Worth a walk through.

Suprising oasis. We headed to this park as I wanted to try the Lock Cha Tea House for lunch. I am so glad we were early as there are so many things in this park to see and do. Firstly the park is quite large. On walking in and under all the established trees the temperature drops and you leave the city behind. It is very peaceful.There is a really nice aviary that we spent much time in and a greenhouse to wander through. The park has water features of a lake and fountains and waterfall, all very pretty. The Museum of Tea Ware and the Lock Cha Tea House were are main port of call but we happily spent the morning wandering through the park beforehand
Nice gem to relax from the traffic. Quite amazing, this nice and quet park in the middle of a busy city. Cant wait to go back the next time im here, just nice to walk around.

Beautiful park. In the middle of the craziness of Hong Kong is the beautiful Hong Kong park.. Nice to walk around or to just enjoy a break from the heat, it has many ponds and fountains. We loved it, I'd recommend a stroll through...

Unbelievable.... When we first went into this park it was just unbelievable to see all the greenery and life right in the middle of this concrete jungle. There were birds, fishes, turtles, butterflies... a lovely break from the city right in the middle of it.

Bird Sanctuary. It is like a hidden treasure island in the middle of business area. I happened to walk there after the peak visit. I didn't realize you can see so many different kinds of birds in the bird sanctuary. Under the hot sun, the tree shade in the Park provides a release and tranquil oasis.

Hong Kong Park. The park is truly amazing. So much green space and a lot to do on the property from the botanical gardens, to the bird sanctuary to the art museum. This park had it all. I enjoyed the daily walks and it was clean and friendly. I would suggest taking toilet paper as the do not have westerner toilets.

A beautiful oasis. In the midst of all its busyness, Hong Kong has islands of beauty and tranquility. Hong Kong Park is a large area which is easily accessible from exit C of Admiralty Station. You enter past a wonderful fountain and water feature, and soon come to a complex of lakes and waterfalls. The plant conservatory is beautiful and the aviary is well worth visiting, although it is a bit of a climb to get there. The Park is close to the Peak railway, and also to St John's Anglican Cathedral, for those interested.

Picturesque and thought provoking. An early morning visit as a potential running route turned into several moments to pause and reflect. The park is popular for weddings and has many varieties of birds, plants, fish and butterflies. I stubbled upon a monument to all of the medical workers who lost theirs lives fighting the SARs outbreak. Each had a bust in the likeness and a short account of their lives. Very moving.I also returned and visited the Museum of Tea. This was a great place to visit, explained all about the heritage and culture surrounding tea (and it also puts to shame our use of tea bags and milk in western society!!)

What a contrast!. Just a short walk from the tramway, and well worth the detour, not least for the contrast with the rest of Hong Kong. The gardens themselves are very impressive, but the aviary must be unique. A huge area where you can walk among a vast collection of birds from south east Asia, with superb photo opportunities

Pleasant respite. Hong Kong is really built up, but green spaces such as Hong Kong Park, which is quite compact, packs in quite a lot. There is an aviary, a tea museum, a marriage registry, besides general park features like ponds and fountains. You can easily spend 2-4 slow hours here. Expect some slopes, steps, but all well paved. If you are old or less fit, just take it slow. I found it nice to see all the tall buildings around this oasis.

Lovely park for a Sunday stroll. We came upon this park by accident on a Sunday afternoon and really enjoyed it. We were just going to walk through and come out at a different exit but enjoyed it so much we kept walking around and around. Definitely worth a visit. Lots of ponds, fountains flowers and picnickers!
Lovely to walk through. Just behind Island Shangri La a little oasis in the city. Nice water features. Probably not a destination but nice to stumble across.

Its a nice park in an Urban environment. The park is on Hong Kong island. There is a tea museum and other things in or adjoining the park. It has a few fountains. It is well traveled, especially on the weekend. Its close to the subway which is under a large and beautiful shopping mall called "Pacific Place." Very nice and I don't even like malls.

Very nice free walk-in aviary!!!. The park is a nice retreat from the busy CBD area and just minutes from Pacific Place located near Admiralty MTR. Exit from Shangri-La's lobby and the Park entrance is just opposite. The best attraction is the free walk-in aviary that houses many exotic and beautiful birds! It's worth a visit for birders and visitors that want a different experience right smack im the CBD area!!!

Beautiful park in the middle of the shopping madness. When you want to relax from the shopping madness step in the park , there you will find yourself in another world.Hugh trees and different birds all with nice sounds and cool athmosphere.Deserves a visit , even for 30 minutes walking .
great park with birds and turtles and fishes. My daugther liked it a lot: green park with birds, lakes with fishes and turtles, and it was on the way to victoria peak, so just perfect.

SUPER PARK IN THE CENTRE OF HONG KONG. Considering land is SO scarce on Hong Kong island it is amazing that there, right in the middle of town, is a super little park. Yes it is mostly man made but that doesn't matter when it provides cool shade under its trees and an excellent covered aviary filed with exotic birds. Further down it's slopes you'll find small lakes, waterfalls and a small Olympic themed auditorium. It can be easily accessed from the beside the Peak Tram station and has easy access to the centrally located Admiralty Metro station. A great place to sit and be cool when it's hot on Hong Kong island.

Ensure you visit the aviary. The park is a true oasis within the bustlng city of Hong Kong.Our kids loved the playground as it was a good "reset" for them.The aviary was also wonderful as the amount of birds and comfortable walk through was a nice break away. All areas were beautifully landscaped and clean. A must-do in Hong Kong!
Hong Kong Park. You wouldn't expect to find such a lovely park in the middle of a city. It was very clean, tidy and well kept. The walk through aviary is a must.

Pretty and tranquil park. Lovely, tranquil and pretty park in the middle of Central district, Hog Kong, surrounded by the skyscrapers which Hong Kong is famous for. A bit like a very small Central Park.
Nice place to go to get away from the intensity of KH, go on a Sunday to see HK residents out for a picnic (no males, they're at work).

Green and tranquil. You cannot visit HK without taking time off to visit the Park. Beautiful greenery of various types, tropical flowers and plants and all labelled in English. Water lakes with Coy and turtles, waterfalls and a botanical museum and Aviary. A wonderful Sunday Stroll through it and you may see several wedding parties taking pictures.

afternoon stroll after far east cruise. Clean, and most interesting park with massive aviary, and horticultural, aquatic, and botanic sections.
The water features [ a favourite of mine] enhance the place and as it contains the local registry office, weddings regularly seen here.
Go for the gardens. There's also a zoo, but the gardens and tea museum are better parts of the park. Conservatory includes both native and non-native plants.

Green space amid the buildings. We found this park peaceful with many interesting features including a bird aviary, Tea Museum, lake and lovely plants. A great place to unwind and just enjoy watching locals enjoy the open spaces.
Oxygen in the middle of the city. Beautiful park with lots to see, you can walk in the tree tops in an outside Aviary. Had a bad experience in one of the restaurant s but I am sure it was a one off.

A lovely afternoon stroll. We meandered over to this park after the zoo and it was a very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours out in the sunshine. Th pond areas with the bountiful fish and turtles are a pleasure to gaze into. The lookout tower is very nice as is the aviary where you can see some beautiful birds relatively close up as well.
Beautiful park. a nice park in the center of the financial district in Hong Kong Island, you can rest and relax, small but pretty
Nicest park we saw in Hong Kong. See the park, the people, the birds in the Aviarium, the tea museum and lots mre in this nice little park.

The most inaccessible park I've ever been too!! . So we have 2 young children and a pram (stroller). This is in the most inaccessible park we've ever been too. I know most of Hong Kong is not pram/wheelchair friendly due to the landscape, but as lovely as this park is (very green, lots of interesting things to see!) we had to cut our visit short as carrying the pram up and down MANY MANY flights of stairs was killing us in the heat! The aviary was brilliant (and is accessible once inside) id recommend that. The fountains and gardens are lovely and peaceful too. But if you're travelling with young kids you might want to really plan out your route before entering the park!

Nice getaway in the middle of the city. It is very easy to get to - if you want a break from shopping at Admiralty you can just hop on the escalator up to the Park. I particularly enjoyed the aviary and greenhouse. You're also able to see the monument dedicated to the doctors who lost their lives fighting SARS. You'd probably be able to finish walking around it in a few hours.

Unexpected Oasis. Hong Kong Park is an amazing oasis within the hectic downtown area. I was blown away by how beautiful and well kept it was, along with the lovely flora and fauna. Highlights: - Koi ponds- Waterfalls- Butterflies! - Aviary (you have to check it out - very cool!)- Topiary (shaping bushes and plants into animal shapes)- Paths galore.Lastly, the park is immaculate. They do an amazing job of keeping the park clean and perfectly pristine. Even the bathrooms are clean! I highly recommend taking a stroll around Hong Kong Park. Great for people of all ages.

Fresh air in the concrete jungle. I am a local and I work in the area near the Hong Kong park. Access to the park: easiest way is to take the MTR to admiralty station, find the exit to Queensway (the Pacific Place exit is actually further away which you have to walk through the entire shopping mall). Once you are in Queensway, take the bridge to Pacific Place, go up the escalators and you will see sign pointing you to the HK Park. There will be many locals resting in the park during lunch on weekdays so if you want to have a more quiet time, you can go past 2pm on weekday or any time during weekends. Food - There is a Tea shop (which serves vegetarian dim sum) inside the Tea Museum, they are famous for their tea. It's not expensive, so it's a good spot for lunch or a quite bite. If you would like more substantial food, go to the other restaurant just across it's called L16, both outdoor and indoor seating. Enjoy yourself in the park, there are quite a lot to see and you will feel yourself surround by high rise buildings which you might not find anywhere else! Around the park - From there, you can take the bridge to Central and visit St John's Cathedral and have a drink in Lan Kwai Fong!

Great Park. Hong Kong park is a peaceful refuge in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Koi pond, walk in fountain, walk behind waterfall, aviary, children's playground and more. Great place to spend a short time or several hours. The grounds are clean and well kept with gardeners constantly tending to it.
An oasis in a busy city. The park is beautifully set out and if you sit for a while you can forget that you are in the middle of a very busy city.
AWESOME！. Hong Kong Park is free for admission fee, and you can see the beautiful birds, flowers and trees there.

Definitely worth a visit. I really like Hong Kong park, it's a tranquil little island of greenery in the bustle of Central. The aviary there is very nice indeed. There's a play area which is good for young children. Especially nice in cooler sunny weather. We visit whenever we are in HK with the children.

Peaceful and tranquil instead of shopping. this park was not built the last time I lived in Hong Kong so it was lovely to see some famous buildings restored and the facilities like the history of tea making is a great way to see the old tea pots and history of tea in the park as well as the Avery and other highlights worth a visit even to chill in the on site restaurant
Brilliant. Lovely park set in the middle of all the high rise buildings. Plenty to see including a wonderful aviary with a treetop walk.

Beautiful. Stunning park in the middle of a huge amount of high rise buildings in the central /admirality area of HK. Plenty of Epic views and photograph locations to be had here. There is a large walk through avary with 600 species of birds from all over the world flying round as you walk across platforms 10m in the air. Must visit location.

very pleasant interlude. We were walking from the star ferry near the Convention Centre all the way to the Peadv Tram on a warm morning. After stopping for tea at the Shangri La we walked through this equally refreshing park, Lots of fish and a lovely turtle dove

A breath of fresh air. Hong-Kong park is really a breath of fresh air in a city crowded with skyscrapers. You can cross a major part of the city through it while enjoying the most beautiful buildings of HKG
Anniversary holiday. Lovely gardens,Just a few minutes away from the crowds, Terrific aviary where you can walk among exotic birds, who are very tame.And all for free

relaxing.... Hong Kong is a very crowded, polluted by now. If you want to escape away from the midst of the busy city, you may relax and enjoy the scenery. The fantastic man made lake, koi fishes, beautiful flowers, WOW!

So much to see in so little space. Lovely Hong Kong Park.Nestled on the hillside between Central and Admiralty, Hong Kong Park is full of little gems. Not only is there the Tea House and museum, there is a lake full of koi carp where red eared terrapins sun bathe on the rocks, there are man-made waterfulls and a walk-in fountain in the fountain plaza.A climb up the steep steps brings you to both the conservatory for plant displays and the wonderfull walk through aviary with a vast amount of varid birds to view and photograph.

Great For Stop for Toddlers. We visited this park a few times during our 2 week stay in Hong Kong - great if you're travelling with toddlers (we had our twin 2.5 year olds with us). Great location (right off the MTR). Not very large park, but jammed with lots of things to do (as far as toddlers go). They have fountains that you can actually walk into; ponds full of turtles and Koi, waterfalls, Aviary, HUGE multi-layer playground, and what was most important for us: SHADE (we were travelling in the dead heat of HK Summer). Some days we made a special trip to the Park for the kids, other days, we strolled through it after visiting other closeby attractions. We liked it as it wasn't very packed or busy (of course that could be because we were the only ones crazy enough to be outside in the blistering heat!). The park was very clean, with many staff stationed at key points to help direct you to where you want to go. We were very grateful for this Park smack in the hustle and bustle of the City.

Lovely park. Hong Kong Park is located in the Central District and it's excellent for a stroll. The park features a maniacally perfect artificial lake with turtles and fish, kids areas and a museum with annexed charming tea house, unmissable!
an oasis. A small retreat in a very busy city. Dont miss the opportunity to stroll around and visit the big walk in "birdcage"

Relaxing and calming in the midst of the bustle. Here's a cool and calming place to take a break in when touring Hong Kong's different attractions. When you need to slow down and take a rest, here's the place to go.In the middle of our hectic day, we stopped by here to look at their landscape and aviary, and enjoy the overall scenery. The cool and quiet environment was very relaxing and refreshing.Nice to know there are quiet places you can relax in amid the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong shopping.

Birds, Koi Fish & Plants Oh My!. It's a park in the middle of hundreds of high-rises and bustling city life. Hong Kong Park is a must stop destination for a family visiting the region. Be prepared to do some carrying if you have a stroller! The Park is in the middle of a city built in the mountains and there are some inclines and other spots with only steps. The koi pond and fountain offers a beautiful relaxing site, along with the indoor humid and dry plant conservatory. The spot that stands out the most was definitely the aviary. My 18 month old went absolutely bonkers over the beautiful variety of birds flying overhead. Her reaction to the space made the visit worth while!

What a Gem. Catching the Ding Ding from Hong Kong Ferry to Cotton Tree Drive we walked through a shopping mall finally finding the park, which is what we had come to find.This park called Hong Kong Park which is completely free for us was the most enjoyable part of Hong Kong, it contains lovely water features, a conservatory and a very large walk through Aviary.Although we do not usually go to places where birds or animals are in captivity this aviary was very different to others that we have seen, you walk through at high level where feeders are placed so that you are able to view the birds close to, they have plenty of space and able to fly freely with true to life surroundings i.e. trees, ground covering plants etc...Well worth the visit, just across the road there is a zoological and botanical gardens and between these two points is the Garden Road Peak Road Terminus, which is a must on a clear day to view the city.
Lovely park. . Beautiful peaceful park. . There is a lovely waterfall in the park. Not far from city centre and next to a subway station.

A park in the middle of the hustle and bustle. We enjoyed our time in these manicured grounds. Very pleasant looking at the high rises and landscape from this park. We shot some really lovely photos too.

an escape from a noisy and polluted city. peaceful and beautiful. only I didn't find the tea shop where to sip my tea, but only a reastaurant. The tea museum was not that thrilling (I was looking forward to the tea) but it is free of charges!

Tranquility in the hustle and bustle of the city . Great for a late afternoon stroll. Visiting the aviary is a special experience as well - and climbing the tower with the winding staircase ends up in a great view of the cityscape.
An unexpected oasis. I stumbled across the Hong Kong Park on the way between Victoria Peak tram station and the Conrad hotel, a wonderful place to relax and mingle with local populus

Beautiful park, great view after sundown. A nice oasis in busy Hong Kong. In the evening, the park is very calm and you have a great view of the skyline, especially the Bank of China tower with its beautiful lighting scheme. Just remember to leave the park in time, it closes at 10 pm. We didn't and had to climb over a gate...

Small and steep but pretty. The park is not for the weak. Lots of steep walkways and stairs but very pretty. Very busy (as is most public space in HK) especially around the marriage registry. Good way to spend a morning.

a secret verdant gem. walking up to the tram idle away an hour or so admiring the serenity of the oasis of calm in Hong Kong. Some enchanting terrapins amused us as they clambered over each other on a rock
Great place to refresh the lungs. Lovely park with a waterfall and conservatory. Cafe is great to people watch, we drank plenty of Tsingtao.

Nice oasis. A lovely calming oasis near to the Peak tram. Had an enjoyable walk through and visited the aviary. Very nice exotic bids flying around and feeding at the many stations. Away from the noise, hustle and bustle... the calmness of the park may just be what you need :-)

Nice flower show. a big project from hk gov
they had prepared a big flower show here,
coz hk weather is very wet, many flower was died
but also still a good section for holiday

Great metropolitan park.. You would never know you were in the middle of Hong Kong except for the tall buildings peeking over the trees. Peaceful and serene, a good place to unwind for an hour or two with ponds, a waterfall, an aviary, and a tai chi area that people also use for yoga.
Dancing in the park. So special and so quiet plenty of activities to join in go and be mesmerised and put to shame by 90 year old who are just so fit in beautiful scenery and surrounds

A beautiful sanctuary in the middle of the city. As I was walking through the streets of Hong Kong, I came upon this park and spent a good deal of time walking around and taking photos. The landscaping is very pleasing and there was enough to see to spend an hour or two here. There's a free aviary within the park that had a lot of tropical birds flying around. There are also a few little lakes/ponds stocked with koi. If you're looking for a break from the city, check out this little gem.
Lock cha tea house.. go for the tea. Go for the dim sum. Go for that conversation you might have with the nice gentleman who purchases the tea for sale in the shop.

Nice place to escape the intensity of Hong Kong.. We went here just to walk around and decompress from the hustle and bustle of the big city. Beautiful gardens,and fountains with lots of nice areas to rest and contemplate the views,and beauty of the place. There is a small Zoo to see as well,but it is not like a nature park type zoo. Just animals in cages. If you want to find a place to relax in the Central area,this is it.

An oasis. This is a must to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. Very clean and plenty of sitting places. Make sure you walk all around and cross the road/take the underpass to see the birds and monkeys.

Great to spent an hour or two. Although this park is clearly man made, it is a wee gem in the middle of the frenetic activity which is central Hong Kong. The trees sing with birdsong, even before you have reached the excellent walk through aviary. The lakes and waterfalls are most relaxing (good feng shui?). Spoke to a couple of locals who go daily for lunch. The conservatory lovely as well. Good exercise as quite hilly!

Visit the Edward Youde Aviary!. The park itself isn't bad, if very hilly, but the highlight was the Edward Youde Aviary. The conservatory wasn't bad either.The aviary, however, was exceptional. The Wikipedia article says they have 80 species, but I'd estimate I saw "only" 40 or so. If you walked through and ignored the animals, you could get through in about two minutes. We spent about an hour there.

A slice of serenity in the city. A walk through Hong Kong Park offered a slice of serenity amongst the bustling crowds and their ever increasing drive for capitalism and more bling. Immaculately kept greens, lakes and wooded areas are shadowed by glass monoliths emblazoned with the likes of Merrill Lynch.

In the heart of the city.... A great park located in the Heart of the City ! Great things to see especially with the kids... However, I don't think it's a priority to visit it but it's definitely nice to go on your free time !
pretty!. the park was surrounded by buildings but the air was fresh. it's very clean, well maintained, well designed, very beautiful. Oh and there are some turtles too swimming freely in the pond.

Beautiful park amidst skyscrapers. The Hong Kong Park is definitely worth visiting as it is a beautully laid out park in the middle of the busy business district of Admiralty with waterfalls, koi ponds, flowers and plants. Als the L16 restaurant is located in this park where good food is served.
relaxing breath in town. you got greenery, flowers, birds and fishes,waterfall in small garden, it's just a break to calm our mind in busy city, entry free with a nice tea museum worth to visit.
afteroon good option. Very well kept park where you can go and read a book and watch people go by (if you can handle the heat in the summer)

Hours can be spent here.. The park even with the many many people that fit in there is quiet, with well thought out attractions. It is a real peoples park. Plenty of different activities and borders main roads.
Must visit. Been to Hong Kong a number of times and had never visited this park before, but loved it spent an hour here away from the hustle and bustle, lovely trees birds and fish.

Beautiful and fun. A very attractive park, with nice greenery set against the dramatic backdrop of Admiralty's skyscrapers. Stunning on a clear day. There are terrapins in the ponds and a worthwhile walk-through aviary. Definitely worth visiting when in the area.
Beautiful bird enclosure. Free of charge and walking around inside the bird enclosure with exotic birds everywhere is a great experience

An oasis in a big city. This is quite a large park, about 23 acres, with a pretty fountain, flowers, and a pond. When you're sick of the crowds and the neon, go here. There's a Tea Museum if you like that sort of thing.

lovely place to relax. It is a big park for family, couples and kids. The kids area offer special sand dome for children! My daughter loves playing that very much. It would be better if there are more "sand tool" available. The children need to wait for a long time to play it. The slide there is rather long and exciting for the children. The lake is very big and nice. I like to see the waterfall too even it is man-made. Many people enjoy spending time in the park to read, relax, have a sandwich.... you won't feel you are in HK in some degree. life would be less stressful inside at once. There is a big water fountain and the water would come from the top or a resting area. Many people like to go inside. It is cool and fun but you need to beware that you would get wet.. you can also see birds and a greenhouse in the park.

Absolutely wonderful for kids. The park is one of the best parks I've seen. The play area has six large areas and is great way for a kid to spend some time. The Aviary has a lot of interesting birds. The pond has plenty of turtles and fish to watch. Overall, it is a great park to wander through. Even though we were only in Hong Kong for less than a week, we went to this park twice.
Nice waks. A great place to walk or chill out in such a vibrant bustling city. Plenty to do and see here. Clean walking in areas and plenty of wildlife to see.

An oasis in the urban milieu. Hong Kong Park is wonderful. Aside from the greenery and wonderful areas to explore, the enclosed aviary was AMAZING. Even those who aren't bird enthusiasts will find this an amazing experience (free of charge). And then there are the various gardens etc. This is a must-see when visiting Hong Kong.

One of the best parks. In my opinion this is one of the best parks. Not only is it beautiful, but there is an amazing aviary full of birds, some really cool water features and ponds full of fish and turtles. It is a must do when in HK. Prepare to spend an hour or 2, longer if you like the aviary.

It was okay. I visited HK Park on a Thursday afternoon.It was a great place to kill time. (I wanted to take the Peak Tram but the lines were still too long.) The plants, fountains, water falls were very beautiful so I had a wonderful view while waiting. It was a fairly hot day then but it was tolerable underneath the trees.The only thing I disliked was how secluded it was, behind the buildings. I was staying in TST then, so I got to the area via the MTR and walked the rest of the way. It was my first day so the easiest way to get there without getting lost was to walk.It was still okay. If I had more time, I would have spent longer there.

Great place to spend an afternoon. There is no shortage of things to see, beautiful plants, amazing animals, all while overlooking the skyscrapers of downtown HK. Also, of you are staying anywhere near LKF, you can walk through the park to get to the Victoria Tram, maybe drink a beer on the way!

Great escape. HK Park is a great little park in the centre. A nice walk from Central or Admiralty and a very refreshing change from the concrete of the buildings. Make sure you visit the Aviary and climb the viewing tower. The tai chi gardens are peaceful and well landscaped if a bit dated. The ponds section is always busier. Good tea/bar options means its a good rest spot

Small, multi-level park near the zoo. This is a pretty piece of landscaped retreat that one can enjoy amidst a busy. The day I went it was pretty crowded, and a little touristy too I guess, since it is located in the heart of HK. So if you are looking for complete peace or silence, this is not place, you should visit Chi Lin Nunnery. Otherwise HK park is a great place to catch a breather during a busy day. There are small shops / vendors selling interesting knick-knacks.

Amazing space. Amazing green space in the middle of Hong Kong, and all for free, the walk through aviary is brilliant ! Saw some exotic birds . The rest of the park is lovely and deserves a look . Don't miss it !

Beautiful Hidden Garden... I remember back where I was doing an Art piece in high school and the Hong Kong Park was one of my greatest inspirations. I had to come back several times and each time is just very peaceful. Whether it is sunny, gloomy, rainy or windy - it is always a perfect time there.

Green among bricks. The Hong Kong Park is very close to Central Station, also near the Peak Tram Station and it is definitely worth visiting. There are fountains, trees and also a huge cage where one can enter and look at many different spieces of birds. It has also a little tower on the top of that one can have a beautiful view of the skyscrapers. It is a good place to visit just to escape the chaotic life of the city for a few hours.

Oasis in the city. A short walk from the Peak Tram terminus is this wonderful park full of different things to see and do. Once inside you would barely know that you were in the heart of a major city. Apart from the aviary and conservatory (see separate reviews) this park offers numerous tree lined walks and a large series of lakes. These are teeming with fish and numerous turtles. There is a wonderful waterfall here which you can walk behind. There is also a viewing tower in a double helix design that can be climbed for wonderful views and a clock tower. An enjoyable break from the hectic pace of the city.

Beautiful Park. We headed through Hong Kong park on our way to the useless Peak Tram. The park was a lovely place with couples and families everywhere enjoying a really nice open space which is something unusual in high-rise Hong Kong. Well worth an hour.

Peaceful Green Space. Well worth spending an hour or so in this piece of green oasis in the middle of this bustling city. It is free and never too crowded. Better still, it is well looked after and open throughout the day and evening.

Bird Park inside!. Such a great park with playgrounds for the kids and a spacious area. Make sure you find the aviary for the birds which closes around 5pm. It is a great experience to see the beautiful colored birds as they fly around you and great shots for any photographer!
Cute. Weird little city park. An oasis of quiet in an extremely urban environment. Skyscrapers as a backdrop to the greenness of the trees.

Loved it!. Lots of stuff happening at the park, including an aviary with tons of exotic birds, many of which were really friendly/social with humans. Some nice views of the peak and surrounding buildings.

Worth a visit. Well worth a visit to get some peace and quiet from the busy Hong Kong life, lovely ornamental lake and waterfall very well kept gardens. We never had time to visit all the places as it was just getting dark as we got there. The bats were just starting to show over the water . I would definitely visit again. It is on a hill so expect a little climb.

An oasis of peace in a hectic city. We relaxed here for an hour or two one afternoon and it was a wonderful break from the hustle and bustle around us. The park is not large but it is absolutely lovely and well worth a visit.
Peaceful place. Excellent place to get a break from the city's hustle.You can see tons of animals and people from different places.

A couple of hours. You can spend a whole afternoon or just walk through, depending on the time you have. The tea museum is interesting and the aviary is fun. The Japanese restaurant is OK. I always enjoy seeing the wedding couples. It's just a nice, close, quiet escape and a good way to get to the peak tram station from admiralty mtr station.
Hong Kong Central Park!. This park is much smaller than Central Park in New York but it has a lot to offer. Beautiful views and photo opportunities and at sunset the park is magical.

An oasis in a busy city. Hong Kong Park is a beautiful park located in the very heart of busy Hong Kong. It is located mostly in Central and is available from Pacific Place Mall in Admiralty. Getting there is easy as you just get off the MTR train in Admiralty and make your way through to Pacific Place Mall and follow the signs. The park itself is a little slice of soothing nature with some great fountains and quiet ponds. Wonderful place to take a quiet break from shopping.

lots of green. Hong Kong is generally considered as a small and busy city with all concrete building around without much of green. This park is considered a great area for Hongkonger to seek for some green and fresh air in the city. It is a good spot to go rest with your lunch box or takeout!!!

Pink Flamingo's Galore. We spent an amazing afternoon visiting the Hong Kong Park. At the time of our visit there was maintenance being carried out but while this meant that some of the roads were closed we were still able to enjoy most of the Park. The exhibits are well presented and the Park is amazing. We enjoyed the beautiful water features and found the rest rooms to be neat and clean. The big draw card for me was the Pink Flamingo's and I was not disappointed. They were a stunning sight amongst the rich greenery and lake setting.You will not regret taking time out to enjoy the tranquility of Hong Kong Park from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city.

Beautiful park surrounded by skyscrapers. Finally got a chance to visit Hong Kong Park, which is located near Pacific Place and the Admiralty MTR station. Take your camera with you and you can see some of the beautiful plants, birds, fish, and turtles, which are all nestled in this modern city. My favorite place was the Conservatory, which had many types of plants set in different environments (dry and humid) and the Aviary House with its many types of birds flying around you. Best thing about Hong Kong Park was that it was free! Nice way to spend your afternoon and see something different in Hong Kong.
Nice peaceful. I nice place to wonder around and enjoy some peace and quiet in the middle of Kowloon. A great place to people watch or just rest.

Oasis in Central. It's always a pleasure to walk through Hong Kong Park, coming up from Admiralty by the escalator from Pacific Place. Beautiful tropical plants greenhouse, very nice ponds with goldfish and turtles, the Tea Museum (with a beautiful gift shop), a small restaurant with nice terrace for a drink or snack, the open air concert stage, the trees and flowers, the many birds - one could almost forget one is in the middle of one of the world's busiest cities (well, the Bank of China Tower and Cheung Kong Center tower over the Park). On Christmas eve, I walked through the Park with my little daughter, and we could listen in to the Christmas concert that was performed in the Park and broadcast live on TV and Radio 4. Very nice experience!
Brilliant. Great place to spend an afternoon. Although much is man made the park is a delight to wander around with many diverse elements e.g. Aviary, Conservatory, tea museum. All free and central.

hong kong park. what a hidden treasure in the busyness of hong kong, you just walk around the corner and there it is a little paradise of a park which is just a treasure of different wonderslike a small lake with the tame fish in it and the big waterfall behind itwith the caves behind it and the small outside theatre thingy and the small museum bit, but the best bit of it all is the big avery in the middle of it which is free. theres a few restaurants in the park so you can have lunch aswell and when you come out of the park on the westside you exit out opposite the peak tram station so you could spend the morning in the park have lunch and go to the peak in the afternoon and make a day of it.
Nature at it's best. All I can say it is very picturesque, you do not feel you are near a city. It is not overly busy with tourists either.

Do not miss this beautiful park!. Due to the student demonstrations in November, we almost decided not to go to Central but were very glad we did as we had heard rave reviews. I could not stop taking photos of the stunning skyscrapers surrounding and dwarfing the beautiful greenery. We found the Aviary enchanting and the exotic birds very accessible. The Museum of Tea was outstanding, as well, but we had counted on having tea there and then discovered that we had needed prior reservations. We ended up having a picnic as the weather was lovely and got to people-watch as we were eating by the gorgeous lake surrounded by very colorful flowers. We even saw a wedding party rushing to have their photos taken. A lovely and memorable day!

Nice park but smakl and crowded. hong kong park is nice, well laid out with interesting plsnts and water features, however it is also realitively small and when i visted on Sunday it was about as busy as thr nearby pacific place shopping centre so not a tranquil break from the city i was looking for.

Get away from the city while being in the city. Even if you're only in Hong Kong for a few days, do spend an hour or two taking a stroll through Hong Kong Park. It's a wonderful pool of calm in the hustle-bustle of Central District. In addition to places to walk, sit, and relax, there are also a delightful aviary with many species of Southeast Asian birds and a pretty decent greenhouse. Educational, fun, and best of all completely free. Hong Kong's small but graceful answer to New York's Central Park.
The lungs of Hong kong. Take a peaceful stroll,though the park and take in the peace and tranquility of the place. Adidas the bustle and hiatus if the city this is a haven of peace and calm.

Spent the afternoon exploring this place!. We had a lovely time exploring this park one lazy sunny afternoon in Hong Kong. We had started the morning going up to Victoria Peak and stumbled upon this park after coming off the Victoria Peak tram in the afternoon.I loved sitting on a bench, reading and people watching. It was a very relaxing and strange place to be in the center of Hong Kong. Don't forget to look out for the turtles, they are hiding everywhere in the pond! This turned out to be one of my favorite places in HK!

A little oasis t. this is a little oasis in the centre of Hong kong Island. Near by 'central' mtr station. Very relaxed. There is a viewing deck, gardens, and lakes and other various things within the park a nice place to take a break (have a sit down) through a manic day as a tourist in Hong kong!!
see the big building around you.. a nice park with lot of big building.good for the one who looking for inspirations.bring jacket when night comes.
Wonderful aviary. Serene park with lots of water features. Nice place to wander through and the aviary is great for anyone, well planned, well cared for and ample space for the birds. Just lovely

Small oasis. After returning from the Peak on Peak Tram we came to this beautiful garden. Just cross the road as soon as you exit from the Peak Tram Terminal and walk under the Cotton Tree Dr overpass, you will come to a gate to this park in 2 minutes.It is clean, very well maintained and free, so is a perfect place to wonder around with kids. There is a play ground for kids close to the gate we entered. It seems to be bit old but well maintained.There are many water features and ponds with colorful fish and tortoises. We climbed the 108 steps up the observation tower and had a good view of the city buildings over the tree tops.There is an Aviary in the park. It is small (15 -20 mins worth) but very nicely built with an elevated walkway. The Aviary closes at 5 pm.We couldn't find any place to buy snacks or food around the park other than the restaurant (Thai restaurant) in the park, so think about your food if you are not planing to go to the restaurant.This is a good place to visit if you are in HK Island, particularly after coming back from the Peak. Park is quite close to both Central and Admiralty MTR stations.
Beautiful. A beautiful park and very well kept gardens! An excellent place to have a picnic lunch and great place for a quiet walk!The Peek tram and entry is near a park exit.

Pleasant Escape from the surrounding Bustling City. The Hong Kong Park provided a welcome bit of greenery and fresh air. It was perfectly lovely. It was a little slice of heaven in a large bustling city. There were water fountains, palm trees, an enormous koi pond, turtles, and a massive aviary to enjoy birds and other wildlife. The park was beautiful and was a great escape from the surrounding bustling city. There were dozens of turtles basking in the sun on the rocks. It was incredible. I truly enjoyed our mini visit to Hong Kong Park.

Pretty & Fun. I went exploring with my little brother, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We took the longest route and saw a lot of cool scenery. The waterfall was very pretty, as was the collection of birds in the aviary. It was cool being so close to so many birds! The playgrounds were also kid-friendly.

Lovely park. Made a return visit to this park, I enjoyed it so much. I'm not a fan of zoos but the aviary here is at least large and beautifully looked after. Also take a stroll down to the pond to watch the turtles basking on rocks in the sun. A lovely green space for when you tire of shopping malls and need some peace and rejuvenation!
A pleasant surprise. We accidentally stumbled on this park - but thoroughly enjoyed strolling through the gardens. The aviary well worth a visit

amazing green space in the heart of hk. always surprises me how much green space there is in hk and how immaculately it is all kept. always people picking up trash and sweeping. i don't know a single park in the US that is this clean. great place to walk around.

A small park in Admiralty. The Park used to the site which housed the British army barracks in Admiralty. It was turned into a park when the British retreated before the hand-over in 1997. Quite a fair sum of money has been spent in converting the army barracks into a green park. Ponds and waterfalls are incorporated to add in more colour. But due to the topographic feature of the site, i.e. hilly and on a slope, the park lacks the space and environment of a lush green park that one would normally expect from a newly built one.The two key attractions of the park are 1) the Flagstaff House; amd 2) the aviary. The Flagstaff House was the residence of the Commander of HK British Armed Forces. It has now been turned into a museum of Chinese clay teapots. The collection, which is quite reputable, has been donated by the a wealthy local Chinese. Vast amount of time and money had been spent by him in gathering the collection over several decades. Go there if you want to know more about Chinese teas and teapots. There is also a teahouse right next to the museum when you can practice what you have learnt from the museum visit immediately.The aviary is biggest of its kind here in HK. It has more than a thousand brids and animals of different varieties which roam around freely inside. It is spacioulsy laid out, and the setting has been carefully designed and tuned to make it resembles to a stroll along the forest, rather than go pass a line of cages of birds as as in many zoos.You can think about spending about two hours at the HK Park if you are interested in Chinese tea or birds.

free park. lovely park to walk around and couldn't believe it was free entrance, with a botanical garden and aviary to visit as well as a lovely pond with fish and terrapines - there's also a small zoo but we didn't have time to visit it

Beautiful, tranquil oasis in Hong Kong. You can enjoy the greenery and tranquility here and still have an eye on HK's sleek and modern skyscrapers in the Central district.
There's a lot of colour and peace and tranquility in here. It's just a 2-minute walk from the Peak Tram station and adjacent to the Museum of Teaware. Definitely worth a visit.

A quiet refuge in a very busy city. Hong Kong Park is a delightful refuge from the bustle of the city. Located near the Conrad and Marriott Hotels and up from Central the park has great flora, wonderful waterworks and is a great shortcut over to the Victoria Peak Tram. The fountains are lovely and the pond has great turtles and koi. The Tea Ware Museum is at one end and the tram at the other. Plenty of benches to relax on and the vibe is one of relaxation.
