Overcast. Would have been great in fine weather, but unfortunately we had rain and wind and could not see a great deal. The trip up by coach and down by tram was good.
Pretty. Very pretty and nice photo opportunity. Able to block out the pollution of the adjacent roads for a bit.
lovely. fantastic aviary, peaceful park. clean toilets (!). interesting little teawares museum in an old colonial building (Flagstaff House)

A great little park in the middle of the city. This is a nice find right outside the door of our hotel (Island Shangr-la). The park is very urban but nicely done. It is a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of downtown HK. A nice water feature and some good walks. It seems very safe and pleasant.

Great view of Central at night. Worth a visit if you have the time. There is a tea house and exhibits. From the Peak Tram Terminal - you can walk through the Park towards Pacific Place Mall. The view of Central (and the Bank of China building) is noteworthy at night. The Park is safe.

Great city park and wonderful aviary. We stumbled upon this park while walking around the Central area. It's has a small lake with fish and turtles and fountains that are nicely laid out. The best part is the aviary where you can see beautiful birds flying around and snacking on fruits as well as some exotic birds in cages. The park is huge and can take a while to walk around. The top section of the park is right next to the Peak Tram station so you can visit the park on your way to Victoria's Peak.

Beautiful and peaceful. A great place to relax and have a breath of fresh air in the middle of the hectic Hong Kong streets. Definitely recommend for families with children, couples, joggers, tourists and pretty much everybody who needs to take a little break.
Amazing aviary. beautiful park near admiralty station, massive walk through aviary,carp ponds and fountains, the tea museum and tea rooms and much more,access to the peak tram and zoo is close by.

Looked onto from our apartment. This is great park nestled into the hustle and bustle of Hong kong. This was our 4 th time in Hong kong - yet we had never been into the park only walked past. The pink flamingos are crazy....

Very relaxing. After a hectic weeks work, a trip to the Peak followed by Xmas shopping I relaxed in the Hong Kong Park.
Very relaxing with lovely plants and water features. Most enjoyable.
Surprise. In the heart of the city, surrounded by concrete towers, this park is surprisingly peaceful - but it was very busy when we visited on New Years Day.

Fantastic. Been here today and lived it . Great gardens and ponds. Not to mention the brides!
Worth the trip before getting on the tram
Great park in the city.. Ks Lo Gallery and Museum of Teaware were interesting. Tidbits and Tea served in tea house were great too. The staff was happy to share their knowledge about tea.

Lovely Escape from the Hustle & Bustle. Lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. There is a large bird aviary to walk through which made for a nice little adventure away from all the crowds. The pictures here basically say it all, but if you've been to Hong Kong a few times and haven't yet seen the park - or if you have a free day for a slower pace - definitely give the park a visit.
Fascinating, exotic birds, good paths to walk.. Plenty to see, friendly people in a relaxed space.Very clean easy to walk around. Provides great views and good photo opportunities.

Great park!. The highlight for us was the Edward Younde aviary. They have some caged larger birds but the walk through exhibit with the freely flying birds was something really special. If you are a photographer, take your big camera.

Tranquil Park. Take a stroll through this peaceful park and be delighted buy what you will find in this bus city. We were there in winter but I can imagine how it must give you a pleasant reprieve from the hot summer days!

Very clean, nice park with plenty to see. The Aviary is definitely worth a visit, and the park itself will have you taking plenty of photos. On the side of a hill so there are plenty of stairs to climb, but caters for disabled with ramps.

Hong Kong as a Destination for australians. Travelled to Hongkong with a family of 2 kids and 2 adults. Had never been to Hong Kong before so was glad to come but don't feel the need to return again. We stayed at a great hotel in Mongkok called the Langham place which was excellent.Hong Kong itself was pretty ordinary. Really just a big trip to a shopping mall. It had the same shops over and over and over again. If you are from Sydney then it's just like walking through chatswood chase over and over and over again.I'm not a shopper so found it entertaining but not something I'd come back for. In terms of a reputation as a great shopping place I'm really not sure where it comes from. Nothing was particularly cheap certainly nor worth travelling for. We were looking for some cameras and electronics and while pricing it we found we could buy them cheaper online in Australia so quite hilariously ordered her camera from an Australian web site. The only stuff that seemed cheap was small things and cheap trinkets which really I wouldn't bother with. Some brands of sneakers seemed a bit cheaper.Had some good food but nothing that blew my mind.The locals were lovely but the mainlanders new money rude and pushy.All in all a vibrant, busy city ok for a stop over but lacks the culture and sophistication of a Rome, Paris or London I might stay in the airport hotel over night to break a trip but wouldn't bother comming back again otherwise

Beautiful, tranquil oasis with excellent attractions within. This is a real find in hectic Hong Kong. Reached easily from Admiralty Station--follow the signs for the Queensway. It is also easily accessed from the Pacific Place mall. The park has several great attractions within it--the Flagstaff house, a nice conservatory and an amazing free flight aviary. This is a great add on to a day in Central or a trip up to Victoria Peak, as the cable car station is adjacent to the park.

Escape the noise. Great park in the middle of the city, you can escape from the noise and crowd very easily. The park is very well set up and maintaind, additionally you can go into a huge birth garden (free entrance) where you can watch beautifull births.

Nature in the City. Hong Kong park is a lovely, well maintained, tranquil spot above Admiralty...a short walk from the JW Marriott, Conrad, etc. Well worth a visit, to escape the bustle of the city ...highly recommend ...
Green space among the skyscrapers. Lovely park. Very restful during a long day of site seeing. Saw couples getting wedding photos taken. Flagstaff house tea museum is also located here.

A beautiful park in the midst of Hong Kong's business center. In the vicinity of the Peak Tram entrance and in the midst of Hong Kong's Central business district sits this lovely and tranquil park. You can enjoy the greenery and tranquility here and still have an eye on HK's sleek and modern skyscrapers in the Central district. On a nice day and near lunch time, you will see the well dressed office workers enjoying the sun and their lunch during their lunch break here as well.

Nice park in the middle of the city. Something here for everyone. Waterfall, lake, koi carp, aviary, Olympic square, observation tower, museum of teaware... What??? You heard - a museum dedicated to the history of tea making in China and the various ways of making and serving tea, with examples of teaware through the dynasties.If that's not your thing, try the exhibits of Chinese seals (printing chops, not the performing type).All this surrounded by some of the most modern high rise buildings on the planet.

Gorgeous Garden in the middle of busy Hong Kong. The Hong Kong Park is a beautiful, beautiful garden! It has fountains, waterfalls, flowers, trees, plants, fish, terrapins - everything you'd want from a picturesque little park. There's a lot of colour and peace and tranquility in here. It's just a 2-minute walk from the Peak Tram station and adjacent to the Museum of Teaware. Definitely worth a visit.

Certainly worth a visit. Calm serenity in busy HK. Don't miss the Aviary. Very clean, lovely water features, very relaxing.Easy walking although some steep inclines.Not been here before, despite 6 trips to HK.

An Oasis in HK. Amid all the high rises and shopping malls, we were surprised pleasantly with the tranquility and beauty of this park. It's not a big park but has a beautiful pond and shady trees. The green scenery with the high rise concrete and glass in the back drop provide a great photo shoot opportunities.A great place to visit and relax for an hour or so.

A very well maintained park. There were quite a few very nice artificial waterfalls in the park. It was really nice that the entrance fee to see the plants exhibit was free. There was an area to see some cactus as well. Very impressed to see such a nice park in the middle of busy Hong Kong.
~great place. A great and place to enjoy but location is a bit far away, loved this park and will go again there. walking, relaxing and seeing the Conservatory .relex within on one day
Loved the aviary!. Well worth the visit just to see the aviary. Great atmosphere - super photo-opportunities. Really enjoyed our visit.
Great for strolls. This Park is very safe and clean. In fact, we saw several couples getting wedding pictures taken in the park. Several fountains/pools, an aviary and beautiful trails.

Nice ride and a lovely view.. We went on the tram ( the ques can be long). the view from the top is wonderful. Kept reminding us of the Statue of Christ in Rio de Janeiro. The children enjoyed it very much. We had lunch at the peak. There is quite a number of restaurants.
Beautiful. Beautiful in the middle of the city. Great place to walk and relax right in the middle of the skyline. I like this place.
Not to be missed. Hong Kong park has a walk through bird avery water falls, pretty walks and a cafe definitely worth a visit

A little piece of heaven. This park is situated right in the middle of central Hong Kong and is surrounded by the city skyscrapers giving it an unreal quality. Beautiful gardens with waterfalls and lakes and plenty of peace and quiet. Quite a contrast to the busy city streets that surround it.
Nice Park to visit.. Nice place to hang out and meet the locals.Most people were friendly but I mostly stayed to myself.Sometimes I got the feeling Americans werent welcome.Hmmmm

Outstanding park in the middle of the city. An oasis of calm in the middle of frenetic Hong Kong. We walked through this exceptionally well maintained park to reach the Peak Tram from our hotel. It was immaculate, with beautiful trees and plans, an aviary, a tea house, fountains and so much more that we didn't have time to explore. A wonderful place to relax and enjoy nature

Great Place to Visit. A great and place to enjoy but location is a bit far away, loved this park and will go again there. walking, relaxing and seeing the Conservatory and Aviary are best things to do there.

Oasis in the heart of the city. As a park, it isn't that special. But its location is what makes it special. I usually pass through Hong Kong Park from Admiralty MTR to take the Peak tram. But when you have time, it'd be nice to have a walk there and relax. Features include Artificial Lake, Conservatory, Aviary, Fountain Plaza (in which you could "enter" the fountain and be surrounded by water) and Museum of Tea Ware which was the historical Flagstaff House. Inside the K.S. Lo Gallery there is a nice vegetarian tea house called Lock Cha Tea House. Atmosphere and food there are great. There is also a thai/western restaurant called L16 in the park. You could buy snacks/drinks at the snack bar outside L16.Apart from plants, you could see birds, koi fish and tortoises in the park. Encircled by the city, the park is quite a treasure that provides a break from the busy city life.

Great concept of park in the middle of city. Talking about Central Hong Kong, many people never recommend HK Park to visit. Maybe because its difficult-to-reach location, albeit strategic, and maybe because people would opt for Victoria Peak-Madame Tussaud package than HK Park. You should enter this park via backdoor of a building opposite the street of exit A on Central MTR station (just ask the guards, they relatively have fair English). You may also access this park via other gate, from Admiralty MTR station.You would be surprised about how park is well-maintained; and how wonderful it could relax your mind. And you could enjoy this ambience free! You could also enjoy some parts of this park, like conservatory, aviary park, the lake, and many more... I like the aviary part, since they have very large collection of birds there (but I think, they have to pay attention to people who bring telescope into the aviary street, because they are sometimes annoying other visitors).

A Gem in the Heart of the City. This wonderful place is a quiet enclave with something for everyone to enjoy. On this warm December afternoon the locals were out in force making the most of the facility. I was amused by the flocks of photographers hunting butterflies around a small lake with all the dedication of National Geographic staff on assignment to some far flung corner of the earth. Wedding photographers too seem to use the venue, which is not surprising given that there is a Marriage Registration Office in the park. The park is scenic with a number of facilities that are worth experiencing. My wife and I were traveling with a four year old, so we made a beeline for the children's playground, which was well designed, and comprehensive. I recommend the Hong Kong Park to anyone wanting to escape the bustle of the city for a while.

Be sure to see the Conservatory and Aviary. Most tourist skip through this park. If you like plants and birds, you should go see it. The location is convenient. Get off the MTR at Admiralty station. There are many ways to reach the park from the station, including a good stroll through the Pacific Place Mall.Once in the park, it is a nice place away from the busyness of the city. Be sure to walk up to higher ground where you will find a conservatory that features desert cacti as well as tropical rainforest plants. There is well designed air separation curtain between these two environments. From there, go to the aviary. You will get to walk through a garden with free flying birds. Bring a camera with a telephoto or a good zoom lens for some great bird photos.

Very nice aviary in the middle of the park. We took a walk in Hong Kong park after coming down from The Peak, on the way Admirality MTR station. It was surprising that the park is very nicely maintained.It also has a very nice aviary in the middle of the park, which is home to more than 600 birds. The aviary is very clean and very nice, and there was a sign that says the railing are disinfected 4 times a day. It's also free. A very nice visit away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. I really enjoyed Hong Kong park and the aviary. If nearby, I will definitely visit again.

wonderful oasis in the middle of city. wonderful green oasis in the middle of city, great to chill out away from the crowds and heat. Lovely walking areas with different things to look at, like an aviary.
Beautiful. There's a bird sanctuary, tea house, and museum among other things. We were there in mid September the day before typhoon Kalamaegi. Man it was hot and wildly humid but worth it.
Tranquil in the city. Spend some time wondering around and notice all the little details, this is a place of peace in one of the busiest cities, take your lunch and find a spot to enjoy it.

Pretty and green. Staying nearby and wanting to bird watch this was one of the few options within the main city.
It has a lovely lake and lots of interesting trees and plants.
An oasis. An oasis in a very busy city. Lively to take time out and wander through the aviary! Wonderful. Then a cocktail in the restaurant in the garden.

all in all a very touristic site. Of course: you have a great view from the top but unfortunately you even find a mall there which makes the place pretty busy. Looking for some nature you can experience the round walk which takes you about an hour. If you hope finding a kind of trail you will find out very soon that the way is made of concrete and even the side walls are reinforced with even more concrete. In fact this is no place you have to visit before you die. ;-) Better meet your friends in one of the roof top bars and enjoy a beer.
An oasis of calm. This lovely park with its waterfalls, lake and free flying aviary offers a welcome escape from the high rises and crowds of Hongkong.

Amazing. After 8 trips, this was the first time I had the opportunity to visit HK Park and what a find. The aviary was amazing, even if I did get swooped on by birds when I first entered. Plenty to see and do at the park, but always a good place to go and just relax.
Quiet spot on the island. If you need a quiet moment, or want to watch some birds, visit the park in an otherwise very busy place.

A little bit of tranquility in a bustling city.. Stumbled on this park after accidentally stumbling through the zoo. It's right near the Peak Tram station (at the bottom). Very green and very clean. We were quite amazed at how quiet it was in this park right in the middle of an extremely busy city. It was good to sit down and have a rest after doing a lot of walking.

Nice place to spend morning. Aviary was very nice. Pretty birds and not very crowded. Park was quiet and peaceful. lots to see for everyone. Lots of stairs for morning work out and grounds were super clean. Nice tea museum and restaurant in the park. Free to walk around the grounds.

A Bright Lung in the City. A good place to the local Chinese with their families relaxing at weekends and not leaving a ton of rubbish as happens in England. It is like an oasis in the desert but substitute a vibrant energetic city and you get the picture. A must just to sit for a while to wind down for a bit.
Tranquil. A beautiful and tranquil spot amidst the chaos of the city. Remarkably uncrowded as well. Lovely in every respect.

Nice walk after Victoria Peak. Once you come back from Victoria Peak with the train it can be nice to have a walk in the park which is a couple of minutes away. Nothin amazing, just if you have some spare time.

Calm in a storm. This is a wonderful park in Hong Kong city. It is a lovely place to relax and spend the day or just an hour if thats all you have. There are lakes, waterfalls, tearoom and lots of places to explore. If like me your not a fan of walking around busy cities with lots of people this park provides a sanctuary from the chaos. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Hong Kong, just picture the ideal city park then visit here and you won't be disappointed.

Lovely gardens. Once you have climbed the hill to get there you need a rest. Great animal enclosures and beautiful gardens. This would be a good place if you are travelling with young children to let them let off a bit of steam. Plenty of space for them to run around.

serenity in the city - calm and wonderful. greenery and perfectly planted gardens this little piece of heaven in the center of hong kong island is such a great place to sit down and relax and enjoy the free wifi or just take in the nature surrounding you.the views out onto the skyscrapers around you are beautiful and almost surreal as you are surrounded by nature first and then onto the large towering blocks of glass and concrete.

Oasis im megapolis. a really nice and cozy place of HKG! a lot of places to sit and enjoy! during lunch a lot of people are coming to enjoy the lunch in the shadow of trees. a pure hideaway from rush of the city!
Lovely little park. Great to take a relaxing walk in the small park with some interesting buildings, small lake etc right in the centre of town. A most pleasant surprise.

One of the best places in the world that mixes nature, wildlife & amazing city views. Hong Kong Park is one of my absolute favorite places in the whole city!! It is peaceful, beautiful and an escape from the busy city but still keeps the energy and beautiful city views. You can go for 30min or for hours, depending on how much time you have, if you have kids, etc. There is a tea room, nice place for lunch, an aviary + a caged bird area, conservatory, numerous waterfalls, turtles & fish in the pond and lots of places to sit, walk and people watch. While many people will rush around the city to see every sight, I urge you to take 1-2 hours in the morning or afternoon to enjoy this very special place.

An oasis in the city. Hong Kong Park nestles in the heart of the Island and is a great place to wander - or to sit and watch the world go by. It is beautifully set out and carefully tended, there is an abundance of water features and the large lake is if full of fascinating fish. It also has a very good aviary [a steep, but fairly short, climb to get to it]. Situated behind [and above] Pacific Place [a typical Hong Kong Mall] it is easily accessible by escalator and makes for a relaxing spot after [or during] shopping or sightseeing trips!
Hongkong Disneyland trip. superb shopping, rides and food....one day is not enough as one should stay in disney hotel and visit the park the next day also

HK never fails to amaze!. I have been in the area around the park before, but this trip I finally got a chance to walk through it. I was there fairly early in the morning before it got too warm and it was beautiful. Lots of water features and beautiful paths. Amazing to find these little islands of beauty in the middle of the skyscrapers!

Goes on an on. What many people do not realize is that HK Park is not one park but 3 that run across mid levels in Hong Kong. My advice is start in the morning at the back of the Shangrila Hotel. You can take escalators up from Admiralty station. Then enjoy a long stroll through wonderful parks all heading West. Dont miss the Tea Museum in that first park. Now you task is to get over Cotton Tree drive to the Botanical and Zoological Gardens. The best way is to head up hill in HK Park and get to Kennedy Road. You will see a public walkway that crosses the busy road right at the end of Kennedy Road. Just keep heading West and you will even find the zoo which has some very interesting monkey breeds including some amusing Orangutans. By now you are right above Central so just stroll down and find Lan Kwai Fong for a bit of eating or drinking fun.

Green in the middle of the city. Very nice park in the middle of the city. The aviary is free and fun to go to. There is a really nice lake in the middle where you can take great pictures. The tea museum is also a good place to stop by.

A green oasis offering so much more than initially meets the eye. We walked through this park several times before we took the time to explore it properly. The park is much larger than it initially seems and offers visitors the opportunity to explore a walk-through aviary (very tranquil) and a conservatory. Definitely worth spending an hour or so of your time when in Hong Kong.
Peace in the centre. Lovely park with great swan/flamingo/duck pond. Mixed local and visitor. Good facilities close to metro/MTRs
Lovely park. One of the most attractive parks in Hong Kong and great to retreat from all the concrete and glass for a while.

An Oasis In The City. Adjacent to the H.K. Zoological and Botanical Gardens, this is a great addition to a 'day at the park.' There are numerous levels to the park - great walking paths. The centerpiece is a man-made pond/lake (once the tennis court area of the Victoria Barracks). There is a 90 meter-high tower which can be climbed (105 steps) that offer incredible 360-degree views of the central/financial district and the hi-rise buildings clinging to the slopes of Victoria Peak. The wet/dry greenhouse is like nothing I've ever seen - desert and tropical environments in the same building! The grounds are beautiful and the waterfall is spectacular. The several remaining 19th-century buildings add a grand atmosphere to the park. Entrance to the park and the museums/buildings inside are free. Allow +/- two hours.

Lovely for a walk round. This park is a complete oasis in this busy city. The park is worth having a walk round for a few hours. The plants and water features are beautiful and the whole area is so peaceful.Visiting the aviary is a must. It's lovely to see the birds not in a cage and free to fly around. Some very interesting and pretty Asian birds.

A nice break from the city. A lovely park in the middle of a very busy city. We took time to visit the avery which was well laid out and had an good variety of birds. Not a massive park, but very relaxing and plenty of coy carp in the lake.

Hong Kong Park, Admirilty, China. The Hong Kong park is beautifully constructed with an onsite tea museum and pleasant skyline views from the tower. It also has a memorial area to the brave health professionals who helped patients who were diagnosed with SAR but later died as it was contagious. There is ample of water features and aviation site. I had a great blissful day and would recommend it to people from all walks of life and interests.
Hidden Paradise in the Central District. Quiet and nice park in the Central, free admission. Nice break from the hectic city ilfe for the Hong Kongers.

Best kept secret tourist secret in Hong Kong. I grew up in the 1960s around the garden , never realized there was its existence then even though I walked along Kennedy Road to go to school daily. It rivals any of the greatest parks in US. You do not want to miss the Aviary. It is an amazing retreat in the midst of one of the most bustling commercial center in theworld.

Hong Kong Park. The park is easily reached on foot, by bus or metro from almost anywhere. A highlight is the walk in fountain steps away from the entrance to the park closest to the British consulate and the Conrad Hotel. The park has a number of interesting fountains and pools. A welcome break in the center of a bustling city.

Good aviary and nice for a stroll. Hong Kong park is worth coming to just for a few hours to wonder around. The Aviary is huge and you can walk in and around the boardwalk which is a good chance to see some of South East Asias birds without a cage or net blocking your view. Other areas of the park were as expected. I would like to see the food kiosk offering a little more but never mind!
Great park to spend some time!. Peaceful oasis in HK ! Nice to take a walk or grab a seat to relax and take it in! Little shopping booths the day I was there... nice time!

Such a quiet place in a busy city. When most of the residents of the city have small apartments, it only makes sense that there would be a park where they could relax with some vegetation. This is that place. We had a wonderful time walking through the various trees and seeing the quiet places one can sit and contemplate life. We suggest you take a look!

Lovely Park - Stunning Setting. My wife and I visited Hong Kong Park during our recent trip to Hong Kong. My main interest was for Bird Watching. I found the wild bird population disappointing, only a handful of the more common species were present. However, if I had more time an early morning visit may prove to be more productive. For anyone interested in 'Bird Collections' there is a walk through avery. Not really my cup of tea, I don't like to see captive birds unless done for conservation purposes. A personal view. The park itself is well set out with stunning water features and plenty of shaded seating areas. It appeared very popular with officer workers during the lunch period. Very Good, certainly worth a visit but for the Bird Watcher - Kowloon Park is much better. Be warned anyone with mobility issues may find getting about difficult, lots of stairs. Even just getting into the park may be a challenge. We looked for but couldn't find a disabled persons access point. If it's there it's not obvious.
Nice place to have a stroll. However, due to the towering buildings around, it doesn't really feel like an escape to nature. However the zoo next to it is worth visiting...

Pastoral and beautifully maintained. A wonderful respite for everything urbane. The aviary, the water displays as well as the lush vegetation invite you to hang out and take it in as counterpoint to the intense urbanization all around you.
Urban Oasis. Really nice place to relax for a minute in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice water features.

Don't miss the aviary in the park. The park is a very nice green area in the city, but the aviary is a real treat. It is so well designed. You enter on a wooden pathway at the top of the aviary and then work your way down. You get to see lots of birds in the trees. Interesting birds that you do not see in the US.

A little slice of green in a sea of concrete.. Beautiful little park in Central, HK with paved paths, water features, a koi pond, aviary (birds came right up to me like I was in a Disney film), thaichi garden (yes, there is such a thing), beautifully manicured greenery throughout. Paved walking paths are easy to get around. This also connects to a tea museum, which was just "meh", but it was air conditioned. This park is a nice place to visit if you have an extra hour and need a break from the busy HK streets. Many locals were eating lunch on benches throughout the park, and I saw a recently wed couple taking pictures, which was very sweet.

Get a glance to the aviary. The park is peaceful, the botanic garden is ok but no more, eventhough it's free. But continue your visit till the aviary, you will enter in a very huge cage, so huge you got the immpressions birds are free. You'll walk for 100 meters in the top of the trees discover lots of parrots and birds flying everywhere. A good attraction which worth more than it's price... it's free of charge

More than a park in a busy city. *) Nearest MTR: Admiralty Station C1 exit.*) Opening Hours: Park Restaurant - 11:00 a.m. to 10:30 p.m.*) The tai garden and the aviary are a sight, Shady trees and ponds, and plenty of seats to rest on. Easy to find, just off the main street. The ponds with flamingos, ducks, swans, fish etc and the aviaries are well done. fountains and bridges. *) There are places to eat, plenty of seats to sit and have a picnic, a waterfall and other water features, an aviary, a pond full of fish and turtles, a tea museum, an art gallery, a viewing tower !! its great. *) The best part is perhaps the permanent exhibition of plants from desert and humid environments, perfectly arranged in climate controlled pavilions that create a nice atmosphere. Entrance is free. *) It's got an Olympic plaza/amphitheater in the middle of the park too. For a detailed trip list feel free to visit http://hongkongandmacauitinerary.blogspot.in/2014/10/hong-kong-macau-itinerary.html

Peaceful oasis in middle of busy city. This park is right above the Pacific Place shopping mall. Take the escalators directly inside the mall to the park. At the Hong Kong Park level you will notice a pathway that leads to water fountains and little ponds. There are fish and turtles. There is also a cute little tea house restaurant which serves lots of different Chinese teas and has a great vegetarian menu.
Loved it. So peaceful and a calm after the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Lovely gardens and you must have tea at the Tea house! It's very traditional!

A little oasis of peace. Hong Kong park is a great piece of land in a bustling city where one can find space and relaxation away from the hustle. Plants, birds, fish, water - all there to calm the senses.

Small but perfectly formed . I checked out the park today, amazing how much they crammed into such a small space, an avery, a tea museum, an observatory and more. Had a good lunch at the restaurant on the terrace. All attractions where free. So nice to be able to step out of the hustle bustle for a couple of hours and very accessible.

One of the very nice parks in the city. We ended up exploring this park because the line at the Peak tram was just way too long. This way we had fun at the playground and enjoyed the aviary. When you travel with kids, this is a great oasis for a stop before doing the peak.

LOVELY PARK. Hong Kong Park is a lovely oasis in a bustling city. It has a charming lake with fish and terapins and some easy walking paths. The highlight was the free open air bird aviary - be sure not to miss it.

Incredible. My favourite park in HK, a great place to spend a couple of hours. The best attraction is the walk through aviary with over 600 birds and is fre to enter. In addition there is a conservatory with beautiful orchids, cacti and tropical plants in 3 separate displays. A large lake in the centre is home to several dragonfly species, as well as fish and turtles, and there is also a tea museum (which sadly was closing as we arrived late). The park is very tranquil and provides respite from the business of central and admiralty nearby.

Nice urban park - visit after the Peak and see the Aviary. Great park to visit after the Peak as it's right nearby. Impressive little park in the middle of the urban chaos. The aviary requires a hike up some stairs but there are over 600 birds to see. The lower area and water feature are nice as well.
Loved. We really enjoyed the park all the trees just a fun place to go. I really enjoyed Hong Kong I did not know just what I would see but they have a lot there to enjoy.

My favourite part of HK. I loved the tranquillity in the middle of the high rises. The conservatory part was disappointing and didn't see many birds in the aviary, but a great place to just sit and eat lunch and soak up the atmosphere.

Tranquil. The park is in the centre of Hong Kong and is a must. Its tranquil and out of the city's hustle and bustle and free!. There's a Conservatory, Aviary, Fountains and a Tea House Museum. Go and enjoy
Picture in the waterfall. Lots of opportunities for photo calls. You must have one in waterfall. Aviary has a great selection of birds. Tea museum well worth a visit.

Good for the kids. The play ground in the park was good for the kids and it had multiple levels for them to play through. It was lovely and peaceful and quite relaxing for my husband and I as we watched the kids play

A patch of fresh air in the concrete jungle. A place to re-charge and chill out from all the shopping and oceans of people around you! There is also a tower with spiral stairs, once you are on the top, you can view the city and have a good look at all the tall architectures around you.

Green HK, clean HK. If you have time to see just one park, you may consider this park in the HK island. Not only is it a relief from the glitzy multistoreyed neighbourhood, but tourists can even take rest between their tour of the island. I am not sure if tour operators add this attraction as a part of any pre-fixed tour.

Great for young children. The park is quite a walk from Central Station so be ready for that. The park itself has many different sections including a walk-in aviary but the highlight for our 4yo was definitely the multi-level playground which is beautifully shaded by the big trees in the park. We even saw a squirrel on one!

Day in the park. Hong Kong Park is an excellent place for family, friends, and couples to enjoy a relaxing stroll through the park while enjoying the scenery. I also notice people that I think were doing tai chi in the morning, while watching them do their morning excercise with a very calm atmosphere as they enjoyed the saturday morning silence

An oasis.. Hong Kong Park is not large, but it provides a nice green getaway in a very built-up city without much green.
Includes an artificial lake, as well as lots of fountains. Convenient to the Peak Tram and easily accessible from Central and the Admiralty districts. Well-marked with lots of maps.
I hate birds!. But this aviary and park is super. A quiet spot. Fasinating birds. Great walk down from Kennedy Road to Cotton Tree Drive.

Super little park. Well thought out, with lots of benches in every spot imaginable, this is a lovely place for a weekend stroll. It's peaceful and the artificial lake brings a lovely touch of nature to the middle of a bustling area. Really liked it.
Interesting Park. Great park to have a walk around and escape the traffic. Interesting plants and water features and a range of captive birds that are very unique.

afternoon promnade. we spent, all family, an afternoon at the hong kong park, nice weather, although very humide, tea museum was great
recommended place

Flagstaff tea museum in Hong Kong Park. We loved this museum and bought a lovely travel tea set from here. The Park had some lovely water features in it and was a nice break from all the hustle and bustle of the streets.
Have Tea in Hong Kong Park. The park reminds of me of a version of Central Park. It was fun to walk around and to try the Tea House in the Park.

Nice sanctuary in a concrete mess. The park's well maintained and had a lot of diversity to spend time on. Unfortunately, I was there over the summer and could not spend more than 5 minutes in the 90+ degree heat and 85% humidity.Recommend making a visit if you're in Central but I wouldn't go out of my way if you have limited time and were in another part of the city.

feel bad for the animals there. my heart was broken by what i saw in that park, the birds and the monkeys didn't look like they enjoy their living cages are small and a felt really sad after that visit. it's not a must and definetly not worth the trip.
pretty little haven. there are lots of little areas in hong kong to escape the hussle and bussle of the city, this is definitely one of the pretty ones. nice place to escape for a little bit!

Hillside gardening creates urban haven. Hong Kong park was intriguing in that the park is not very big but it's use of slope, color and screening within the inner city of Hong Kong island amongst the towering skyscrapers makes for a very pleasant break from the crowds. The transition from day light to night lighting as darkness came with its own appeal was good to witness. The vistas through the trees to the buildings beyond reminds one that you are in a very busy city.

Nice little escape. A nice escape in the concrete jungle that is HK. The gardens are beautifully manicured. We found carp and turtles in the pond and one of the very few playgrounds for children. Worth the stroll about

Retreat in the city. Nestled on the foothill of the HK Peak on Hong Kong Island the Hong Kong Park is a place of abundand flowers and peaceful landscaping close to the busy raods and shopping centers.

greaat. There are plenty of shops that sell antiques and historical monuments along cobbled streets which made it so ancient and special. Take time to stroll down hong kong and enjoy the beautiful atmosphere.

Teaware Museum. I visited the Teaware Museum in the old Colonial Governor's Mansion. I find it to be fascinating that for over a thousand years so much thought, time, and effort has gone into preparing a simple beverage. After examining the teaware on display and watching videos about tea production and tea brewing, I have a better appreciation of the importance of tea in the Chinese culture. I recommend a visit.
Tranquility in the city. Well worth a walk through. Brings a little calm in a crazy city. Colourful gardens and ponds. Be aware it is as busy as the rest of the city at weekends.

Beautiful gardens hidden in this metropolis of concrete. What a refreshing place to wonder through and enjoy the serenity of the gardens hidden between skyscrapers and busy roadways. It is a great shortcut to get to the Peak Tram.

Green against the backdrop of the modern city. Loved the greenery and the various ponds and plant surrounding the city.Dislike: the way going to the park involved a lot of walking as there were limited subways or buses that stop near the place.

Hong Kong Park. Hong Kong Park is an oasis of calm in Central Hong Kong. The aviary is wonderful--both the flora and fauna. The Tai Chi Garden was, perhaps, the place I liked best in Central. Within the Tai Chi Garden, the tribute to the first ten health care works who died as a result of SARS was unexpected and moving. Be sure to look for the wild cockatoos within the park. Like the rest of Hong Kong, the park is vertical--but there are plenty of lovely places to rest and nice public restrooms.

Loved this park in the city. Next to the Peak Tram on Hong Kong Island, a beautiful retreat from the bustling Hong Kong streets can be found at Hong Kong Park (see photos). There is a lovely lake and garden. The walk up to the conservatory is worth it and definitely do not miss the Edward Youde Aviary (see photo) that is home to more than 600 birds. We enjoyed our elegant vegetarian dim sum lunch at the Lock Cha Tea Shop.

Nice area in the heart of the city. Hong Kong Park is a nice area in the middle of the city, nice area where can walk and tak a break
With play house for kids and different level of vegetation

Awesome. Nice place to run lots of birds and i sawsome squirrels clean & wholesome place goog place to spend your time lots of trees & playground for kids manmade lake love it relaxing specially in the morning definitely a must see place

Absolutely beautiful park!. Loved this park!! Sat under a tree for a while and then lay on a bench in the Zen Garden, undercover when the torrential down pour happened. Then went to see the aviary where they have an incredible variety of birds. Amazing viewing points of the city and makes for some beautiful photos of where city meets the lush green of the park. One of the places in Hong Kong I would visit again on my next trip!
Lovely park, a credit to HK. I liked the layout and the landscaping.. nice surroundings for a wander round some greenery. Makes a change from the bustling streets around you.

Nice area and good veggie restaurant. We walked through here on the way to the tram terminal for Victoria peak. It's very nice, with lots of different sub areas. Lots of pretty flowers and trees, with many of them labelled and some good water features. It has an amazing backdrop with the skyscrapers around. We went to the restaurant by the tea museum where we had veggie dim sum which was lovely and very good value.
Oasis in middle of city. If you want to chill out in the heart of the city take a stroll around the park and visit the tea house for a cup of delicious tea.

Great Day Out. Visited HK park which is in the middle of the HK CBD with a great day had by all.Started by looking at the man made lake in the centre of the parl then with an interesting look through the Chinese Tea Museum which is housed in the oldest Colonial building still standing in HK which used to be the residence for the British Military Commander up until the 70,s.This was followed by a look at the cactus display in the climate controlled hot house (though the climate in HK would have suited them anyway) with some interesting varieties of the prickly cactus's.This was followed by a walk through the very large bird avairy which houses over 600 varieties which live and breed in HK and surrounding areas & islands.Very nice day.

Free park. there are places in HK that you don't need to splurge, the HOng Kong park is one of them. The flowers in the garden are all blooming, there is an plant and flower exhibit in the area when we were there, and enjoyed it for free.

Great Green Space. This is one of the best city parks I've visited. Other than seeing the skyscrapers around you, you'd never know you were in a major city. The landscaping is beautiful with ponds of fishes. Great way to spend your lunch hour to get a break from the heat and hustle of HK.
Nice oasis.... ... In between all buildings. I would especially recommend to visit the aviary with a lot of exotic birds.

A tranquil escape from the bustle of Hong Kong. I have lived in Hong Kong for 13 years. This is one of the first places I take visitors. It is a beautifully designed park. Just wandering through the park is a delight, or just sit on a bench and watch the world go by. If you have time I'd definitely recommend a visit to the tea ware museum to have a cup of tea and dimsum at the Lok Cha tea house - it's in the oldest remaining building in Hong Kong. The walk uphill to the aviary is worth it, there is an amazing tree walk through a tropical jungle, and the birds fly around you.
Incredible design. An incredibly beautiful urban park. So much is given to detail. It is extremely clean and well kept--a true pleasure to walk through.

A wonderful Sunday Walk.. Easy to get to, a huge park in the middle of the downtown core, easy access from Nathan. Street. Lots of things going on, exercise, dance etc. Beautiful plants, trees and flowers. That park has a huge swimming pool. Lots of places to sit and relax, a great place for pictures. You would never know you were in the middle of a busy city.

A Bit of Peace in Hong Kong. If you don't have a day to waste at Lamma island, the Hong Kong Park is a great second option to enjoy a bit of nature & peace with less time.. incredibly beautiful flowers, birds and refreshing fountains is what to expect. People come here to unwind and and watch out, it's very contagious! :)

Oasis amongst the Skyscapers. Hong Kong park is an oasis of tranquility located in the middle in the middle of some of the largest skyscrapers in Hong Kong, including the distinctive Bank of China tower. The way we got there from Wan Chai was via the Ding Ding Tram system and then a short walk of about 7 minutes. Keep your eye out for the sign posts. On entering the park you have flowers and water features with terrapins and huge coy fish. The flowers also had butterflies the size of small birds which was amazing to watch. It is a lovely area to walk around and plenty to do including some indoor areas. Don't forget to try the amazing tea house in Hong Kong park which I will review separately. Hong Kong park was a highlight and this gets my 5 stars.

Tranquil Oasis. Visited last May. This park really is an oasis of peace and tranquility in a busy city. I originally planned a pit stop for an hour be we were here for 3! Lots of meandering and steep paths. Lush vegetation in places but by far the best for us were the Koi ponds - there is something very calming about them. The aviary was brilliant - I had no idea it was there - you can spend ages in this part. It is a really nicely set out park and well worth a visit.

Nice place for a walk. The gardens are nice and there is a reasonable walk through aviary. I make sure I walk through the Park whenever I am in Hong Kong. Good short cut through to the Peak tram or Old Peak Rd too.
Loved it. Such a beatific park, make sure you make time for aviary - hundreds of incredible birds up close. Inside the fountain is a great place for photos

tranquil escape. Loved this park and not because it's free but simply because it was a great escape from the rush of the HKG streets. There is a small zoo that was well maintained and the park itself was well put together. Loved it. Come see it.

Fab way to spend Sunday morning. Absolutely wonderful park with a wonderful atmosphere and amazing views. The lakes are full of coi carp and terrapins and the aviary is packed with beauties.A must see!

This is a must visit in HK. Great exotic plants & birds. Plenty of fountains and shade to keep cool. Just make sure you start at the top (take the elevators up) then walk down thru the park back into the CBD.

One of the Best City Parks in the World. HK Park is located a short walk from most Central located hotels and is well worth the time. It is absolutely beautiful with many Coy ponds, exotic plants and birds. Asians from all over travel to HK park for wedding ceremonies.

A sanctuary. This tranquil section of the city is well worth a visit to just sit and relax. The layout is quite beautiful with wonderful walkways and trees. Truly an oasis in the midst of the sometimes frenetic energy of Central/Admiralty.

Surprising oasis in the middle of the city. This park in the middle of the city is a great break from the metal and concrete of the city. There are lakes and walking paths, and don't miss the (free!) walk-through aviary. Be forewarned, though, that there are some steep paths, and it's not much cooler or less humid in the park than in the rest of Hong Kong.Definitely worth it to bring your lunch and spend some time afterwards wandering thru the greenery. And it's just two blocks from the tram to Victoria Peak if you want great views.

Lovely Time. The park was beautiful and a wonderful get away from the city! The Aviary was amazing. If you have children, they too will love this part! There is food you may purchase at certain parts to feed particular birds and many will come and take it out of your hand. The gardens are amazing and the walk is beautiful throughout.

Pleasant green oasis in the city. Depending when you go this can be quite busy with newly weds having photoshoots and domestic helpers enjoying their day off. However, it is a nice area with a pond and heritage buildings, one of them housing a tea museum and teahouse with fabulous tea and vegetarian dim sum. There is also a Thai/Asian restaurant which is ok if you need a break but don't expect the food to be extraordinary. There are also the aviaries near the top of the park.

An oasis among towering sculpture. It was a pleasant surprise to find this park after the bustle and crowds of SOHO. Peaceful with lovely grounds and water features, the park is an oasis surrounded by beautifully architected commercial towers housing the Island's top banks and hotels. It's at the heart of a series of stairs and walkways throughout this part of Hong Kong that separates walkers from traffic - or perhaps just routes us through the several high-end malls. That's ok, its really an amazing part of the city and well worth a visit - simply to decompress from the crowds you face everywhere else.

Tranquillity in the city. As soon as you enter the grounds the noise & bustle of the city disappears. The grounds are well kept & the fountains & pools just beg to be photographed. The plant houses & large aviary are a must. It is easy to get the Peak tram from here as well

Nice picturesque park. Smaller park than Kowloon Park, this is on the side of Victoria Harbour / Peak. There's a nice waterfall area as well. Worth a stroll at dusk when it's cooler and you can get some lovely colours from the surroundings of the park.

Peace and quiet in the City. When you've had enough of the hustle and bustle of the city shops, retreat to the Park for some space and tranquility! Beautiful gardens, trees, fountains, ponds, and several swimming pools (in season").
A little paradise at the heart of Hong Kong. The park is easy to access from Admiralty MTR station. Very quiet. View was okay but it has a nice bird watching site. We enjoyed our visit there.

Great Park in Central / Admiralty Hong Kong. We walked through the park on our way from the JW Marriott hotel in Central / Admiralty to The Peak Tramway. Excellent / clean park with koi ponds, nice shade, places to rest. We stopped at the (free) Tea Museum in the park, and it was an unexpected treat as well. I recommend a short trip through the Tea Museum if you have the time.The only downside I can suggest is that we went to HKG in July, and the weather was hot, hot, hot with a huge amount of humidity. This took some of the luster off of this nice park because it was so hot (to be anywhere outside) in HKG.

Oasis getaway. Hong Kong park was a refreshing change in my sightseeing schedule, relaxed and lovely and green after the tall buildings and crowds of people.I visited the botanical gardens which were good but small compared to similar in Kew and Edinburgh etc.The open air aviary was lovely, it felt like I was walking through a small forest area and I was surprised how many birds I actually got to see, the Bali Myna's were very inquisitive and definitely not shy, a few of them insisted on following me around as I walked. The caged bird area is small and I don't like to see birds confined to such small spaces.The tea museum explained all types of tea traditions, brewing and tea accessories which for me was interesting.I didn't get to see the whole park as I only had a couple of hours to spare but entry was free and all in all a worth a visit. A warning, the park is along the hillside so some of the paths are steep.
Nice city park. Kids area in the park, needs a little refurbishment though. Jogging and walking path were interesting. Will go often with my kids.
For Free. So much to see, and it is all for Free. The Hong Kong government is really doing a great job at maintaining the city and its parks.

Hidden oasis in the city. The was a surprisingly pleasant experience - we did not expect such a well kept park in the city itself. The birdhouse was particularly enjoyable, large numbers of native birds in a large aviary. Definitely something to visit if you are nearby.

An oasis in the city. Hong Kong Park, one of the few easily accessible green spaces in highly urban Kong Kong, provides a welcome respite from the frenetic activity in the rest of the city. The grounds are clean and well maintained and there is lots to see. My favorite thing is the amazing walk-through aviary, featuring an impressive collection of exotic Asian birds, such as the Bali Mynah. And best of all, it's free -- and there's even free wi-fi!

Many things to see. A good size birds aviary one can walk though on the wooden pathways, good restaurants, tea museum, dim sum house, water fountain, an oasis in the middle of a busy city. I love to visit the Park. It has different levels along the hillside that give visitors different views at different locations.

stroll along the PArk. I happened to be there because I needed to walk to the HK squash centre. there is a nice lake and water features. tea restaurants. very tranquil and peaceful and calm. however the weather in July is too hot to enjoy the peace.. it is near the Victoria Peak Tram station. so if you are there, take a stroll in the park to see what the Locals do.
Worth a visit. This is a beautiful oasis in the middle of Hong Kong. Its worth a visit. I think I preferred it to Nan Lian Gardens

An aviary you can walk through!. There is an actual aviary you can walk through, almost like a tree top walkway. The park itself is small but contains a lot to see., Check out the vegetarian dim sum place in the park and count the number of turtles in the ponds. Walk through the education centre, if not for the orchids on display then at leats for the air conditioning in summer!
An oasis in the city. A lovely little park in the city...small waterfalls, koi and turtle pond, lots of trees and benches to enjoy a bit of quiet from the hectic pace of Hong Kong.
Cool pond. Normal size park. It has a cool pond in the middle that everyone kind of gravitates too. The skyline views in all direction make it unique.

Great aviary. Next to the tram terminus for the peak is Hong Kong Park, beautiful and shady with a lot of great plants. It's a little hilly but that makes for a great experience when you tour the aviary, which seems to be built across a canyon. It's free although you have to climb a lot of stairs to get to the entrance. Lots of tropical birds although sometimes they're hard to spot. The women who take care of the place are very helpful in pointing them out, although their English is limited. Good brochure with photos of the birds. If you're into tea, there's a very good museum about it in the park.

Air, trees, and tea. Most direct and easy access from Pacific Place Mall in Admiralty. Perfect place to be for a quiet sandwich lunch in the midst of a piece of nature within the busy city. The Teaware Museum and adjacent tea house are both housed in heritage buildings from the colonial days and are worth a visit.
A breath of fresh air. Worth a visit to recharge the batteries. Quiet, green oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of a very busy city.

Take a break. As almost everywhere else in Hong Kong places like this a cultivated and cared for. I like the atmosphere at lunch time when the many office workers come here for their lunchtime break. It's another haven in the middle of Central. Further up you will find aviaries. It's a bit difficult to reach unless you have some tips.

A park with a bird Aviary. This park is hidden between buildings, though it has wide open spaces. One will not notice but there are many ways of accessing the park grounds. There are many pathways, trees, small areas to discover. There is an aviary with endemic birds like egrets, herons, black birds , sparrows, finches etc. I feel sorry for the birds , though. In the mornings , there are many residents who walk and exercise inside the park.. Bring your own bottle of water because, it gets very humid after . Wear comfortable shoes, because there are lots of elevated spaces to discover.

Pretty little park in the middle of Central.. Very nice stretch of green space right in the heart of Central. The water features, the bridges, the bird sanctuary - you can spend a few good hours relaxing here. Its a nice little break if you're running around taking in all HK has to see and need to recharge before you tackle something else. There are a few cafes there as well, so if you need it, extend your break into a meal and just relax in the beauty around you.

nice to get away from the city. The hong kong park gives you a different feel about HK other than just the sky crappers. There are birds, butterflies, frogs, etc. It can get really hot if going around june, july. So bring an umbrella for the sun, sunblock and plenty water.

Loved the bird aviary most. So nice to take a break from the city in this park in the city. Poured rain when we were there and blisteringly hot but still loved seeing the many different birds in the aviary. Wooden walkways lead you through a tropical forest where the birds are easy to see. Feeders with corn attract the parrots and bolder birds walk on the walkway railings. Free admission and only a few others there. Really enjoyed it.
Quiet oasis in a busy city. Hong Kong Park is a very nice and quiet Oasis in central Hong Kong. Its a nice place to relax after seeing the busy and hectic Hong Kong. Can only be recommended.
Avery in the middle of the city. After The Peak we crossed the road into the park.Loved the avery & the fountain you can stand in - a nice rest from the heat. Nice koi pond too.

Worth a visit if you are into gardens.. Nice garden right in the middle of the city......but still very noisy from the traffic surrounding the garden. Visited the tower, not great view, but very quiet -- nice place to get away from the crowds and action in the city.

Wedding Venue. My cousin married his beautiful bride in this park where they have an area set aside for the ceremony and a garden for photographs. It was a very pretty green space, and had a peaceful quality which made you forget you were surrounded by some very tall buildings.

Great park for relaxation, families and to enjoy nature in the big city. This park has everything, from stunning water features, great photo opps, a tea shop/house, lunch in the park, tranquil benches, beautiful flowers/plants/trees of all kinds in the conservatory and all different kinds of birds in the atrium. It is one of my favorite place to go with my husband, solo and especially with children as there is so much to do.

Beautiful and a lot to see. It's in the middle of everything, which is great. It is beautiful and has a lot of winding paths and different things to see. Definitely worth a trip and easy to stumble upon.

We very much enjoyed our visit. HK Park is located very near to the Central Business district of HK Island. One of the easiest ways to get there is actually through the prestigious Pacific place shopping centre, using the escalators to climb up to the Park level.It's a very nice place and relaxing to walk around, but the highlight for us was the aviary

Hong Kong Park. We dint plan this park. One of my friend took me there. Beautiful park. Well maintained. Calm and peaceful. Its close to the Admiralty MTR station. Nice water falls all around the park. A nice location to chill.

Kids loved the park. Great park in the middle of the city. The bird exhibit was really nice and the birds came right up to the walkway. The park was probably the highlight of the trip for the kids (except for Disney land).

Excellent to wind down. Great for a lunch/after office walk if the weather is right. The location is very convince as it's next to most of the office area in admirality and the little tortoise and fish in the ponds do take you to a different zone. Absolutely recommended after a stressful meeting.

Treasure of a park. A little bit of paradise among all the tall buildings and the traffic.
A place to chill out and enjoy the plants, pools and butterflies.

Walking trails are much better, and Free the birds!. A nice enough park but nothing spectacular. It stands out because there is not much greenery around that part of town. Go hike Dragons Back or one of the many trails if you really want to see trees and nature. This is average at best. The bird cage is pretty depressing - many large species that should have large areas to fly, but they don't
Green in Concrete. As someone had said earlier, it is just wonderful to find a green spot in the midst of so much concrete. Kids enjoy as well the trees and aviary.
Beautiful Park!. Large park with various activities going on. Early morning there’s a soccer, tennis and Tai Chi training groups.

Its Hong Kong. Went there with much higher expectations and found that I could circle it in less than 15min without running. The tai garden and the aviary are a sight, but not really a reason to visit, unless you happen to be nearby.This was a great find. Shady trees and ponds, and plenty of seats to rest on. Easy to find, just off the main street. However if the weather is good you get terrific views of the city and harbour.

Morning trail. This is a very popular walk to the Peak but be aware it is quite steep and hard work in the heat and humidity of a Hong Kong summer. However if the weather is good you get terrific views of the city and harbour.

Surprisingly small. Went there with much higher expectations and found that I could circle it in less than 15min without running. The tai garden and the aviary are a sight, but not really a reason to visit, unless you happen to be nearby. The best part is perhaps the permanent exhibition of plants from desert and humid environments, perfectly arranged in climate controlled pavilions that create a nice atmosphere. Entrance is free.
A quiet oasis in a busy city. This was a great find. Shady trees and ponds, and plenty of seats to rest on. Easy to find, just off the main street.

A green oasis in a busy city.. A lovely park to walk around. The ponds with flamingos, ducks, swans, fish etc and the aviaries are well done. Easy to spend a couple of hours relaxing and walking around.

The great escape!. If you want to stay in the city but escape it too then head for Hong Kong park. There is a spectacular bird aviary that you can admire from overhead walk ways and a tea ware museum plus a large pond. Very peaceful.

Nice place for a couple of hours. I live in Hong kong since 6 months and went already 3 times in Hong Park. This is nice to spend only 1 or 2 hours and enjoyed the park , the birds , lakes with fishes and turtles. Have a seat and just relax or read a book. This park is a really peaceful and quite place in the middle of noisy central.

An Oasis in the City. One of my favorite Parks in Hong Kong, I like it because 1) easy access, 2) a great place for bird watching, 3) beautiful landscaping, 4) Museum of Tea Ware inside the park, 5) Visual Arts Centre nearby, 6) Pacific Place (a shopping mall) is not far away...... for details, please visit http://www.lcsd.gov.hk/parks/hkp/en/howtoaccess.php

Green in the middle of soaring high buildings. We were just passing by the park on the way to somewhere else. You will be able to see some buildings from different angels while walking along the park. While the park itself is very nice, with few fountains and bridges. It could be nice retreats for the locals. We did enjoy our walk and I would recommend people to tailor their directions so that you may pass through this park while on your way to somewhere else.

Very beautiful and free!. Hong Kong park is a lovely getaway from the city that's right in the middle of central Hong Kong. There's a lot to look at and enjoy. This is a great spot to take a break or have a snack. We really enjoyed the water elements and the teapot exhibit. You can get lots of nice pictures of nature + the city from this spot as well. Plus, it's free!!! If you're in the area definitely check it out.
Aviary is a must. Beautiful oasis in HK and the aviary is a must. Even better it is all free. Make sure you take the time to visit.

Bird Lovers? Don't miss!. The Avian Center - a large enclosed (with a net) and very impressive structure is choc-full of interesting and "exotic" (for a westerner) species of birds. I spent an hour on the nice walkways thru the exhibit. Bring your camera and visit this tropical oasis juxtaposed against the modern skyscrapers of Hong Kong. Its very cool - even if you're not into birds - take the walk thru!

Lovely respite in the middle of Hong Kong. What a lovely surprise to find this park directly next to my hotel - the Island Shangri-La, Hong Kong - and also right nearby the Conrad-Hilton and the JW Marriott, all adjacent to Pacific Place and Admiralty MTR stop. It was really nice to walk through it, enjoy the gardens, water features, and take the stairs up to a viewing platform to get a great view of the city. It's got an Olympic plaza/amphitheater in the middle of the park too. I didn't get to see the Aviary because I was there after 5 pm, unfortunately, but that would have been neat to see as well. So plan to visit earlier in the afternoon, or in the morning.
Peace in a frenetic city.. At the mid-levels. this is a beautifully maintained park. When you visit make sure and walk round the botanic garden, the orchids are spectacular.

Relaxing place in the city. The park is nice and centrally located. There is a nice bird aviary in the park with a lot of nice birds. The park is reasonably quiet and a good get away from the busy streets of Hong Kong

A Welcome Break !!. Amidst the Tall Buildings in Hong Kong lies this Gem of Greenery. A must visit for someone looking for a break from the regular touristy things. The Park is well laid out with beautiful fountains and plenty of places to discover and enjoy if you are with little kids. Don't miss the traditional Lock Cha tea House situated in the Park. Very close to both the Peak Tram Station on one end and the Admiralty MTR at the Other.
A great stop before the Peak Tram. The park is a nice respite from the bustling city, and it is directly adjacent to the Peak Tram, which makes it an ideal stop before climbing to Victoria Peak.

Excellent space for the whole Family. I enjoyed spending time in the park while visiting my son, his wife and our 3 grandchildren.In the park you'll find a playground for children which is excellent, swings slides etc also a sandpit. There are places to eat, plenty of seats to sit and have a picnic, a waterfall and other water features, an aviary, a pond full of fish and turtles, a tea museum, an art gallery, a viewing tower !! its great.

Gem in the middle of the city. We went to the park during our vacation to Hong Kong not expecting much. We were glad we took the time to go there. It was quite a breath of fresh air in the middle of the city. The juxtaposition of the greenery against the concrete skyscrapers in the background was quite a beauty. There's also a bird aviary in the park which is a must-see.
The Park. Lovely, well worth an hour or so to relax and chill in between sightseeing and shopping. Sit and watch people, all nationalities and the occasional wedding party having photos.
Opportunity to relax. An excellent quiet location that allows one to rest and recuperate after the none stop go getting attitude that is Hong Kong generally.

Get away from it all. Right in the middle of the city this is a little Piece of quiet, there are water fountains and exotic birds as well as ponds of fish to view and for you to relax, also the museum is nice to catch up on HK history and I have been to the swimming pools at the top if the park a few times which is well worth it, for small kids there is a great play area next to the pool and lots of places such as the maze to get list in, its really a place to step out of city life and wind down for a while

A Change. This park is a peaceful spot amongst all the crowded skyscrapers and there a nice Chinese Tea house here. I found it very relaxing here which makes a change from the normal hustle and bustle of Hong Kong.

Feel the serenity!. Stepping into this tranquil park, located in the heart of central Hong Kong, I imagine would be like the feeling you might have on locating an oasis in the middle of a desert. The juxtaposition of the park with its surrounding skyscrapers and apartment buildings, is quite magical and it is no wonder many locals come here during their lunch-break for some peace and quiet. The park is also host to a delightful walk-through aviary with a variety of colourful, tropical birds that appear to be very contented with their habitat and the attention they receive from keepers and spectators alike. Another treasure within the park that is worth an extended visit is the Flagstaff House Museum of Tea Ware. The two floors, show exhibits of tea ware dating from 11th Century BC until the the 20th Century and adjacent on the ground floor of the K.S. Lo Gallery Building is a Chinese Tea House that regularly holds tea demonstrations and also serves tea and delicious sweet dumplings.
Good place to relax. Dropped in at the park, just before going on to the Victoria peak. Pleasant and relaxing atmosphere.

Nice to have a relaxing walk around. Nice to walk around the park and relax, while we was there we had a massive thunderstorm so we were huddled in the tower in middle of the park which was quite nice.

Bird song in the morning not to be missed. I travel Here once a year on my way in to China , and all ways find time to sit in the park , if in Hong Kong if you don't want to shop or eat then you are struggling , I come here .Sunday Is especially good

Greenery secreted amongst the glass, concrete and steel.. This garden (probably a more accurate description than a park) is a really well managed/manicured patch of green in the midst of Central. Running over a variety of levels, it also houses the excellent Tea Room, a Tea Museum (ok substitute if you can't get a table in the former), a wonderful walk-through aviary and various ponds, playgrounds and the like. Get there in the morning to watch or join a Tai Chi group. Use it as a verdant relief when whizzing around the city to other places. Well worth an hour or two to wander with a camera.
Amazing!!. It's so nice to see somewhere beautiful right in the middle of tower blocks for absolute free. It's a very nice and cool place to take a break from shopping on a hot day.

Beautiful. Loved theses gardens. They are a sanctuary in the middle of a busy commercial area. Different types of gardens, an aviary, artificial lakes and many great places to sit. A visit to the Teahouse Museum is also very interesting.

Pretty but no wide open spaces. Only here briefly but my son was a little disappointed at lack of wide open space to throw a ball around. I guess that's the way it is in Hong Kong - compact.Would like to have visited the Aviary and Tea Museum both of which I have read are good but we ran out of time.Nice fish ponds with tortoises too.

A pocket of greenery in Central.. We've been visiting HK for more than 20 years - usually stayed in Cntral right near Hong Kong Park and never knew it was there. And it's a gem.It's tucked up behind the Pacific Place complex - a few escalators up.There are waterfalls and lovely ponds full of fish and great little turtles - our kids loved them. The turtles bask on the rocks, usually on top of one another and then waddle back into the pond.It is a very pleasant place to have a stroll - plenty of people do - and it provides a good contrast to the hurly burly of Hong Kong streets.There were tearooms (fully booked!) that looked very inviting and the Teaware Museum which is worth a visit as it contains all sorts of variations on what a teapot can be!The thing we loved most about the park was the amazing location - you are surrounded by tall buildings but it still seems to be a relaxing place to be.Worth a visit.

Multi-terraced playground. My 7 and 10 year old kids had fun playing at the multi-level playing area complete with sand digging toys, swings, and climbing structures. Nice respite in the middle of the city. We also quickly walked through the conservatory and aviary.

Far from the madding crowd. We came here because the Good Friday queues for the Lamma ferry were miles long. And what a contrast! This small but beautifully-crafted park is smack bang in the middle of high-rise Hong Kong, but in every other respect it's worlds apart. There is a stunning walk-through aviary with a wide variety of bird life, there are waterfalls, ponds, a Museum of Tea, a pretty restaurant, and a walk-through waterfall for kids or the young-at-heart to play in on a hot day. The park also contains the oldest colonial building in Hong Kong. As a respite from the madding crowds outside the park boundaries, it is excellent. Stop a while and your heart will thank you.

The tea room!. If in the area then have a stroll. The park is small and dated but the reason for visiting is the tearoom! Not to be confused with the tearoom museum which is a few hundred yards away. Ideally you need to book a tea table in advance (so popular) but we managed to wing it on the day as we didn't know. Soooo traditional - choice of several different Chinese teas (no milk), beautiful porcelain crockery, wonderful setting but the cherry on the cake is the vegetarian dim sum menu. Best I have had in HK! And the toilets are OK too! A very enjoyable Chinese experience right in the middle of HK Park. Take your mum and your friends - just do it!

Interesting Walk in the Park. It is a pretty park to walk through with plenty to see. The water feature is lovely. There are a number of prettily set out areas and we saw a wedding taking place which was a beautiful setting.
Great Park, highly recommended!. Brilliant aviary with fantastic birds and wildlife. Take your zoom lenses for some fantastic photographs.

Oasis of green in the midst of skyscrapers. Lovely haven of green with an aviary, lakes, fountains and trees right in the centre of the financial district. Definitely worth a visit to escape from the bustle for a while.
nice place. this place is excellent,many people from different contry here,the weather in hongkong is not very hot in March,so I think it's good time to come here.
Peaceful. A very lovely, large park surrounded by giant sky-scrappers. Wonderful with kids! Ours loved the fountains and fish.
Pleasantly Relaxing. Hong Kong Park is a pleasant oasis in the middle of the business district. Every trip to Hong Kong i make it a point to stroll through and actually enjoy the peace.

Prof Jeff in Hong Kong Park. This is a relatively small area of the Hong Kong Island within sight of the business district. But what a wonderful place to go and stroll and relax. Inside the park there is a tea museum as well as a small botanical exhibit featuring some interesting displays. There is also the famous aviary which is a walk through attraction and worth a visit. Everything is free entry. The landscaping is superb in the Park and maintenance of the grounds is first class. Also within the park is the sombre memorial to the doctors who lost their lives fighting the SARS epidemic. Some were so young.

Always worth visiting for the zoo. A worthy free visit with the kids when in town. There's also a cafe there to get some food. The guy in there cooks your eggs fresh for your sandwich (didn't expect that)

If you have nothing to do - go there. but do not add it to your schedule if you are on a short visit.you can go to the park to wait for friends, and in between activities, but i cannot consider it as an attraction all by itself

Lovely inner city park. Nice place to discover in the middle of this huge bustling city. Spectacular water fountains and sculptures dot the way. The place is so clean it's spotless, like much of Hong Kong.
:) <3. I have traveled in HongKong 3 times and this was the first time i travel Hong Kong park. It was very nice, there are a lots of beautiful thing here

An Oasis in Tsim Sha Tsui. This is a beautifully kept park off Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui. There are gardens, fountains and flamingos, as well as a public swimming pool. A green retreat in the middle of the concrete jungle.

A place of oasis amidst the hustle and bustle hk. most people would think of HK as "Mai Ye, Sek Ye" (buy things, eat things)But HK has a lot more to offer! in this busy city, find an oasis in the heart of the city. Hong Kong park is conveniently located in the city and accessible through Admiralty MTR station (on the island line). You can just cut through the escalator and reach Hong Kong Park. A quiet patch of greenery and an aviary to enjoy the birds if it catches your fancy too! Brings a :) to your face for sure.

Train while travelling with Fit in HKG. If you are one who prefer challenges outside the gym and likes to meet interesting people, join the Group Exercise training program while on holiday. Open to public at HK$150 only, wear good shoes and workout gear as you gonna sweat.www.fitinhkg.com

Morning Breath ... Nice to see the lawn and other wonderful colourish flowers in the morning .. I would suggest about 3 hours there in the part with a morning schedule for the same and further we can also plan for going to shopping in Ching kung Mansion ..

So Many Aspects to this Park! Superb.. Serene, green, interesting...dry conservatory, humid conservatory and although I am no fan of the aviary this one is pretty good with most of the birds appearing settled and content to be there. Beautiful orchids and some interesting plants, well labelled. The Tea House is another highlight...absolutely superb! Amazing tea menu, delicious and delicate snacks, an experience in itself.
HK Park. Try the Tai Chi - I used to be "dragged along" as a child, but now I love joining in with the locals.

Walk through the aviary!. The whole park is a wonderful bit of peace in the midst of Hong Hong. We didn't see everything on offer here, but highly recommend the walk-through aviary, a large enclosed area where birds fly about in a natural setting. The path is at tree canopy height. We must have spent half an hour there.

Must see!. Nice walk in the park in central HK. Lots unique flora, ponds andchinese culture. Tram to Victoria peak is right there also. I stayed at the JW Marriot which is easy walk to the park. Its a great way to spend the day on the "cheap".
