Very photogenic. This patch of greenery in downtown hong kong is very photogenic, with its beautifully landscaped ponds and pavilions, against a backdrop of a wall of skyscrapers.

Spectacular. This is a treat for photographers and, weekends excepted, a welcome spot of tranquility away from the bustle of HK streets. Don't miss the aviary - you walk along a boardwalk at treetop level, and the birds aren't too shy.
A nice break from buildings. A lot of scenic views with ponds- have baby turtles swimming in! A nice landscape with flowers and then the skyscrapers in the background.

Lovely Park in Downtown Hong Kong. I thoroughly enjoyed our walk through this park. It was so beautifully decorated with flowers and water features - and on the way to the tram for Victoria Peak. The smallest McDonalds I've ever seen is there and just a beautiful park.

A Green Gem. What a gorgeous green refuge set aside in a sea of concrete. Once inside, you forget that a city of 7 million is pressing in at the borders. Plan to spend hours here because there's so much to see in Hong Kong Park. We toured the aviary first. I loved the elevated boardwalks in the jungle-like setting, with dozens of types of birds to enjoy. I appreciated that so many of the trees were identified with signs providing information about the species. You can actually register to get married in the park, which would make a beautiful setting for a wedding.Climb 105 steps to the top of the look-out tower for breathtaking views of the city. We dallied here almost half an hour and hated to go back down. The conservatory building is divided into two main sections - desert plants and tropical plants. Since I love to take pictures of unique plants and flowers, we spent more than half an hour here and would have been longer, but my companions kept moving me along.The artificial pond is gorgeous, lined with amazing flowers and filled with beautiful koi. An extended family of turtles frolicks in the water or suns on the rocks. There's a small museum on the property dedicated to the history of tea making. Because the park closes at 5:00, we ran out of time and didn't get to visit this exhibit.It's hard to fathon the zero admission fee to this park, or to any exhibit inside the park. It's impeccably maintained. I could have explored much longer, had we arrived earlier.
great stroll, esp. if going to the Tram. HK Park is a great stroll from the city toward the Tram. very large, peaceful. The view from the spiral tower is really good.
Bit of peace and quiet. Nice and green and fresh away from all the noise and traffic! Some cages with various animals to see. Nicely laid out gardens with kiosk and fountains.
Good break. Nice bit of greenery and a good place to take a break from touring around the island. And then head to Central or soho for a bite to eat.
Walk in the park. Was lovely walk around these very clean gardens. Lovely colour, fountains, aviary, nice way to spend an hour

Excellent Park. Wow, in the middle of the city is this wonderful park. It is a good size, containing a great conservatory (though you ned to climb steps to get to it), lakes, fountains, a walk through aviary, and the Flagstaff Tea House (whih was partially closed to us). It is uphill at times, but with many beautiful views, places to sit and enjoy the ducks, turtles, vegetation, etc. This is a great place to visit and spend 1-2 hours.

A Little Island of Green.. Me and my wife had spent a few hour on the Peak Railway / gallery and on our retun the the start point noticed a sign to the Botanical Gardens and Zoo. If you walk up the Road about 200 metres under the flyover you gome to the main entrance. Absolutely free to go in, this place was great. Spotless ( including the public loos) as well as loads of Averies with birds and small mamals. After a few minutes you totally forget that you are in one of the busiest city's in the world. Lovley place and well worth a couple of hour.
Lovely Park. This park is within walking distance of the Conrad Hotel & is on the way to the "Peak:. Pretty gardens!!
beautiful setting in the midst of high density. Really peaceful setting and never seemed crowded when I was there. Lots of greenery and water, various areas to sit and enjoy.
Lovely peaceful place. Lovely early morning walk, and watching people come together fir yoga classes was fascinating, it's peaceful and lovely clean park, worth a Little stroll through,

Best city park ever. Perfect financial district getaway. Lovely aviary, Tai Chi garden and loads of interesting plants. Even crowded during peak hours it still manages to give a very calming atmosphere

an oasis in the middle of a bustling city. Hong Kong Park is a great way to take up some time and see some beautiful parkland, an enormous walk through bird avery and some amazing sites. to do this park real justice you would need a few hours to wander leisurely around. This is another must see & do when in Hong Kong.

Perfect park. So very well kept with lots of different parts to wander around. Easy walking. It was good to see the locals doing there morning exercise (tai chi ).the park has lovely flowers, trees and shrubs and water features, as well as sculpture. It can also be used as a short cut to the ferry terminal. Well worth a visit to take you out of the hustle and bustle of the streets.

Hong Kong Park. Nicely landscaped, and the botanical garden and aviary are worth a visit. You can still glimpse the skyscrapers surrounding - go to Statue Square to be right amongst them. Tea Museum in the park is worth a visit too.

more than you expect. It is not only a park! However it is a beaty gem at the legs of skyscrapers, but it has botanic garden exhibition with butterflies in the right time for them, and also an amazing aviary, or bird park, how you like it. Some caged one in huge, healthy voliers and a lot of them freely flying and nesting in a half covered, half net covered building. Breath taking moments when they fly to exam you from 20-30 cm. Also in the park you can see the tea ware museum, but note! It is closed on Tuesdays!

Pretty, lively mid-city respite. A small but well-designed park surrounded by banking/corporate skyscrapers, including a fun museum of tea, fountains, and a pretty lake. Amazingly restful in the midst of craziness.
Bliss. Free. Tranquil. Aviary. Calm in the middle of a busy city.Visited here a couple of times. Lovely for photography.Nothing to dislike.

Quiet break. I was in Hong Kong for a week, and had spent Sunday morning to early afternoon up the 'Peak', and had used the Peak tram to go up and down. On decent I fancied exploring a little more and spent a short time in the Park. I focused on the aviary and took lots of pictures. It is designed so that you can walk through and the walkways enable you to look down on the birds quite often. Also bird feeders are nearby enabling some close-up shots. Nice walk and very pleasant..

More enjoyable and worthwhile than the guidebook description. Yes it is man made - but what a gem to find. The aviary here knocks spots off those in the zoo.If you want a relaxing walk away from the buzz of the city, this is the place to go

A surprise find worth the trouble. We didn't find the park until late in our stay and would have enjoyed more time to explore. This is a significant park right in the middle of the city and is much enjoyed by the people. Aviary, lakes, sports facilities a huge pool and more. Well worth seeing.
Tea exhibition and aviary. Funny teapots and cups there. Try some tea and buy if you like it. Do the walk behind the waterfall and take a sunbath somewhere in the park. Aviary is magnificent!

Park visit. Lovely area to relax and chill out. Tea house museum very interesting with exhibition of art potttery, amazing takes on the teapot!!! Aviary also good with walkways through and area to stop and take photos _ good variety of birds with plenty of information for identifying them. lovely gardens and waterfalls. Ponds with fish and plentiful terrapins.

Always a favorite place to visit. This beautiful park in the midst of one of the busiest and most densely crowded cities is a must visit. Each time I have been in Hong Kong, I always try to spend some quiet time there, especially with my dearest friend. Beautiful surroundings, quiet spots to just sit and relax, a very interesting tea ware museum, an aviary and more.

Small, but amazing city park.. One of the best small city parks we have been to. From the flowers to the turtles and koi in the pond to the flowers and fountains, everything was very well done. Great place to people watch, too.
An oasis in the busy city. Spend some time wandering around this park. There is a little bit for everyone here. You'll love it!

YES! and it's free!. What a delight!Climb up the never-ending steps, walk through the curtain and find yourself at tree-top height surrounded by birds.......flying!For what I think is a dump of a city this place was a gem.

For a nice stroll in the park. On a summer day this would be a wonderful place to visit. I visited it during the middle of the winter when it was cold and raining. Nevertheless, I enjoyed what I saw. I walked around Fountain Plaza in the park, visited the Flagstaff House Museum of Tea Ware, aviary, the Tai Chi Garden, the Conservatory, and walked around the Artificial Lake and under it's waterfalls. If you would like to see pictures and a short video of the park, please go to http://www.WhyVisitChina.com.

Great oasis in the middle of ong Kong Island. It is a great park in the middle of big buildings and busy streets. It is amazing how peaceful it is just walking around enjoying the green, the flowers and the water features. If you like birds, a portion of the park is covered by a huge net and here they keep dozens of birds in a somewhat natural habitat. I walked around looking at the different birds for almost an hour, it was that nice. In the park there is also a tea house you should not miss. I had some tea, and they have a great selection and some dim sum. All in all, it was a pleasant and relaxing excursion
Nice park in city centre. No trip to HK is complete without a trip to HK gardens in Central. Great place for a lunch break, the aviary is worth a visit

Beautiful public park. I was impressed by this public park. It’s free yet it is clean and well maintained. Hats off to the HK government for spending a considerable amount of money developing this place. It’s a welcome respite inside an urban jungle. A quiet place to relax for a while. Museum of Tea Ware is located inside offering loads of information about tea. The Edward Youde Aviary is also interesting where you will walk in an elevated walkway to see lots of different birds. There’s also a fantastic conservatory educating you about the various trees and plants living in different climate. Lots of facilities to explore. Worth going here.

An escape but with history. A local haven (plenty of local weddings) with quiet walkways. It does involve a number of steep steps so be warned. Flagstaff House is a little bit of history and it stands next to the statue of Robert Osborn VC of the Winnipeg Rifles who earned the ultimate medal for valour in defence of Hong Kong in 1941.
NICE PARK. A quiet place away from all the noise.Lots of plants and a nice aviary.Water features.Having toured the park you can then visit the harbour from the park

Nice place to relax. We have found this one just by accident, when we were walking from Mid-Level escalators to Peak Tram. I was really surprised by this piece of nature surrounded by skyscrapers. I really enjoyed walking thru even we did not have more time.

Peace and Tranquillity in the City. We walked through the park enroute to the station for the Peak Tram from Admiralty on the Metro.It offers peace in the hub hub of the city with amazing views of the sky scrapers surrounding. In the park they have an elevated bird walk and butterflies. All in all a perfect place to spend a couple of quiet hours and perhaps enjoy a picnic
Nice spot. Loved all the different types of birds in the walk in aviary but the zoo and botanical gardens had a great collection of birds andm monkeys as well

Free Tea Session. My main purpose to Hong Kong park was for the free tea session that foreigners are entitled to. You must make a reservation and I think its about 2 days before. I travelled in mid October and its got a perfect weather to take a stroll in Hong Kong park. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you are going there for tea at the Lock Cha Tea Shop, they'd teach you how to brew tea, kung fu style! Address: Lock Cha Tea Shop, G/F KS Lo Gallery, Hong Kong Park, Admiralty, Hong Kong Island Tel: +852 2801 7177MTR Admiralty Station, Exit C1. Walk across the footbridge to Pacific Place and then take the escalator up to Hong Kong Park. The gallery will be on your right.Oh the walk involves some uphill and downhill, so be prepared to sweat a little, they also have aviaries for those into birds. Bring: camera, water, small towel

Lovely respite from a busy city. Definitely walk through.. There's a nice walk through aviary where you actually get a good look at the birds... A Thai chi garden, a view tower to climb (if you're up for the 100ish steps) and a tea ware museum (closed the day I visited due to Chinese New Year).. Visit the big fish and the little turtles in the man made lake and find a chair to perch on and do a bit of people watching.I'm glad I took the time... You can't shop the whole time you're here!!

Really beautiful. This is an immaculate park right in the heart of the city, near to the Peak Tram and the Bank of China building.
We were there just as they were preparing for Chinese New Year and it looked magical.
The locals clearly love it too; every time we walked through we saw wedding couples having their pictures taken.

A great place to wind down. It was just across the hotel we stayed in and we had to walk through it to get to the Peak Tram station. Definitely a nice calming place to wind down and enjoy an intimate down time with your loved ones.

Peak tram queue ? - go to the park instead. Access is a bit tricky from the tram but walk with care across the arterial road and the park is a recent ( setup in 1990's) addition. Climb up to the outdoor closed aviary, well worth lingering for up to an hour looking at the birds feeding. The park restaurant is excellent, you can eat indoors or outside under awnings.The Ox noodle soup was really tender and nourishing.

Oasis in the midst of High Rise. I couldn't recommend enough Hong Kong Park. There are a lot to see here: the tea museum, the impressive bird aviary, butterfly area. Just stroll around, you will bound to run into wedding couples having their pictures taken. It is a meaningful and interesting way to spend the whole afternoon here. There is a lot of Hong Kong spirit in this park. It is a muss for me everytime when I am in town. Just never got enough of it. You can also spend time sitting on a bench and watching the people walk by. You will never get bored. Wonderful place to be at in order to get away from the hustle and bustle around and relax. Don't forget to go up further to the little zoo, that is where the school use to take us out for excursion. There is an old fashion charm to it.

Great respite. We went here to fill some time and thoroughly loved it.The park is all man made including the waterfall. The fountains were great to play in and there were lots of areas to sit in.Although only filling a small area there is lots to do. There was lots of staff around ensuring that everything is kept spotlessly clean.Go, you will love it.

How to breath in HK!. I am sure when you are all shopped out on HK island and Nathan road you are thinking, how do I get some serenity in HK??? Well the answer is simple, HK park!HK park has a number of great areas to wander around, the most impressive, and well worth the walk up, is the bird aviary. Hundreds of birds in a HUGE area provide a welcome break from the hustle of HK. Then head down to the ponds for some fish and turtle watching...All in all, HK park is a great escape from the hustle of HK....Well worth a visit!!

Nice gem in the middle of the city. Our hotel was right next to this park, and so we walked through it multiple times. There is a lot to see in it, really. There is a tai chi area, an aviary, and multiple other sections. It is pretty spectacular to see the greenery next to the sky scrapers and all. This park also flanks the line to the tram, which is right around the corner from the botanical gardens. Why not hit them all?

Loved the serentiy, birds and animals.. Such an oasis in the dense HK jungle. All sorts of beautiful birds, gorillas and the antics of the orang-utans were hilarious. There is an area of 8 hectares to cover, so we did it on two separate visits. You can approach it from different streets as there are a few entrances. Official address is 19 Cotton Tree Drive, Central. Still things to discover there, so we will be going back again.

Escape the masses. A nice park to sit and relax. Away from the noise and people. No really!! Go sit, read a book. Sip a nice cool drink. Look at the gardens, trees and birds. Breath a heavy sigh before you get up and face the masses.
Aviary definitely worth a visit. If you go to Hong Kong Park, then go and visit the Aviary. It's a sanctuary of birdsong in the city, and the range of birds is amazing!
Peace in the city. Built on a old British army barracks. Its a little bit of peace and quite in a very noisy city. A great place to sit and eat your lunch or to just spend a little while relaxing,

Gardens, birds, trees. Nice place to escape the crowd from the streets with the view of beautiful gardens full of flowers, and different trees. Trees are tagged with their names. There are fountains with fish and turtles.The aviary has a large amount of bird species. You can enjoy your walk through the aviary watching the different species fly near you. They keep the place very neat. Tea lovers like me would really enjoyed the Tea Ware museum. You will learn about the benefits of the different kinds of tea, the culture of drinking tea, the history behind tea, how to serve tea appropriately, and different tea ware designs ancient and modern. It's amazing! There is no fee for the park or the Tea Ware Museum.

Peaceful Gem in bustling Hong Kong. I was delighted by the walk through Aviary and Tai Chi area along with the peaceful forest and pond filled with turtles and gold fish. Hong is such a bustling city - traffic, trams, and massive high-rise buildings, it was a pleasure to find this peaceful area in the heart of the city.

A Peaceful Refuge Among the Skyscrapers of the Central. Hong Kong Park is a place you least expect to find in the center of the business district, a wonderfully planned park is totally harmonious with the surrounding skyscrapers. The place is great for walking, enjoying the landscape design & great aviary with beautiful birds.

A calm oasis. This is very close to the back of Pacific Place so worth a wander as you can walk to the peak Tram from here and vice versa. Flagstaff House Museum of Tea Ware is worth a quick visit if you are passing as it is in one of the few old buildings around Central.

A green place amoung the buildings!. A good place to escape from the noice...with nice views on the big buildings. Inside there is a little tea museum in a victorian building.You will also find a very interesting aviary with 360 different kind of birds!The park is opened till 11:00 pm but the aviary only till 5:00.

Beautiful Aviary. Apart from a beautiful and clean green oasis, HK park contains a large and well kept aviary with many beautiful local birds that are thriving! We stayed at the Upper House and walked with our 16-month old son to the park. We were delighted to spend a couple of hours in the aviary which was FREE and in great condition.

Hong kong park visit. Enroute to the Peak Tram station - we took a walk around the Park and found it quite nice and interesting, the highlight of the Park was the Aviary which to me was very well designed with the birds within sight (some feeding points were placed close to the foot bridge) - the park itself wasn't as big and is rather hilly, getting to it from Admiralty MTR station was a bit troublesome having to cross 2 major roads
Nice. A green garden in the center of town. a place to relax and watch bitds and plants. Worth to visit on weekend (Sundays) and see many couples get married.
Impressive. Very well kept in a spectacular setting surrounded by skyscrapers. The aviary is really nice too and free!

Great Feng Shui!. Loved this park! Lots of greenery and interesting attractions. The bird sanctuary was so peaceful. A lovely place to enjoy nature and great place for photos of colorful birds. Good for all travelers. Very near to The Garden View YWCA Hotel by walk. Not far from the Peak tram entrance as well.

Oasis in the concrete jungle. The Hong Kong Park is really an oasis in the concrete jungle.It used to be part of the British Hong Kong military establishment, and was reverted back to the Hong Kong / China government as part of the 1997 process. It went through the second world war under Japanese rule. A lot of horror stories, and yes, ghost stories still exist there. Other contributors have done a great job describing the place. What I will suggest is how best to use your time there. The Hong Kong Tourism Board offers through KS Lo Gallery free tea appreciation class that situated right in the park. Also the Flagstaff museum of tea ware and a small exhibition of stone stamps / seals carving are there too. If you take the elevator from the Pacific Place building to the Park, there is a great food hall at the lower level of the Pacific Place Building that will give you a good grocery pricing comparison of the higher class people that live in Hong Kong.So combine all these with the visit to the Hong Kong Park, that will best utilize your time. The tea appreciation class is from 4 to 6 and the museums are closed at 6, take the time to visit the park, the museums and the grocery place, that will take about 3 hours, before the tea appreciation class.KS Lo Gallery offers dim sum and tea for lunch, and there is an outdoor restaurant in the Park. You may want to enjoy your good eating there too.
The aviary is awesome. The aviary, in the middle of the city with the skyscrapers behind as background is very cool. Free, clean and many different species

Stroll through nature in the middle of Hong Kong. HK Park is ideal for getting some green space in the urban environs. Many people choose to walk and picnic in the many open spaces here. Plenty of trees, grassy lawns, and ponds, as well as a few attractions including an aviary and playgrounds for children.

Nice park not too crowded. Once we found it (it's approx 10mins from the MTR but a bit confusing) Hong Kong Park turned out to be a nice little walk away from the hustle and bustle. It's not big but there's a pond, waterfall and a tea museum which were all interesting. Nice also to sit down and enjoy the city for a bit, HK seems to be against seats in the city, you don't find many around?!

Hilly and full of attractions. Hong Kong Park is beautiful, and a respite from the crowds. Make sure to walk through the spectacular aviary. Because the park is on a hill, the views of HK's most famous high-rises is spectacular. The entrance to the park is on the downhill side, across the street from the Conrad Hotel. Don't try to get in from the uphill edge.

Great aviary!. Check out the birdwatching in the aviary. We went there in the rain, and it was still impressive! Its large, with elevated walkways throughout. Friendly for strollers, kids, walkers, etc. Lots of benches. Free!

Busy Sunday afternoon. Stopped in the Park for an hour or so on a busy Sunday afternoon. Plenty of water features and differing plants, plenty of photo stops, and more wedding parties as close to the Registry Office. Disappointed with the indoor hot house - no clear marking and not a lot to see.

Wonderful walking park, maintained beautifully. There are many places to visit in Hong Kong, the park and Victoria Harbor are two that stand out. The beauty of the park is amazing, maintained so perfectly in such a large, congested city with so many buildings. Take 2-3 hours at minimum to relax and stroll through this masterpiece of man working with nature.
Good park. Go to this park if you want to see local activities from hong kong residence, most of the visitor is the senior residence

An Oasis in a bustling city.. Small but a quiet and welcome space amongst the high rise office buildings & hotels of the area.Green and with beautiful water features like waterfalls & small lakes. Not very busy during the weekdays and quiet, serene restful place to relax and escape from the hustle & bustle of the city outside it's boundaries. The aviary is worth a visit as it is big enough for the birds to fly around but not quite like being in their natural environment.

Beautiful Calm Oasis. Hong Kong Park presents a beautiful green space in an area otherwise overwhelmed by traffic and skyscrapers. The bird sanctuary is a must see and it is walking distance to the cable car for Victoria Peak

Nice but small. If you stay in Shangri La or Conrad it's just 50 mtrs away across the street and can be easily visited in 15 min. Nice palms and trees, some fountains, great skyscrapers view and very cute titles in every fountain. But really small and crowded because lots of people use this park as a way to a station...

Nice little park to walk through or spend some time. This park was across the street from our hotel and we could walk through the park on our way to the peak tram. We enjoyed an afternoon lounge in the park as well on a sunny day. It seems so quiet it is hard to believe you are in such a big city.

Beautiful park nestled within crowded city. The Hong Kong Park was a welcome break from the crowded & concrete city just outside the park. Thankfully, once inside the Park, you feel like you are miles away from the city, its so peaceful, beautiful, green & serene.My favorite place in the park was the waterfalls. The sound & ambiance it creates, takes you to a "faraway waterfalls in a forest" kind environment. I did not visit the aviary since I am not a big fan of seeing animals/birds trapped within constricted spaces.

One of the best places in Hong Kong. After being rather disappointed with Hong Kong itself, we didn't expect a lot from the park. However, we found it to be a wonderful oasis in the huge city. Many attractions of which the best to us was the birds residence (called Edward Youde Aviary I think). Best of all, it's all free!

Hidden gem in the city. I stumbled upon this gem of a park on a Sunday when I lost my way - and its really an oasis in the middle of the city ! Good to spend a couple of hours to relax while taking a break from shopping.

a bit of green in Central. We took about 30 minutes to go through Hong Kong Park in Central with its falls, pond, birds and vegetation – plus aviary. First ‘attraction” was the fountain where tourists went in under the falling water curtain. We looked at trees and birds donated but not indigenous to HK – some died, some barely survived (like the jujube tree) and some thrived – like the cockatoo. Our guide also talked about a croc that its owner had released into the pond, presumably because he had grown too big to be taken care of at home. There was the Olympic memorial built to commemorate HK’s participation in the 2008 Beijing Olympics – but only for equestrian events. There was the Flagstaff House, the oldest existing Western building in HK built in 1846. It was the office-residence of the British Commander until 1978 then in 1984 converted into the TeaWare Museum. Also the pink Rawlinson House built for the Deputy British Commander now the Marriage Registry. All in all, a nice half hour.
Pleasant get away from the skyrises. Tranquil park in the haart of the bustling financial area. Make sure you visit Lok Cha Tea House for vegetarian dim sum while you are there.

Cool calm and connected!. Hong Kong does have quite a lot of small pocket parks especially in Kowloon. On the island there are fewer but this one is really pleasant during the week. Like most places in HK the weekends are not such a good choice as crowds can be extreme! Worth a walk, rest and maybe some Tai Chi or other gentle excercise.The upkeep is very good which ensures a clean environment for all. Enjoy your visit and take only photographs and memories.

On the same way to the Victoria Peak if take by tram. It is a treasure Park which located in this Concrete Jungle City. The HK Park is next to the Tram station to the Victoria Peak. If you have time to stop by, you can feel what is the "treasure" here means.

Calm place in the city. Great place to escape the noisy and busy streets of Hong Kong. Nice walks between the trees and flowers, lakes full of fish and turtles, fountains and sculptures and birds. And the tea ware museum and tea house are worth a visit as well.

Oasis in the middle of a concrete jungle. Hong Kong Park is a great place to relax, stroll or even exercise. The views of HKG and Kowloon are great if you walk to the higher areas. Don't miss the conservatory. The water fountains are well done. There is easy access from the Admiralty Metro through the shopping mall.

Overated by Most.. Found myself drawn by others opinions and discovered that Kowloon Park has far more to offer. Lots of space but very crowded and whilst full of lots of botanic opportunities it just seemed to lack a tangible appeal. I guess that if you are in the area of the main drag it is worth a look but not a repeat visit.
Beautiful little piece of peace.... It was great in the middle of the concrete jungle. Lovely grounds, museums, aviary, conservatory which are all free. Great for a break from the hectic pace.

A great location to get married at!. This was the site of the Cotton Tree Drive Marriage Registry, and I selected it as our wedding location. The gardens all around made for some really nice wedding photos.

Beautifully landscaped area in the middle of the skyscrapers. We only really visited this park as a way to walk to the Peak Tam terminus as we had already visited Kowloon Park and thought it would be similar. However we were very glad we did stroll through as it was a lovely place and on a hot day it would be a lovely to find some cool areas with fewer people. Well worth a visit.
Little oasis in the centre of bustling city. It is a beautiful garden - right in the centre of HK. I loved being able to walk around with relatively few people around in this buzzy city.

Lovely park with an excellent aviary, and a gorgeous tea house.. We visited this park both times we were in Hong Kong, and loved it. The aviary is worth seeing, as is the Tai Chi garden. But the best thing is the Lock Cha tea shop, which is great for tea and Dim Sum, at very reasonable prices. The staff will advise you which tea to try if you're not sure, and for lunch try at least three or four of their (vegetarian) dim sum. Delicious!

Filled with surprises. Hong Kong park is filled with surprises for the spontaneous visitor. The fountain is not to be missed when you want to sit and take a break from the crowds nearby, and we also enjoyed just standing around in the public space. During our recent weekend visit, my companion was captivated and thrilled with all the activities on offer, and was still smiling hours afterwards. I had a great time too, but was left feeling a smidgeon unsatisfied.
Lovely park, lakes & fountains. Well visited park, particularly on weekends. Lots of large quoi in the lakes. Sometimes see weddings taking place.
Very relaxing. Lot of Thai Chi going on, water fountains, different areas to sit , bird avery and easy access around the park

Oasis in the heart of the city. Fantastic cool spot with walk through aviary and formal oriental style gardens, plus a pool with turtles! The perfect place to combine with a ride on the Peak Tram as it's close to the lower terminus.

An oasis of calm. This is a great place to get some calm amid the bustle of the city. Plenty of shade to get away from the heat with ponds, fountains and a waterfall too. We were only visiting Honk Kong for a week but we liked to take a cool drink and our books and to read and people watch for a while. There was almost always a wedding party having photos taken, in fact I think there is a registry office in the heart of the park. There is also a café and a tea room and a Museum of Tea. On a practical note there are also toilets which we always very clean!

Peaceful In The Park. Hong Kong city is exciting with much to occupy the mind but with warm daytime temperatures the Park is an ideal location to relax and recharge the batteries. Accessed through the city High Court building and near to the Queensway Plaza tram stop an escalator takes you to the Park level with delightful wooded and grassed areas plus much running water. We were there over a busy lunch period with office staff making use of the facilities and fuelled by food from local eateries in the Court Building. Break your viewing schedule here and you will not be disappointed.

Down time in downtown Hong Kong. This is the place I run to when, after a while of being in HK, I realise that it is just not possible to keep up with the locals. They really do talk, walk, eat and finalise business deals faster than I ever will. So if you are a fellow visitor, or have just started working in HK, take a step back, bring a packed lunch and enjoy the beautiful surroundings here. To chill even further, visit the Aviary and Flagstaff Tea Museum (see separate reviews). Then head back into the real world feeling refreshed and ready to compete for that last seat in the noodle house in Wan Chai...

Wonderful. Make a visit for your leisure, take good camera to do a lot of photoshoot, enjoy the colorful fishes in the pond with lot of turtles. Varied range for Flora and Fauna.Can easily spend 2-3 hours in the park without getting bored.

Just Beautiful !. Would be nice to go here when the weather is not so warm, the aviary felt like a sauna but so worth it. There were some beautiful birds. The grounds are so well kept. Also visited the tea museum and had lunch in the cute little proper tea house ! Made a nice afternoon in this little haven of calm in a huge city.

A quite random yet beautiful part of Hong Kong. Came across this place by complete accident!A quiet a tranquil area of the big City.Some fantastic pieces of art along with bright flowers and birds, such a wonderful place to be.

Peaceful and Meditating. The Hong Kong Park is located in Central Hong Kong, it is a beautiful, peaceful and meditating place. It's a perfect place to relax and chill off. It is perfect for a long walk or jog as it is quiet and there is no disturbance. It has outstanding view as well and represents nature very well. It has lots of fountains and natural waterfalls!!! They have various pools and oh!, the best part is they have massive and huge fishes and beautiful tiny turtles. These fountains and waterfalls make up a glamorous scenery or view that is to die for! And don't worry if you are tired there are benches and other facilities available. It is way better than the Victoria Peak and is free of charge. Not only that, but what makes the park better than the Victoria Peak is because of the view. I forgot to mention that they have conservatories, artificial pools and an Olympic stadium. If you do have some spare time then do visit the Hong Kong Park it is definitely worthwhile.

Charming oasis. A short walk from the hotel and it was clean, quiet, peaceful with the waterfalls, and had a few sanctuaries that made the stroll lovely for a business traveler needing a few minutes to relax. Well done indeed.
Wonderful views. Well worth a visit - but make sure you get to see the city views (behind the tram station) as well as the harbour views (from the shopping centre)

Peaceful oasis in a busy city!. I took my 85 year old mother to Hong Kong Park, Central whilst staying in the city recently. This is just the best park! We caught a taxi to the top entrance and wandered down through the amazing bird aviary, along easy walkways, past the children's playground, the lake, the waterfall and fountain areas to the other side of the park. There was plenty of seating along the way for breaks and enjoying the plants, birdlife, turtles and fish. It was quiet and peaceful and we forgot we were in the middle of the city. There are maps on boards along the way. Had a delightful drink at the restaurant then caught a taxi from the hotel opposite. This is just a lovely haven in Hong Kong and so interesting. An excellent outing for older visitors but everyone will enjoy a visit. Highly recommended.

A beautiful 'secluded' oasis. What a fabulous place. So refreshingly green full of interesting flora and fauna and water features. The memorial to those who gave their ives in 2003 fighting SARS was a moving reminder of how fragile all we tske for granted is. I felt very privileged to enjoy the joy of HK in this lovely spot.

Not huge, interesting and hilly.. We walked through this around midnight and felt very safe, we saw a female jogger on her own for example.The maps confused us and we had trouble finding our way out.There is a circular tower to climb during the day, it is a fair few steps though and we decided to skip it, you do get a good view regardless.It was clean and we saw an official walking around one of the exhibits.There is an enclosed botanical section, however this was closed when we passed it.In summary, very hilly, very safe and clean.

Surprise in a crowded city. With all the non stop and crowded areas of Hong Kong Island its a great surprise to discover a wonderful park in the center of it all, so many areas to search, and enjoy, i visited Flagstaff house Tea Museum it small and even though i don't drink tea found it interesting but not being allowed to take photo's is a bit of a downer

Busy. You just have to go and visit this place, its quick, busy, good & an experience.We by-passed the City from the A/Port but during the course of the stop, we ended up coming back through the Piers and the Ferrys, it may look frightening, belive me it's not.

Beautiful place, enjoyable day out and FREE!. This place is fantastic for all the family. Beautiful large pond with hundreds and hundreds of fish and terrapins. All the plants are facinating and I'm not even 'into' plants like my partner. The bird enclosure is just incredable and we spent ages in there. Highly reccommend visiting.

Nice!!. We walked through this park to reach the tram station (at night). Eventually we could not go up the peak as it was very crowded so decided to have dinner at a restaurant inside the park.Im sure this park would be lovely in the evenings...I have a few pics of night time. Shall visit this place next time.

Peaceful place. I had to walk through the park each way to work. It is amazing how you feel so quite and isolated even though you are in the middle of the city. Lots to do and see.. I would recommend a visit

Lovely retreat. A lovely retreat from the hussel and bussel of the busy shopping area around the star Ferry area. Some of the touts can be a bit much and you will find mostly elderly locals in the Gardens. Doing their Tai Chi and just sitting. Very pretty gardens with some interesting Statues of Chinese Comic characters.

A lovely tranquil spot. I love this park. It has a lovely pond with fish and terrapins. A waterfall, great for photos and wonderful plants. It's hard to believe you are in the centre of HK as it's so lovely.

Nice place to take photos. It's a small Park but we'll designed. There is another big Park nearby. Have small fish pond. Where can see nice colourful fishes and turtle. If you traveling to Victoria peak then worth to visit this park. Can view Hong Kong skyline building when facing north.

nice park in the busy city. It's hard to find a park for some fresh air in Central. This one is quiet and nice and not jammed with the noisy China tourists. You can really get a quiet and peaceful mind there. Also fun to go with kids as there are some animals and birds (although you cannot feed them)

Great spot to relax. Lovely place for peace and quiet in the city, lake, museum, tea house, bar, aviary and bird cages with some good views of the backs of landmark buildings if you're missing the city.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city...great for relaxation or families. This park was a perfect sanctuary in the middle of bustling Hong Kong city. There were fish and turtles in the pond, a beautiful waterfall to take pictures in front of and overall, an amazing place if you just need to get away. We kept thinking how nice it would be to have our neices and nephews with us as they would love it so if you are traveling with kids, I highly recommend this beautiful and free city treasure.
Surprising. This place is a lovely way to spend a few hours. The observation tower makes for great photo fodder. Do this, the peak and Hong Kong gardens and zoo all together.
Away from the bustle. Lots to see and do here, can be very busy at weekends and holiday times just a nice place to wonder or sit and watch

Imagine the history. This is a lovely park of lush green tropical plants, set in the centre of the bustling town centre. Its not quiet (how could it be ) and it is busy, but nonetheless bags of atmosphere and history. oh, and wear as little as possible its very humid.

Peaceful Haven. A great place to drop in and get away from the hubbub of down-town HK.It is quite near to the peak tram station and an easy walk to other attractions.Be sure to visit the tea room there.

Oasis in the heart of a beating city. Next door to the British Consulate-General (behind Ocean Plaza). It has a walk-in aviary, large lake stuffed with terrapins and koi. Lots of water and fountains. Good to walk through to reach the Peak Tram terminal on Cotton Tree Drive.
peaceful. peaceful atmosphere for a walk with kids, nice play ground for kids, pond of gold fishes was nice too
Very scenic park. On the way to Victoria Peak, stop by the park. Very nice park. Very peaceful. The plant life there is amazing. The people there are also very nice.

Birds. There is a large walkthrough bird cage where you can find a lot of different birds inside. Take your camera with you and I am sure you can take many good photos of birds there. Hong Kong park is a good choice for travelers to visit where you can also see plants in green house and water fountains. You won't be disappointed.
A fun walk!. A bit of peace in the city. Nice to stroll through on your way to somewhere, or you can spend a bit longer checking out the different things the park has to offer.
Nice place to get a fresh air. It was very nice to see the all kinds of tresss and all the birds Sactuary. And also good for excersice.

nice place to relax. the park is very nicely maintained. there different areas to relax. The is a lookout tower which is worth the climb as there are some nice views. There is also an avery which is nice and is free of charge to enter. The park is located next to the tram station to take you to the peak so would be convenient to visit on the same day perhaps.
oasis. Amazing how quickly you can get away from the madness around you. Beautiful park, great view and good tea house.

A nice park in a metropolis. The park is located not far away from the busiest place in Hong Kong. The park is built along the hill side. There are many trees, flowers, ponds, waterfalls, children playgrounds, art works, green house, bird house, etc. in the park. There are also museums inside the park. It is a nice place to visit and take photos.

Beautiful park, do not miss! Hk park, flagstaff house, the peak tram. Prepare for a long walk but its worth it. Inside the park is FlaGstaff house museum of teaware which is worth a 15-20 minutes visit. Then after the park, you can see signs going to the peak tram. I visited with my family at around 2pm (1400hr), hk park with 1 1/2 hour, then maybe youll be spending less than an hour queuing at the peak tram, enjoy the rest of the afternoon and evening at the peak, beautiful view at night,

Lovely park. This park is lovely for a stroll went with the children and they had a lovely time bird spotting and walking through the water fountains it's not particularly huge but it's cool under the shaded trees and nice place for an outside lunch.

Jungle of trees, jungle of skyscreapers. It is a pleasure to walk easily and relaxed in this smal but very pretty parck just behind the jungle of skiscreapers rising from HK Central finacian district.
Dont miss the walk behind the waterfall from where there is a great view of the Bank of china and Citi Bank towers

visit it if you have an extra two hours, it may be worth it. it is located right in Central, the busiest downtown. The neat thing is that you are surrounded by huge commercial high rises, namely the Cheung Kong Centre, the Bank of China, the Citi Bank...etc. it is quite different from being in the Central Park in NYC or the Hyde Park in LON. Better yet, you can visit the Aviary. The whole visit may take a good hour, plus transportation or getting to another destination on foot from here, assume 2 hours. i would reserve this visit as secondary, prioritize your visit and leave it till the last day when you know that you have a few hours to kill, and do not wish to rush to another major hot spot. It is a decent place to visit with very few tourists. We visited it in mid morning on our last day, then we just walked to the food court in these commercial buildings for lunch to kill the last morning in HKG in our july visit.
nice park in central. nature nature and naturevery nie park in central,perfect place to spend evenings.great place for kids

Definitely worth the trip. It may just have been the day we went, but the view from the Peak was amazing. We just went up for the view, but there is plenty of eating and shopping to do while you are there too. It is a great way to see the Island as a whole, not just the city.

Hidden Gem in the Central. The Glass house area comes as a surprise in the center of the hussle bussle, you can reach some tranquilty whilst in the dryness and heated area housing the cactuses or next door be in the air conditioned area mimicing the rainforest. There's plenty of birds to check out in the huge bird area where there's a winded route in the netted area. Its a relaxing place to go to after a shopping spree in the center of the city.

Wonderful City park. Great place to walk around to get away from the hustle of the city. Lots of pedestrian traffic criss-crossing the park. Great gardens and trees. You can actually find some quit spots to relax
small park. Good to take a little rest from the busy city. But the weather made it almost impossible to sit here for along time. The park is small too.

they have a record of cruelty to animals. We are against animal being trapped to give show to tourists. The park keeps obtaining animals for show. Their stories about self-breeding are just lies and PR tactics. The intelligent dolphins should have been in the wild swimming, why should they be trapped to do tricks for you ?

It is next to the tram terminus (to the peak). It is a big garden but nothing special. If you have time, take a look. Not so acctractive. There are a lot of foreign domestic workers enjoy their holiday there.

Nice for a praceful walk. I really enjoyed taking a walk outside my hotel to this beautiful park. If you get there really early, it was nice to see the local people that came down to work out or just for a stretch or Tai chi session were so welcoming in greeting you good morning. A special spot was the teaware museum. There is a lovely little tea house that was a great stop when it rained. I really liked the attentive staff, the great dim sum an if course the tea.
Great place for a walk. Every time I'm in Hong Kong I always head to the Park, the trams, ferry and the Peak. Things like this are cheap to do and gives you a sense of the city.
Nothing to see without your trunks. It's a park with a swimming centre and a few statues of unknowns. As parks go, this is nothing special
Don't waste your time. The park had old dirty equipment. There was a nice atrium to walk through. Kowloon Park is spectacular. Go there over Hong Kong Park.
Great Park. My kids loved this park - particularly the bird aviary. A great way to see the birds of Hong Kong. We came here after the Peak tram and it is walking distance from the tram terminal.

Beautiful.. Prepare yourself for the stair climb, you might think its easy but its not. If you don't stretch you will struggle for the next few days. In saying that, the view at the top is definitely worth it. Its just amazing. The walk from the village to the Buddha is nice too, lots of cultural statues, and beautiful mountains to look at.
Hide out the noise. This is an excellent place to hide out from the noiss of crazy street. I highly recommend to come here in the early morning or late afternoon. it was ao cool and romantic,too.
Lovely park. Lovely park, was not planning to go, but couldn't resist the water features. The park is great for a stroll. Some turtles in the ponds.

The old and new hong kong. I went to hong kong for the first time last sept,1989. I thought hong kong was a very beautiful place; we went to every tourist attraction, and it was very easy to know the streets of hong kong, ESP in tsim tsa tsui and mongkok.14 yrs later, hong kong is totally different, esp mongkok. Before, there were only streets and small food stores and night market. It was a simple life. But now there are malls, big stores along the streets, overpass for people, coffee and tea stores, and lots and lots of people. The night market is now the ladies' strip, open even at day time. In direct competition with the malls and big stores. And all are surviving because of the shoppers. Mongkok is really a big big Mecca of people.

Worth the effort finding. Hidden behind loads of buildings is this great chilled out park with loads going on. Very odd place but the highlight has to be the Aviary which you could spend a long time in relaxing and getting away from the hubub of the city.
Aviary is excellent. Visited on a rainy day so had to dodge the showers but a neat place, well looked after and the birds in the aviary seem happy

Oasis in steaming hot city.. We found this almost by accident on the way back from the peak tram ,it is situated near the terminus . Lovely cool greenery in a steaming hot city .We particularly liked the walk through water feature which reduced our temperatures by about 15 degrees .

Lovely Gardens. There is quite a bit to see in the gardens. There are lovely ponds and the tea museum is worthing going to look at. They have a fantastic gift store where you can get some traditional teapots.

Lovely park. We happened upon the park by accident as we were walking to access the Victoria Peak tramway. I would highly recommend an early morning stroll. You will see people doing Tai Chi, early morning joggers, and office workers on their way to work. If you are staying at a hotel in the Pacific Palace complex, this is easily accessible and a quick stroll to Victoria Peak Tram.

Oasis. A very pleasant change from the hustle and bustle of the city. Still quite busy. Nice to see some trees and water. I visited the botanical displays on a previous trips which are definitely worth a look. This time however we were concerned with a trip to the Registry Office!

Peace and tranquility in the heart of Hong Kong. A really lovely park. The walk through bird aviary was wonderful and delighted me and my small grand daughter. There is a very large play ground on six levels for the kids to use up some energy and it gives a great view over HK as well. Good toilet facilities. Lovely restaurant on the lake . We did not eat there. Lake had heaps of turtles to delight all.Really worth a visit especially if you are in HK for any length of time.It was quite taxing walking up all the stairs so some level of fitness needed

Pretty respite in the heart of the city. A lot of greenery, lakes, fish and birds to relax you in the heart of this dynamic city. There are many attractions contained within or you can sit by a fountain and people watch....very near the major hotels and the Tram. A nice place to relax.

Great oasis in the city. I love Hong Kong park. It has a great playground for kids (especially those 5 and under), the lovely pond with carp and turtles, and the aviary (one of the largest in Asia?) with tons of exotic birds. There's also Lok Cha teahouse which serves tea and (acceptable) vegetarian dim sum. At almost every exit there's something to do: Peak Tram at one side, Citi Tower at another exit (basement has coffee and lunch options on weekdays) and Pacific Place/Admiralty (MTR, shopping mall, hotels, Asia Society, British Council) at the other end. It's a great place to walk through on your way to or from somewhere else, and as a resident I really appreciate it!

Great place for short walk and pics. We took the HK park from our hotel to Peak Tram and enjoyed the beautiful fountains and flowers. The sight was so picturesque that we could not resist but take pictures

Very Beautiful and Relax. Livning in a stressful city with full of concrete jungles, noises and polution, parks with beautiful plants are important. HK Park is such a wonderful place to walk or take a short break, away from all the business. Government needs to build more parks as the populations are increasing significantly in the recent years. Wonderful place for locals and tourists alike.
This is a oasis so peaceful. It was amazing how peaceful it was considering the hustle and bustle and skyscrapers around it. Well worth a visit !

Oasis in the middle of Kowloon. With a range of garden settings, this is a great park to recover from the shops nearby. The aviary is impressive, although always sad to see caged birds, while the Chinese Garden had an abundance of tortoises in the lakes! Tai Chi is very popular throughout the park.. As a bird watcher, I was glad to have my binoculars, seeing many birds wild, including the resident goshawk.

Nice, tree shaded walks and a small zoo & botanical collection. The best thing about this attraction is it's free.You can duck in here after a visit to the Peak, or gawking at Central's famous buildings (Bank of China & HSBC). There are many benches to rest, and they've got a modest aviary, primate, reptile and plant collection. There's only one refreshment stand however, and it's nestled someways into the park.

A welcome break from the noise of the city. When I visited, Flagstaff House was closed and as a result I could not see the Museum of Teaware but this was not a great problem as I wandered through the park enjoying the break from the city noise. Indeed it reminded me of Central Park in New York in this respect.I had not researched this previously in great detail but my eyes lit up when I found the Edward Youde Aviary which was completed in 1992 and named after the Governor from 1982-86. This is a walk through aviary with shallow pools and waterfalls. It is not small comprising 3000 square metres and 30 metres high containing about 600 birds. The birds have become so accustomed to humans that it is possible to get quite close to them. As always in Hong Kong, the park is immaculately maintained.

An oasis amid the skyscrapers. Lovely park, very clean and well maintained. The open aviary and the tea museum are must see. And the artificial lakes are a surprise with the live terrapins, yes they are alive, look long enough and they will move on the rocks. Look hard enough and they are swimming all around, best nature park I've been too, definitely recommended.

Wonderful oasis in the middle of Hong Kong. This park has some great paths and small lakes/ponds throughout. I enjoyed just walking through it, watching the locals enjoy it, and in general, get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.It is a quiet place to walk through as you go from Pacific Place to other parts of Hong Kong island.

For the birds. This lovely park is a favorite with locals and visitors and hosts a gigantic semi enclosure which is home to many and various birds that fly free and safely where the visitor can enjoy them. Clean, safe and beautiful, the park is a very pleasant few hours outdoors.

Nice playground and Aviary. For any resident or visitor of Hong Kong, this is a nice spot to hang out for an afternoon. The kids would love the multi-level playground, the large aviary, the turtles in the pond, and the Botanical Gardens in the vicinity. The primates display in the Botanical Gardens is also a must see.

A Nice Escape. This is a nice pocket of greenery in the centre of Hong Kong. Like all parks in HK its extremely well manicured and there are paved walkways throughout so if you're hoping for a nice place to sit on the grass and have a picnic then you may have to make do with a bench. The park has the obligatory man-made waterfall and ponds which are prevalent throughout Hong Kong parks but are very nice to look at. We didn't have time to go in the Aviary or the Tea museum but the rest of the grounds were definitely worth a visit.
Tea House.... This was lovely, bit of a treat. The museum was great too, learning about tea making over the years in China.

Lovely Escape From the City within the city. I went to the park on the weekend. It is easy to get to through Admiralty Station and Pacific Place Mall. It's a lovely place to walk around, relax on a park bench, have lunch, visit the tea museum, go to aviary and conservatory or zen out in the tai chi garden or children's play area.There are some lovely waterfalls, ponds and photo opportunities too. When my aunt and uncle were visiting earlier in the year we took them to the Botanical Gardens but I think Hong Kong Park is nicer and has more to offer.

Romantic and fresh air~. Love this park. I heard this place is recomended to takes photos of prewedding. Nice view but poor me, when i go there, the pond had no water, so i cant see any turtles nor flamingos. Huhuhuhu..

a quiet place to take a break in the middle fo fast-pacing CBD. This is not a zoo but a nice park in the middle of the concrete jungle. There are a couple of restaurants in the park, all very nice and you would enjoy spending an afternoon there.
Great to be Home - Lovely Park. Fantastic oasis in the city - beautiful and well kept , highly recommended for visitors and others, the kids will love it and provides a nice oxygen lung in the city
Nice garden walk in the heart of the CBD. A nice walk through the park and gardens with a Tea Museum, kids playground, aviary and viewing tower.

A walk to remember!. We were staying in J.W.Marriot and the park is walking distance from there. It's a huge, well maintained and scenic park. It has a beautiful fountain too where one feels like sitting and relaxing.When you go there do have at lok cha...it has nice dim sums with authentic Chinese tea
A hidden gem in skyscraper central. Pleasantly surprised at this hidden oasis in downtown Hong Kong. Nice to find some "green" in amongst the concrete jungle that HKG is.
small but nice place. park was not that big but nice anyway. There should be more benches for people to rest and relax and larger place for picnic areas.
feel the contrast of park vs skyscraper. get (slightly) away from the hustle by watching the turtles, fish and birds in Hong Kong park... worth it for a quick escape and relaxation time.

Beware of the bugs. This is a wonderful park - a little oasis in the center of Hong Kong. I spent some time there before taking a Tea Appreciation class at the Lock Cha Tea House located in the park. However, make sure you wear bug spray. I got bitten to death by some tiny flying bugs. I saw them landing on me and just brushed them away (I didn't realize I was getting bitten), but a day later my arms started getting itchy, sore bumps all over them. I had a really hard time trying to sooth the itching, and it took a couple of weeks for the bumps to disappear totally

Delightful but wet. Going in March to Hong Kong is not the best time to see it at its best. We visited the lovely, if not difficult to find, Hong Kong park. Bizzarely the entrance to the park is through a shopping centre (??) as is everything you visit in HK. It did rain hard whilst there but the gardens, waterfalls (or was it rain), lakes, statues, exotic (and named) trees, landscapped areas were beautiful and can imagine when the sun finally came out, it was a wonderful place to walk through. There is a large aviary but the birds were hiding from the rain too. The tall modern buildings that formed a backdrop to the lovely park made for some striking photos.

Lovely green spot in the middle of the city. Lovely green lush gardens set in the midst of the city, a great little spot to relax away from the hustle and bustle. The park is clean and beautifully kept lots of nice little benches and spots to sit.

Magnificient Aviary. this wonderful little park conatins a magnificent avairy with a wide range of exotic birds.Elevated walkways through the avairy allow easuy viewing with great photo opportunities.The park is also an easy link to the peak tramway from the nearby hotels.Many weddings also occur in the Park with the Registry office nearby

Worth a wander!. We went here almost by accident and had a lovely few hours walking thought the park, hothouses and the aviary. Did not feel like we were in the middle of HK! Would recommend this for a change of scenery from shopping and bars!

A pleasant afternoon.... Lots of great photo opportunities from fountains to tea house museums and eventually the Peak! A great place to escape the heat of the afternoon but still enjoy some tourism vice hiding in an air-conditioned shopping mall.
Beautiful and tranquil. Welcome retreat in the hustle of the city. Completely worth a visit. Pool was closed but plenty for children to see and do.

The lung of the city. It is the most romantic park in HK, with a wedding registry there. Whilst sitauted within the CBD of Hong Kong, this park is at the edge of a secluded area, with amny trees. It also jouses a tea museum which has some demonstratoons on tea -making from time to time.

A Nice Escape. We have visited Hong Kong several times, but only went to the Park on our most recent trip. It is not a large Park, but is a good escape from the concrete jungle that is the rest of Hong Kong. The Aviary and the Lakes are particularly nice. The Aviary has over 300 birds in a large enclosed area and is facinating. The lakes are small, but have dozen of turtles that are very entertaining. Weddings are hosted in the Park on a regular basis and the Tea Museum is also part of the the Park area.To get there, it is a nice walk and just follow the signs to the Peak Tram. It is right beside the Tram behind the Hong Kong Squash club.

Relax Park. We loved the tranquility and you do not see the busy life style in hong kong. It is great to stay few hours siting and relax infront of the pond. The park itself there is many walking up & down slopes and step. It is free.

An oasis in the high rise of Hong Kong. Hong Kong is a city of contrasts and being in this very pleasant park and looking out at the skyscrapers of HK is a bit other worldly. We enjoyed the visit. It was cooler than last time we came and were better able to enjoy it. As with all HK attractions it is well maintained & spotless. Well worth a visit.

What a place to relax. Something on holiday we tend to forget about is to relax!!
The park is an excellent blend of relaxation and exercise over multiple disclipines. A great afternoon treat
Just another park. I did wonder around here for a bit, but it is basically a manicured park like any other. There is a nice pond in the middle with a number of large gold fish inside though.

tranquility in the city. Lovely grounds, and flowers, plants, venues. I beautiful retreated from the busy streets.
Stop to use your wifi in the park and skype your friends back home

A taste of serenity in a bustling city. What a great treat HK Park is - wander by the ponds and count the turtles who are posing nearby or the koi fish swimming past.HK Park houses the Marriage Registry, so you will see many folks getting their wedding photos taken as well.HK Park is a nice break from the city which is easy and convenient to visit.

It's suppose to be a nice walk in the park but it was raining that we had to cut short our visit to this p. It was suppose to be a great walk in the park but it was raining that we had to cut short our trip in this park. It is child friendly and amusing for them.
Great city park. A great place to get away from the hustle of Hong Kong. Beautiful ponds and gardens. Look for the wild parrots.

Stumbled across this by accident...beautiful. We found ourselves in the middle of the gardens on our way up to the peak tram. We sat and had our lunch there and got some amazing photos of the plants and the wildlife. Worth a stroll around and make sure you go up behind the waterfall.

So easy to miss but a great little oasis just on the fringe of the CBD. You can cut through this to get from Central to Admiralty's Pacific Place. I've lived in HK many years but still choose to take this overland detour whenever I am not in a hurry. Very quiet during office hours on weekdays. Photo ops abound.
Not bad. Took a walk around the Central area and stumbled into the park. Great area to walk, chill and relax.

Beautiful but not on the weekends!. It's a marvelous place to bring the kids or to go relax in the middle of nature during your lunch break on weekdays. On weekends tends to be a bit too crowded (especially on sundays) when most of the helpers in Hong Kong look for places like Hong Kong park to gather and enjoy each other's company.

Happy to return here. First visited 2 years ago just before Chinese Year.Enjoyed it so much then that we revisited mid March when we were nearby anyway.Although the park was less festive this time it is still a lovely place to visit and we were happy to return.Lots to see and do and definitely merits a visit. The walk through aviary is probably one of the highlights.

Beautiful park. We visited the park as part of a walking tour we planned our selves. The park is well laid out with an enormous aviary full of beautiful birds. The board walk has been build high up in the trees, so visitors are on the same leave as the birds.. The park is surrounded by some of the well known building of HK, there've lakes and fountains full of gold fish and turtles. A good place to get a way from the hustle and bustle of the island.

Oasis. This place rocks for me! Loved the tranquility which is a complete change from the norm in HK. The conservatory, and waterfall were personal highlights but the whole visit was very worthwhile. The aviary was also made more enjoyable by the variety of bird life.
one of my favourites. I didn't realise just how nice this park was until I visited it on the way to the peak tram. The walk in aviary is also worth visiting in the park.

A calm oasis. A lovely green calm oasis in Central HK. Free to enter. Plenty for children Tea rooms, ice cream vendors. Aviaries are fascinating. Lots of walking up & down steps/slopes-just the nature of HK island. A really pleasant escape from the hustle & bustle .Visited in October-signs around the park warn visitors not to venture into the shrubbery but stay on the paths due to active poisonous snakes!
Peaceful. Loved the free aviary full of tropical birds and pelicans. There is also an expansive pond with koi and turtles. Overall just lovely even with all the crowds there.
beautifal park. I walked through this park on the way to the tea museum.it has the most delightful fountains and water features you would wish to see.
Wonderful park. Beautiful park with great gardens and trees, fish ponds, museums, wonderful walk-through aviary, and a botanical conservatory. All free!

Nice park in the middle of busy Hong Kong. Stumbled into this place by accident. Had expected to have to pay a fee but surprised that it was free. Our kids enjoyed seeing all the birds and monkeys and other animals and the park was nicely shaded and not too crowded.

nice and clean. fee: FREEtime to consume:1-2hrs we've just pass by going to the peak tram.. i used their comport room and its so clean and they have all you need like tissue,hand soap hand dryer. we had fun in their botanical garden...wink wink

One of my favorite parks in the world. Really like the Hong Kong Park. Even though it is small, it has lots to offer: Museum of tea ware; Aviary; fish ponds (with both turtles and fish); bird watching; fountains....all in all...an excellent inner city park
The park is kept spotless by the many staff. Could not enjoy the quiet serenity more than at this park.

Wonderful park for all with super bird avery.. It's free, super safe and friendy, total chill and right next to major shopping malls.Like Central Park in NYC. Full of families with plenty to do. Very close to 2 metro stations. Well sign-posted. Super picture opportunities.

Pleasantly surprised!!. This was my husband's choice and I was not too thrilled with it to start off with. But I had a wonderful time and found it to be such a welcome respite from the onslaught to your senses that is HK. We really enjoyed the bird Aviary and would recommend this!

Very nice and unexpected. We stumbled across HK park just by chance and it is very nice. Plenty of places to get some nice pictures.
My only gripe was that the coffe shops and cafes all shut early so we couldnt really spend much more time there (as it was winter).
An oasis in the heart of the city. Take a break from shopping, grab a sandwich and a cup of coffee and go and chill out there. You will have fun watching people and a bit of nature!

An ordinary park. 1) It is the same as other parks in the world.
2) The best part is,it is very clean and tidy.
3) You can spend time here to enjoy the surrounding scenery.
4) The best place to take a break in the city.
Great aviary. This is a lovely park and well worth a visit. It has a large,walk through aviary with some beautiful birds. There is small museum which is interesting.

Good Morning Adventure. Start early to miss the lines. Once you get to the top, there are coffee shops and cafes for a nice breakfast. The Peak Tower opens at 10 am. Shops are bit late in opening. Great places to walk once you are at the top.

Quick getaway from the city. Located on the mountain-side above Admiralty MTR station and connected to Pacific Place shopping mall, Hong Kong Park is a great place to get away from the city temporarily in the cooler months. This is a good place to visit with kids/families. It's not built with strollers in mind, but stroller-accessible (may require some detours). As it is built on a steep hillside, expect some semi-strenuous walking or stair climbing.The park is decently-sized (although not to the same scale as New York Central Park) and contains a number of things to see: A walk-through aviary, Tea Museum, indoor conservatory and the Peak Tram. I suggest walking through east to west by starting from Admiralty MTR station, taking Exit C1, and crossing the pedestrian overpass to Pacific Place. From there take the escalators up, following the signs to Shangri-la/Hong Kong Park.You can stop by the Tea Museum quickly (there's not a whole lot to see), and stroll along the koi fish ponds while following the signs to the aviary, which I consider the feature of the park.Stop by the bird enclosures above the aviary and then head inside. The aviary lets you get up-close with the birds and you can see them swooping through the enclosure and munching on snacks placed by the caretakers (please don't feed the birds yourself!). It's a one-way trip, so take your time. Then you can either head back to Pacific Place, see the Conservatory (usually contains some cactus exhibits) or head to the Peak Tram

Tranquil spot. We went exploring and found this park by accident. It was a lovely spot and very quiet compared to the hustle and bustle around it. The park contains an aviary, pleasant gardens and water features. Well worth a visit to see a different side of Hong Kong

A pleasant break from shopping and buildings!. Well worth a stroll through this green space just up from Central. A wonderful space that allows you to escape the hectic speed of the city and relax and slow down.The aviary is especially worth a visit, free entry and wonderful walking along the raised walkway with birds flying above and below you. The enclosure is late and very well done, with feeding stations positioned close to the walkway so that visitors get great views of the colourful birds pecking at the fruit.A really pleasant way to spend a few hours and the an ideal day would be to then hop on the Peak Tram from May Road, no queues and a short trip up to the peak.

Beautiful park amongst skyscrapers. Just walking in the park takes you away from the pace of this great city. There is a small tea house called Lock Cha Tea House just at the entrance of the park beside the tea museum. Wonderful teas and tea ceremonies. They also have a great selection of vegetarian dim sum. A must of you are a tea lover or just like unique local experiences.

Good view, fun for families. Good view, fun for families. Enjoyable sights, birds, fishes & trees. There's a big playground for children. You can even see squirrels on the trees sometimes!!! And it is very convenient to go by MTR. Shopping malls are nearby.

An urban gem. A beautiful oasis of green easily accessible by MTR, and all free. The huge walk through aviary is wonderful, the grounds, fountains, fish ponds and gardens well maintained. Enjoyed the small tea museum, with its room for children's make believe tea parties.
Nice. Not bad getaway from streets even if you know you are surrounded by the city and it's traffic. Nice to have these little enclaves to rejuvenate the senses.

See the birds. We did a walking tour of Garden Road and it started at the Park. It turned out to be one of the highlights of Hongkong. Even so the tour does not do the conservetory and the bird, this turned into the highlight of the park, with a hugh net with walkways and free flying birds. Highly recommended and on the Wednesday everything was free.
Oasis of greenery.. Good to enjoy some open space,and the aviary is a must. Close to tramway and botanic gardens. Nice to sit and relax and take the weight off you aching feet!

A tranquil setting in the middle of chaos. I stumbled upon this park one day and was pleasantly surprised. It isn't huge, and you won't forget you're in the middle of a city (sky scrapers are hard to miss anywhere in HK) but the crush of humanity that exists everywhere else in HK takes a break here. There is a very cool aviary as well. One warning, I was riddled by bug bites after I left the aviary, so maybe long pants is a good idea.
A beautiful green oasis in the heart of Hong Kong Island. Wonderful park to just walk around and take a break from the busy city. Do visit the aviary, playground and one of the restaurants.
Clean. Nice place to hangout, clean, nice view, interesting place to explore. If you want to go there you could easily use MTR to the place. You should go there!
Tranquility. Lovely peaceful area in middle of this busy city. Walk through aviary. Touching memorial to medical staff who died treating SARS victims.
Great break from malls!. After strolling through malls then we ended at this park, and really love this park. Perfect spot to spend afternoon and have some coffee.

A place to sit back, relax and enjoy. If you sit down for a while and look friendly, it will not be long before someone will engage in conversation. This is just a wonderful place for people watching amongst very well maintained gardens with ponds, where if you are lucky you may even spot a kingfisher.Taking the path up the steep hill you will arrive at the huge walk-through aviary and admire the many birds free flying above and below you.There is also a restaurant at the lower entrance to the park for a good range of refreshments and you are within minutes of the escalator down to Pacific Place if you must have that Starbucks coffee!

Need down time? Then it's time for HK park.. Kudos to the most vertical city in the world for leaving an oasis in the center of the city. Make time to see the aviary - for photographers there are amazing opportunities for unique shots. The observatory tower has 105 steps up a circular staircase - 3 or 4 rapid ascents are a great conditioning set for the cross-fit aficionados. No so energetic, then sit by the lake to watch the people and enjoy the tranquility. The Tea Museum and the Conservatory offer more local colour. No charge for the experience, Hong Kong park offers balance to the pace of the city - cross Cotton tree Road and you are in the heart of the financial district. It is a 5 minute walk from the north end of the Zoological Garden. Enjoy.
Nice park. Even though not of the size of Central Park in NYC it is actually great park in a busy city. Just sit there and relax and watch locals
nice. nothing special... nice way to kill a few hours.. to be honest.. it was a little boring.. but yea.. not too bad for a free afternoon

Lovely park. Lovely park, was not planning to go, but couldn't resist the water features. The park is great for a stroll. Some cool turtles in the ponds. Also, there is an avery, i didnt get time to check it out, maybe next time.

Never seen so many brides!. We were there on New Year's Day and all the lucky couples who were getting married that day had flocked there to get their wedding pictures taken. Honestly, every other person was either a bride or a groom! I've never seen so many brides all in one place. It was so cute! The park itself is so pretty. You have some amazing views of the business district. And I love beautiful green spaces in the midst of all the concrete (although the skyscrapers in Hong Kong are works of art themselves). It was a sunny beautiful winter day. One of those memories I won't forget. You should definitely visit.

Tropical paradise inside the city!. We took a short stroll through Hong Kong Park before catching the Tram up the Peak. The park is directly opposite the tram terminal. It is nice to see a number of parks that help people escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Admission to the park is free. There is so much to see, but we just went as far as the walk in aviary. It is beautifully set up and is a good opportunity to see some of the bird life. If you want a break from the busyness of the city - go to HK Park.
Not worth a visit. Too small and plants rated as poor by my garden enthusiast husband. Steep climb from the ferry up to the gardens

Tiny park within the chaos of center of HK. A respite from the hub-bub of HK providing quiet and enough zen to relax the soul ... a smidgen. Nice small pond with koi, along with small museum for distraction

Great aviary. The highlight of the park for me was the aviary. Though not a birdwatcher, I was amazed at the tameness of the birds, which sat on fences, as intrigued by the tourists as the tourists were of the birds. The park is a pleasant little escape from the bustle of the city.
